Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. unagi &#34;burger&#34; on sushi rice buns

nTEmGYe16zTNWY02FK5SXw.text: GROSS!!! Everything was freezer burned. All of the fish was chewy and fishy. The meat was grissle and chewy... Could possibly be the worst sushi. Even the hot tea was flavorless hot water. Needs new management or new head chef. Any decent review must be about the teppan because the sushi was a massive fail!

CWD86zAJqVG9We8yhUDRYQ.text: Uh. Mediocre at best.  Fresh fish was good, and I liked the fish to rice ratio.   No half rolls.  Rolls were overly sauced or plain.   Service was so so.   Sake is cheap, $7 a carafe, so that was good.  Maybe go for their happy hours and such because its not worth that price in comparison to all the AYCE we have in town.

JQtsOuXYkW0vYNAMODVqBA.text: This place literally has it all. They have sushi, they have sushi burgers, sushi burritos, all kinds of interesting and great fusion ideas. The other half of the restaurant has teppanyaki for fancier affair. I've never tried that side, but I love the sushi side, especially for happy hour. Their HH menu has $3 beers and great food selections across $3, $5, and $7 menus. You really can't go wrong coming here!

AtZfEZxJ5B84AmhklgEMNw.text: Come here all the time for their AYCE sushi. Some times there's long wait times but it's okay. It's the most convenient since it's around the corner. Service is hit or miss. Hence why they didn't get a 5 star. But most of the time it's good. Sushi is fresh which is goo and they also have happy hour but I've never been. Maybe one day I'll come in to try their happy hour. Also they have those sushi burgers which look good and are pretty big to share if you don't eat too much. I'd recommend this spot for other yelpers.

PV7PLVkx7rjWn_ZhKhNn4A.text: Sushi was mediocre, you could only order full rolls which was a negative for me because we like trying different ones.We were probably the 3rd table in there since the super bow was going on and not one server out of maybe 5 that kept walking by asked or poured water into my empty cup that was empty for a good 30min. Service was just not the best if I'm being honest. Would I come back probably not.

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Edamame

q8wXNDYNuH11Iv-mvuWY5g.text: Came in Saturday night about 9 and it was slammed!! Got seated right away and before I got in my seat the guy was trying to get my order!! It's like man can I sit and look at the menu?! Then didn't see the server again and had to stop another female server to help us. But once we got taken care of, all was good. Sushi chefs were great, fish was fresh, great poke! We'll be back.   5-29-19 UPDATE!  My wife and I have made Jjanga our regular place for sushi. Most times 2x a week. I will start this updated review by saying I'm dropping my rate to 2 stars because of how this place has taken a turn for the worse. Service has become terrible. Quality has seemed like it's cheaper product and not at proper temps. Our salmon and tuna were almost luke warm. Most times if we order anything that's from the kitchen it never gets rung in to the point I order again just to see if I get double. Never happens. Trying to order more food is like pulling teeth now. Sad because this place used to SO GREAT!  But let me tell you why we won't be coming back...  My wife and I came in to give Jjanga 1 last shot. We were sat and greeted promptly for drinks. Server came and got our order. Got our food promptly. I'm like Sweet! Maybe it's just been a bump and Jjanga is back on their game!  And then the experience gets ruined! We were eating and all of a sudden this girl that's wearing a pink sweater type thing and black leggings, says to us, we charge for leftovers and you need to finish your sushi rice or we will charge you. I was so taken back as we were still eating our food and my wife eating her roll, that I could say was, we know.  Later, I find her standing over my shoulder pretending to ring in something in the computer(I'm in the biz and know when the POS screen is open). Very annoyed st this point, I look at her and tell her how rude it was of her to come to our table while we are literally still eating and she should probably wait to approach a table like that if they are eating. Her response, a smile!! A smile? No sorry! I didn't think anything was funny! We finished our meal, paid our tab, tipped more than 20% as we always do. As we were walking out, this same girl was at the host stand, not even a thank you, a sorry, not to mention a goodbye.  Ellen and Alex, you guys are great!! But this ruined it for us and sad to say, we won't be coming back Only reason it's a 2 star and not a 1 is because we had a soft spot for Jjanga.

0RT95gS89kyptUY1aDPCAA.text: This restaurant has very high rating.  I went tried the all you can eat.  I like the service and the service is consider excellent even the waitress was very busy and forgot I did ordered.  The way the designed the sushi is good on some but I don't like the spicy mom because it was warm and almost no fish.  I like the freshmen!  However I don't find the fish considered "fresh".  It is just a little better than buffet sushi.

mxy6ccNLc1zy1gRe2olz2g.text: This place is legit!! Sushi is so good, don't worry just order. Waitresses are very nice and helpful. Clean restaurant. Definitely my top 3 sushi places in Vegas.

d7mp5dUgKaC5tBA5D7chiQ.text: Went here for hibachi.  I had the 3 entree meal with chicken, NY steak and shrimp.  The food was excellent, the service was excellent, and the cocktails were perfect.  Definitely a place where you get great food at great prices.  I will definitely be back.  And, they have yum yum sauce.  Can't beat that!  :-)

ddVdkmYFSYgDHYE5H127tQ.text: Came here with my cousins because they wanted to try the sushi burger here. I ended up with the lunch special which is hard to beat because they give you a choice of any appetizer, a hand roll, and any special roll. Best lunch special offer I would have to say. I got the something wrong roll 69 , eel roll, and fire cracker appetizer. It was all yummy. My lunch even came with miso soup and a salad. My cousins ordered their sushi burger. They had their burger fried for the rice part which you can choose for it to be fried or not. I think if I come try the sushi burger here, I would get it unfried. It reminds me of a sushi burrito but In a burger form. Our server was nice and helped us ordered. He was friendly as well. It's a nice spot and I would recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eel roll
Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My appetizer and something wrong 69 roll

orw28OxWLDQmjZ7NXXRnfQ.text: A place you can get AYCE sushi and habachi and sushi burger? I'm pretty sure there is no place like this in town. We came here specifically for their sushi burger.  They have 4 different types of sushi burger.   Ordered the jjanga burger ( spicy tuna, spicy crab, lettuce, seaweed salad, eel sauce, spicy mayo) and kari burger ( spicy soft shell crab, spicy tuna, salmon, cucumber, and sceaming orgasm sauce).  Oh my god this is my new everything. My world. Words cannot explain the new plane of euphoria that I have reached. I'm smitten. I love you, sushi burger. The rice bun was perfectly crisped on the outside, and chewy on the inside. The filling was falling apart a little as I bit in, but I didn't care. I was in such a state of joy I barely noticed. I imagine the dining hall in heaven serves sushi burgers exclusively. They ARE that good, you guys!

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jjanga sushi burger
Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jjanga burger

zlQfNToGdXaBxyNnm307EQ.text: Haven't had sushi in a long time so my roommate and I decided to get AYCE sushi at Jjanga since it is near our house.   I usually start my AYCE sushi experiences with appetizers and move onto the rolls/nigiri. My go to appetizers are Baked Green Mussels, Shrimp Tempura, Calamari, and their Soy Chicken Wings. Not used to having chicken wings at a sushi place, but their soy wings were pretty good.  Moving onto sushi, I got a Monkey Burrito, Spider Roll, Tiger Roll, Taste My Ex-Girlfriend Roll, as well as a bunch of Nigiri. I like the rice to fish ratio here as it isn't too heavy on the rice side.   Once our sushi capacity was hit, it was time for dessert. Always room for dessert no matter what. I got the green tea ice cream and mango mochi ice cream. Mochi ice cream is comparable to everyone. The green tea ice cream only had a hint of green tea flavor and mainly tasted like cream.  The service here was great with orders coming out quick. But I felt like our server barely touched base with us compared to other places I've been to.

Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zlu8Kh09A0j7VbyICGymyA.text: This is probably my BEST AYCE sushi restaurant. Food is fresh, great portions. Sponge the chef is AMAZING and all their staff is very friendly. We go about 2-3 times a week. You must try, yuzu yellowtail, tuna karai, burning your ass, sexy time and many more

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best Sushi. Love the yuzu yellowtail. Everything is very fresh and great portions for AYCE.  We recommend to everyone!!

p_aO5Q-gx6bfuC26pWbJRg.text: Best in town. Hands down. Food & service on point always. Make sure to check out the specials board.

APEGpiHIf8TvDvFf0ZYWpg.text: Unimpressed with this sushi place. The sushi pieces were very small especially the nigiri. Overall, the food tasted bland and totally lacking the wow factor.  Save your money and go somewhere else. We spent close to $100 for pickup and were charged twice for our bill, our credit card alerted us 4 days later.  We called and left a msg, manager didn't call back. We then called again.

aGoiwpFmOia0TERvmaBgSg.text: Rating it 5 stars for the speedy and attentive service and decent food. Price is ok if not a little more expensive than the usual place.   The place is intimate and has limited seating. I'm guessing this is what allows the servers to always be checking on you and for your orders to arrive remarkably fast.   Sushi is good; sushi as sushi can be. Shout out to how they prep their unagi. Tastes really good. A roll with eel in it is a guaranteed sell.   The appetizers are decent. They have 1 order per person mackarel pike and golden scallops. To me they were ok, nothing spectacular. Order the crab balls, the korean fried chicken and their bulgogi. Those are good.  Shoutout to the lady chef managing the sushi bar. Got our orders on time and well prepared.

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

W4fIFqXpnwEBncJCu3mMFw.text: Although Jjanga isn't the owner of this location anymore the quality of the fish is still amazing. Staff if friendly and the restaurant and bathrooms are very clean. Prices are reasonable especially for AYCE sushi with a large menu. Tables are always full so there is often a short wait but they have a fully stocked bar and outdoor seating!

Vvw8rPPMTDHmNejFNruszw.text: Love this place! They have a small vegetarian sushi menu but it's all amazing and fills us up just fine. The avocado and April's rolls are amazzzzing. We also love the hibachi. They always accommodate us as vegetarians and are sure to not add any animal product like chicken stock into the rice and food. They even cook it first so that our food doesn't touch other people's meat leftovers. 100% recommend if you are looking for some good sushi and amazing service.   I work in the service industry and my favorite part about this place is the team work. Half of the time you don't know who your server is because they ALL help each other. One will take the order, another will refill the drink and a completely different person will close you out. That's probably why this place is always busy and provides amazing food and service.

9IcLzkhGwKeV15gCoArRwQ.text: Never fails. I love this place so much and Susan is my favorite waitress. I'm a bit of a sushi addict and she recognizes me as a regular and is always hooking it up with special dishes. I used to go the Decatur location but everyone had such a bad attitude. The ft apache location is much better and the employees are much nicer. Moving soon and I'm seriously going to miss this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jjanga special: the Ellen   I also had the next time, salmon skin hand roll, salmon nigiri, and some shrimp tempura

EQZl6F0LsgZDvBJMlhb4PQ.text: The food here was amazing!!!!!!! I came here based on a video I saw on Facebook.  The four of us ordered 2 sushi burgers , 2 burritos, green mussels, garlic parm edename and a miso soup.  The fried sushi burger was a little oily but was very filling and a very large portion. Will def be trying it not fried in the next 2-3 days that we're in Vegas for lol.  We've never tried garlic parm edenames. Very very interesting and good.  I love green mussels in general but the mayo on it was cooked to perfection.  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!!!

Okq5RWykDUcN67BM-EMRKQ.text: The food was mediore; the quality of meat was terrible; the service was excellent.  We went to this neighborhood place because it said sushi & steak...but it was an all you can eat place.  These places never have quality food.  The uni actually wasn't bad.  The surf & turf roll was good.  They fried the shumai!

3Wu9m87NRrGf-z1_jbYi3w.text: We have tried the sushi burger here and it's very similar to sushi burrito and bigger than I expected (lol). Rice to fish and toppings are proportionate. I had the Karai burger and my boyfriend had the unagi burger and we both liked it. Appreciated the free melona too at the end :)

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Karai w/ sushi rice bun (top) and unagi burger w/ panko crust (bottom)

0CyZFHNKofy7a8KuWGnXlg.text: OMG THE BURGER WAS OUT OF THIS WORLD.  I ordered the spicy tuna burger, it come with two huge crispy rice deep fried patties, it was out of this world, ok I just repeated myself.  The spicy tuna was perfect, the correct amount of sesame seed oil and spiced to perfection.  I bought a house in Vegas and you better believe I will be going there on a weekly basis.

5PYSWvZCBWlfHl_AwMtGxw.text: I can't review the food, however I can't imagine it can be THAT good to be worth being ignored.  Told to sign in 5 mins after we arrived and there were 9 parties ahead of us.  After 30 mins still no one acknowledged anyone waiting to let them know about how long waits would be and only 3 parties were called.  Finally spoke to a hostess/bartender who still couldn't advise of wait only to guess could be another 30 mins even after two other parties ahead of us walked out too.   Sorry to say this is no way to handle a business.  At the very least keep in communication with your parties waiting so they know you're aware of them.  Don't ignore them and then expect a glowing review.

tWZCwQF9QZ00ermovGzudQ.text: Would have been nice to have gotten my Postmates order from here. I waited over an hour for my food for me to only be told by the delivery guy that he was still waiting on my order! He had been waiting inside for 30 minutes. I called the restaurant and they said they got busy but my order was now being prepared. It was a very simple order too! Postmates cancelled my order and I never got my food. Definitely won't be ever trying this place again.

-I480Vvv5SObgHTixsxxJg.text: Came at 10:15 pm on a Saturday and was seated immediately for a table for two. Not too busy, but still at least 8-10 other parties seated.   Was excited for the sushi burger & sushi burritos I saw on Facebook videos! Came specifically for that. Ordered Jjanga Burger & Monkey Burrito, and my friend ordered the Karai Burger & uni sushi.  Jjanga Burger: Way too saucy and the regular rice bun totally fell apart. Was basically just spicy tuna, spicy mayo, and saucy seaweed salad with a ton of white rice. The seasoning on the bun was really good though!  Monkey Burrito: Preferred this over the Burger - compact and easy to hold and eat! Would've liked some more veggies or something in there, but not bad overall.  Karai Burger: One-time thing, wouldn't get it again. Would rather get a regular roll. Too much rice.   Uni sushi: 2 pieces. The best part of his meal because it was fresh and tasty.  Good service!  Would come back to try AYCE sushi. Looks like they have pretty good happy hour deals too!

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jjanga Burger &amp; Monkey Burrito

jiNIkawPoklYbWM5j7_I3g.text: My new favorite sushi spot in Summerlin.  Located just off the 215 on Fort Apache and open late for us swing shift workers with a late nite sushi craving.  They had lots and lots of rolls w tons of appetizer options and of course All You Can Eat.  Can't wait to try the Hibachi grill next.

fvLIMcDCM_M_uVwLgkE1wg.text: Love the oysters and nigiri.. Nice location and there's always very little wait time and service is fast and efficient.

mXGjCFx5AJV071MQW_JYMg.text: Glad I tried a new all you can eat sushi spot. This is probably my new fav all you can eat sushi place. Have to come back to try the sushi sandwiches which first caught my eye. Definitely happy about the decision!

qAeS_5vB5haa0ds7xA9kVg.text: Good food, large place. I recommend the Veggie Tempura Roll and the happy hour is legit.

NHDBMwp0-8D1LGNSI4hxWw.text: Second location which seems much less busy than the other, but thats a good thing. Servers are very nice, but sushi was slow to come out when there was only 2 other small groups of people in the restaurant. Nigiri is very good, very fresh. Rolls are underwhelming. Dont remember the names, but did enjoy the candy cane. Xxx and fat ass werent good. The tempura and hand rolls sounded good and wish I tried them. They could benefit from having half rolls so people can try more and not waste food.

lv7LiTdPhMFy6QMXLXH_jw.text: Review based strictly on sushi, as we did not eat at the seemingly popular teppanyaki tables.  Sushi is composed of 2 basic components: fish and rice.  If one or both is not stellar than the finished product will suffer greatly.  We tried a variety of sushi and rolls, all of which were not well executed.  The rice was falling apart at the slightest touch!  The fish was ok, nothing special.  However the oysters were exceptional!  We had those first and thought we had found a real gem, but sadly when the rest of our sushi arrived it was seriously lacking in quality preparation and execution.  I had much better luck at the other JJanga location near Chinatown.

RJ8q-Rp8R2DvUyQHWiuMEg.text: I guess we can say we were a little disappointed with our experience here. We usually go to AYCE near our house but wanted to try a new place. It wasn't very busy when I went, around 4 tables total in the restaurant. However the service was slow. Our server was so sweet and I'm sure we all have our days that we forget things but when I notice the bartender standing directly behind our table talking with her regulars or friends rather then making the drink I ordered makes this dining experience a fail. I would think that the server would take the initiative to ask the bartender to make her tables drinks.  We finished our food and I told the server to just forget the drink since she said it was still "on the way". Once our check came to the table the bartender that was talking directly behind our table had finally returned to the bar and was making her friends their bloody Mary's.... The sushi was good but not good enough to overlook the lack of service.  We ordered a couple different rolls and most of them seemed to contain the same ingredients and all were doused in eel sauce which gives me the impression that the rolls taste the same. It's nice to let the sushi and fish speak for its self. Maybe the other location is better due to being well established.  I guess we will stick with our usual spot.

PJRCZEue6Psu3sFxw4KgXw.text: Excellent food! Will come back again. Ask for Alex he gave us great service. Pink lady, crunch roll, Arizona. Roll. Garlic Tuna is on point.

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Korean Ice cream sandwich

8Xbgt9UlvKhbx7e47HsnHg.text: Joe was great at the hibachi table!  Super entertaining and funny, kids loved him! Will come back and ask for him!

AtSHdVfBHGEz5RI03-G2BQ.text: Would give 0 stars 1. Do no go if you're hungry takes a long time before you get eat order 2. Poor Quality also sushi rice falls apart as soon as you dip your nigiri in the soy sauce 3. Each order that we got as far as appetizers or the red marked ones: Uni (Super dark colored and wasn't fresh), Sweet Shrimp(no heads and also did not taste fresh nor did any of the other nigiri taste fresh salmon had no flavor whatsoever, gyoza (2pcs), oyster (1pc), shrimp temp (2 annorexic pcs) , all taking 20 mins to fry 2 pcs?!!! no rice rolls wrapped with rice paper (paper was so gooey and smothered in sauce)   I usually eat a lot but each time my order came I was more and more disappointed that I left frustrated and upset that I spent money at this place cannot believe this place has 4 stars...the best thing I had there was the wine!! Don't waste you money here....I wish I took pictures but was too busy trying to keep my kid from crying cause his California roll wasn't coming which we cancelled

i8JoFmquafqkNKwnoocdZQ.text: This is our go to sushi restaurant.  Service is always great and the food is excellent.  Do the all you can eat.. it's worth it!

GD2h6o3RAM8oA5V_tum_7A.text: Nice atmosphere.The workers are very attentive and nice. Food was awesome. I recommend trying out the Bulgogi Burrito. Would definite recommend this place to friends and family.

nIlBbvIBpzgiJsrLsWPtHg.text: Food is SUPER yummy... we sat at the sushi bar and did "all you can eat".  Everything was SO good... it was very difficult to get drink service as you needed to flag down a waitress.  It made the evening a bit awkward and frustrating.  If the waitresses would have been attentive it would have been a perfect experience  :)

0zL363t3NszjcdzvqiShXQ.text: My son brought me here for the first time today. It was a great experience the music and atmosphere were very pleasurable. The Chief was very entertaining and even told me the secret to keeping my grill at home clean as new. I will definitely recommend this place to Family and friends. My complements to the chief and staff.

7xcZCuGTnUnMBCNBecr-qg.text: First time here and the service was friendly. They had rolls for a great price.  Would definitely recommend coming back

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

44VnD1L9_RBXkeByhQBySQ.text: Best hibachi and AYCE sushi place! I will not go anywhere else!!!! We've been coming here before it was Jjanga. Blaze and Tony are both the best hibachi chefs! My kids love watching them cook and the food tastes so amazing, so tasteful and the portion size is also very generous! I never left here hungry.  I also love their AYCE selections, screaming o and poki salad is a must try. Everything is fresh here! They never failed me!

g700iOI00M3TswQ3jsZ1GA.text: I've had almost ever sushi place in Vegas. This place is by far the best. Highly recommend. And they have lunch AYCE!!

02YmyhwgxAJe9shZ0SJpfA.text: The sushi burgers were AMAZING!! Highly recommend to try their Sushi Burgers !! The place was beautiful and clean! && the servers were always checking up on how your food is !!

vv53VB_t81zwsWXT7N1D6g.text: Awesome teppanyaki experience!! Came here after a day at Wet and Wild with the family and everybody was basically ready to eat a house.  We all decided on getting the Jjanga dinner Special which included filet, lobster, chicken, and shrimp, along with a yummy savory udon soup and salad.  Everything was delicious, and the portion sizes were definitely larger than the advertised 3oz of each, because at the end of the meal everyone was stuffed.  They also have a great kids menu for teppanyaki that was priced really well, and last but not least try the Korean ice cream sandwich.  Would definitely come again, and the staff is super friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Korean ice cream sandwich

9MdMlT7oM7BDOMZQdc2F-A.text: Food excellent. Had burritos and the rest if the family has all you can eat.  The Korean ice cream was awesome.

ww5Ft4cXfL87qOL6O1w7-g.text: Food was amazing as usual, and the staff at this location was pretty attentive. Would have given 5 stars but I just had to keep asking for too much-beer glass is empty but no one asks if you want another. Then I get another beer but the empty glass stays, etc etc.  just one of those nights. Again, the staff is great about getting you something, you just have to keep asking for basic things is all.  Will definitely be back though. If you want the best sushi in Vegas, this is it. Period.

XiG9CfepkPRh2iP87nJr_w.text: Drove to Vegas from Orange County to try their sushi burger and definitely was well worth the drive for it. I got the unagi burger from the 4 variety they offer. Crispy rice bun on the first bite and the unagi filling was flavorful. Would come back here to try the other burgers!

5HfTeBO-Oy0gK4qdrGwK8g.text: We just had our first and last hibachi experience at this place . Ugh ! Never had a cook like this in my life . Puts the rice down to cook , proceeds to put all the meat out while the rice is cooking . Literally dropped a piece of raw chicken in the rice . Took him a minute to notice it , just moved it off the rice and proceeds to cook. Maybe I'm crazy but I have a feeling if any other cook dropped raw chicken on the rice he would have started over with a new batch of rice .  On to our steaks , I prefer New York , my husband prefers filet mignon . The chef mixed them up and was preparing  the NY for my husband . We told the cook , he argued for a minute , then realized he was wrong . He takes the NY off the grill and orders another filet mignon ?!? I told him It was a NY , he tells me he's giving me the filet because it's pricier ?!? I don't care about the cost ! I like NY strip . I just decide I'm not going to argue , and deal with the filet . Of course he put a nice full lemon squeeze on top before putting it on my plate ! LEMON on my steak ?!? Ugh !  My lobster tasted like it came out of a frozen bag at Walmart. Sorry but I'm not impressed ! We talked to the manager .. He did take my meal off the bill but there is no way in heck I'm going back to  eat raw chicken fried rice or lemon soaked filet mignon .  We literally paid the 62.00 for my son and husbands meals which they didn't fully eat for various reasons as well and went straight to the Burger King drive thru .

BJhAxKPhlb02xzpGfIRf7A.text: Great deal for all you can eat sushi. Best nigiri in Las Vegas. I love the new drink menu so many more options. I will continue coming to eat amazing sushi.

72chr5Al7ZaEh6Ih0N6qLQ.text: The food here is awesome!  Lots of vegan options for me.  Fairly cheap for the amount of food you can potentially get on the "all you can eat".  The servers are always polite and fast and the food comes out fairly quickly.   I'd give 5 stars but we're not usually greeted when we come in.  We've been 4 times and have only been greeted at the door once.  All of the other times we had to stand for several minutes waiting to be acknowledged.

cIMQtqhdEDy3nbIDubstKg.text: Been here just about every week. This place will not disappoint. On top of that, all you can eat?!! Fun atmosphere, amazing food, great staff.

25xmsa7iGz2xjWcZInz7cA.text: This is by far the worst service I have ever received in my entire life. I chose this location on a recommendation from a friend to impress a number of business associates from Tesla who were in town for training. Needless to say, this experience was horrific. We have continually had to ask our server for the food that we ordered because they cancelled our order on numerous occasions once we entered it. The 5 of us ended up sitting at our table without food for 30 minutes at a time trying to make small talk while we continuously waited on our food. When they did bring us our order it was half of what we ordered and they acted as if they didn't remember the rest. Maybe they are trying to save on food cost - which was a legitimate question asked by everyone in our party. The good news is, if you want alcohol they will bring that RIGHT away! Maybe because it's not "all you can eat" and has a high mark up. Overall I would never recommend this restaurant to anyone. If you do decide to try it, I wish you the best but make sure you eat somewhere else first or you may go hungry!

nR0f9FtaH86_oM5xpcIkGw.text: Having been a fan of the original location since it opened, we were stoked to hear the second location opening up closer to our house.  Still pretty new with the "Kanji" sign still up and easy to find (right next to DW Bistro). We've only had the AYCE so I don't know how the teppenyaki stacks up.   What I liked: Same menu as original location, bigger space, seems cleaner because of the brighter colors, option for teppenyaki.  What I didn't like: The teppenyaki smell you leave with on your clothes (I feel like my hair smells like teppenyaki even after I get home), they don't accept the punch card from the original location, only open for dinner.  The new location is pretty consistent with the original, same quality fish, rolls are rolled well, hot apps come out hot, etc. Seems a little fancier with all ceramic plates instead of the plastic ones at the old location. Service is the same, kind of hit or miss. Some people are really nice, some a little cold, but you can always flag someone down and get what you need. I really love their riceless rolls and the fact that they don't hound you about finishing every bit of rice on your plate. I'm not one of those people who are trying to skimp on rice so I can shove more fish in my belly - I just don't want the extra carbs (female vanity thing).   Overall, a great option if craving AYCE in Vegas. We've tried our fair share of different places and Jjanga by far has been one of the most consistent and fresh (well, as fresh as AYCE fish goes, it's no Kabuto or Soho) places. Pretty normal pricing for AYCE, but nice with riceless rolls and a decent variety of apps.

hbMtZ-CGipsnjp1mALG50w.text: First Time in vegas and we found this place because of this viral video about the Sushi Burger. Staff was attentive and the food came out quickly and tasted great!!

mrmVyTtCiN-JDYfFeE5vtw.text: Favorite local place in Vegas! Kid friendly with excellent customer service. Looking forward to our reservations tonight.

7wYCC0KPQAlGOHxqz633Fw.text: Incredible and prompt service, best sushi menu I've ever seen (everything is divided into categories making it super easy to navigate and find exactly what you're in the mood for), great customer service, and hands down the BEST all-you-can-eat sushi in Vegas. My boyfriend and I are sushi fanatics and have been all over town and Jjanga is truly the best we've ever been to. If you haven't checked it out - DO IT ASAP! Can't speak enough volumes about this place! You will not be disappointed.

Mv89Wq-3RHWRhTqCp5mgSg.text: Best sushi in town the service is great and everyone is friendly always enjoy eat here

8RO_z568J6i112TLi-gWBQ.text: Great food and very interactive with my young ones.  Good prices and specials.  The best part was seeing my youngest enjoy the show.  I highly recomend this as a place to eat even with younger children.

opBksiRhZ3B8GacVILvZ1w.text: Great food! Wonderful atmosphere!!!  Very attentive!  Called and made a reservation and was seated earlier than our reservation!  Great interaction from The Hibachi chef with my children who asked plenty of questions!  Would definitely recommend to friends.

rnxMKFushvaHuSNG8eBS3A.text: amazing food, high quality fish. and great service. the specials are great as well.  will def come back again (:

nZ_H41EFSnSHZV3C2Xdz2Q.text: My wife and I LOVE coming here with friends and family. Great food great prices great staff. Can say enough good things about this place. Our server this time was Alex and he is awesome!

fIGoWamNXFasxxeIWV5BiQ.text: The service was somewhat good but the food aren't good. Very disappointed. Especially, on the all you can eat because they didn't use quality food compare to other places which cheaper and high in quality. Its written on the menu that my sushi will have soft shell crab and spicy tuna on top, but all I found is crab sticks with a tuna on top. Yack. I don't like it and would definitely never come back again.

NdM0cvCuxR5Jp7XBJswu2g.text: So we had dinner here last night, it was mediocre at best from the moment we entered the restaurant the "host" was sitting at the bar on his cellphone after we were seated no menus were offered our waiter did not seem like he wanted to wait on us. He was cold abrasive. Though the sushi was ok and well crafted the service ruined it, at the end of the meal I went to wash my hands our server entered the restroom and placed his apron on the bathroom floor next to the toilet, I threw up in my mouth a little and walked out disgusted. We will not be returning!!!

92YkQfynuFKycCiRMEDr4g.text: It was a free ice cream so go in get the bomb as ice cream , we'll idk how good it is yet still didn't get it but I had to do this first lol

9tV3TT09jcT9QUuW536ZoQ.text: Love this place!! Good service, good sake good times. This is our go to sushi and hibachi. Modern and casual.

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice clean sushi bar

wQ2jxMCrgoEt4UT5qDpDyg.text: This is probably the best sushi restaurant ever! Love the sushi, love the rolls, love the dessert! Make sure you order the red worded dishes because they are the best! It is also very close to my house so I go there often.

QxAjfH_9ssx8oZBqkJsvzQ.text: We didn't even stay for dinner. According to online menu, there was AYCE sushi and a full dinner menu.  When we walked in, we were told that you could have sushi OR hibachi but you could not have one person in your party have sushi and one have hibachi.  Period.  Don't advertise what you don't have.  The misleading website and unaccommodating staff will keep us from ever coming back, no matter how good the other reviews are.

-j0zkmvvBA_YYq_Z9z7MTA.text: This is my go-to place for sushi! The fish here is of high grade, the staff is very friendly, and the atmosphere is wonderful. I would definitely pick Jjanga over Oyshi (another sushi restaurant) any day. I'd recommend anyone that loves sushi to go here!

yHJPNh8ty7bNY1cdUsAe9w.text: I'm SUPER disappointed to be giving two stars. I really really really wanted to love this place. To start I can only assume our waiter was brand new..... to the service industry. We had to ask him for water AFTER our food was served. Yea..... that happened. Then we ordered and the sushi is meh, at best. I kept saying to my husband "this just be an off day for them, because how do they have 4 1/2 stars and that many reviews!!!" We had to flag the waiter down 5+ times for water refills for the table(and he would still forget) it appeared he was in a rush to take his lunch break which he did right in the middle of our meal. Mind you there were only 3 tables (ours included) occupied in the entire restaurant. That in itself was super annoying. I won't be back, we will stick with sushi Koma.... at first we thought what a bummer, for the first time Yelp stared us wrong. Actually, it's our fault for it realizing the majority of the reviews are for the hibachi, which is probably outstanding.

WxcSiTOPrXmxYv4nAhEUiw.text: This place is the $#%t! Awesome!!! The freshest fish! Great people etc etc. followed this guy to his third location JJanga is the bomb!!! Love his places. Just go!

8SqNNS1GGNdhEtjn_B81NA.text: We have been coming here for several years and just love  the food and people. I always get the  Jjanga  special and for the money it can't be beat. Great hibachi chefs and sushi is always fresh!

tpE3gSMxMk_QpIyw4tcqnw.text: Hands down best in town. Love the new addition to the jjanga family . Quality is superior to other. AYCE. Ala carte drinks everything is an experience. Always leave happy from here.

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fj2IxeamNz4SOq0yDYW5EA.text: I visited Jjanga back when it was Kanji for sushi. This time we came for Hibachi on Valentine's Day. We did not make a reservation so it was a miracle a party of six was able to make it to hibachi within 30 minutes. We had an awesome hibachi chef. He was hilarious and put on an awesome show. Our food was great and there was no shortage! The house sangria is delicious and so is the house made sake sampler. We also did 2 rounds of sake bombs! I personally think it tastes better with plain cold sake but the flavored isn't too bad either. Benja is awesome and took great care of us!

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House sangria
Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sake! Sake! Bomb! Bomb!
Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House made sake sampler. Delicious!

9eN8fa78E_IAKHEvv-fu7w.text: This review pertains to everything except for Hibachi, being that we didn't have any.  In the Summerlin area, you go to Ohjah for ala carte and Sushi Koma for AYCE. My girlfriend and I, who both work in the Vegas service industry, were excited to try a new establishment. With open minds, we still knew Jjanga had some strong competition.  Jjanga exceeded all expectations in every realm of a sushi place. I never in my life had fresher sushi (all meats shipped in everyday), the ambiance is progressive, beautiful and unique, the prices are unbelievable for the quality and the service is nothing under top notch.  Jung knew Jjanga like the back of his hand. He was patient, knowledgeable, honest and more than a server, but a friend we just met that night. We will request him every time. Yet even beyond this, other servers were genuinely concerned with our well being and satisfaction.   This is the first review I've ever written in which I have nothing negative to say about am establishment, for constructive criticism of course.   Goodbye other sushi joints, thanks for the good times but we'll be at Jjanga from now on.

XY3RRm0Ep3v6U2pFDygiFQ.text: I've been going to Jjanga before it was even named that. They have the best sushi chefs who are not only friendly, but efficient. I love getting the AYCE (All you can eat) sushi because it is affordable, and delicious! I completely recommend this place to any sushi connoisseur. They only thing I would recommend is that if you do plan on coming on a weekend, they're most likely going to be packed so call ahead for reservations.

f73CSV1vg8aQvCJam9mD5g.text: It was awesome before now it's even better super nice servers and the prices are the best the food is to die for all you can eat sushi or the Hibachi both are amazing! They have a great bar or you can go for the flavored saki it's definitely a treat!

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellow tail hand roll and Philadelphia roll my fav

mONz3Z2R_Ep6f1MX-cCysA.text: Best all you can eat. Love coming here. Great food and service! Garlic tuna so fresh. Love all the no rice rolls. Deserts are so good as well.

tmioxnA56JNCVrNTEn-mkA.text: Most def one of the better AYCE sushi restaurants in town. Great food, great service! Highly recommend!!!  4 stars - overall 5 stars - for AYCE rating!

wVu3I_Q6UtzFc7KO6ngz9g.text: Cool atmosphere! One side is sushi and the other side is hibachi. We ordered AYCE sushi and everything was so good. Try the Cajun Albacore, our favorite, has a bit of a BBQ flavor!

WF0ykcaLMxJuI2MSgKXqWw.text: In Vegas for life is beautiful and first time eating here! Sushi was yummy and fried rice was good come back the next time I visit again

fu2Sc0s75dzvGLqEo89lvg.text: Great sushi/food came here and was treated great! Will definitely be coming back soon. Monkey burrito is a must & jalapeno cracker. Love the place

9XJWwAO2s1pm3UuYbDxI2g.text: One of the best sushi restaurants in vegas! Great place to eat and good customer service!

IyOc-a1zQNdM7opws8c39Q.text: Best sushi in vegas hands down. Been going here for awile and ita better than any sushi place in VegAs hands down!

oeSd5DW7iAhOpKdTopZ0LQ.text: Full disclaimer: they actually messed up a couple of things on our order, including forgetting one of our orders. Xkl-UdOIpcz2dGRXbAy_ow.text: I use to love this place until my last 3 visits. I started with there first location on Decatur. THLhEq3tGBlxeREhfAVFLw.text: Came for the sushi burgers, which were ok. The all you can eat sushi was amazing though! Definitely will be coming back next time I'm in town!

1IJV2JnNn3YoNoh91WFnBA.text: Great food for a great price, friendly staff and fresh food. A little drive off the strip but away from the noise and crowd.

YIBM9d3yZg9WPAr8PMOhXA.text: Came in for lunch to try the much-talked about Sushi Burger. I ordered the Bulgogi Burger that also has crab, avocado, cucumber, lettuce, yum yum sauce, and eel sauce. It was very very good, and I left feeling satisfied! I don't usually like bulgogi meat, but this place made it just right. I would also recommend ordering it with the regular sushi rice bun (though it does break apart a bit at the end), the mild mess was worth it. I would come back again to try the other burgers!

B1ao33E37fv4hfGJ315l9A.text: Been here many times. Tonight was horrible. So bad I'm never coming back.  Too many things to even list. And we were celebrating a birthday. Told them that and still got horrible service.

ltN5ZGAm6yyvrxYp5hIyJQ.text: Very unique place because it's a hibachi and sushi place. They have the sushi burger too which is filling wants priced well! Definitely wanna come back to try more of the sushi burgers. Their ayce menu is a good variety as well. They also have a late night happy hour menu if you get a late craving. Overall good place to get your sushi fill.

IeGGSJLz1H0A0L3jpJglTg.text: I went here for the first time on Friday night. We sat at the sushi bar and a server came to take our appetizer order. I did not want to order an appetizer and asked a couple questions about the nigiri. The person couldn't answer and sent someone else. I tried to order and they explained that I needed to order with the chef. I ordered a couple items though it was hard to get their attention. They didn't ask for my friend's order and didn't really make eye contact. Usually when I order sushi, everyone is attentive and checks back to see if anything else is needed. I felt like I placed my order three times. It was just confusing.   The Japanese Lasagna was good and not too cheesy/ filling like some I have had. I also liked the white fish / nigiri. I got a crunchy roll and that one I didn't like.   There was a woman there with two kids. The boy was running around the table with squeaky shoes and it was pretty loud and annoying. My friend asked an employee if they could say something to the woman since it went on and on. Though it was the mom's fault for allowing it, it ruined the vibe a bit. I go to restaurants like this to relax and enjoy a meal and not have kids running around. The employee did mention it and eventually the squeezing stopped.   I would go back because of the location and proximity to where I live and work but I would honestly say the place was pretty average.

e6V8jUOs_OtUOy2zb3f4BQ.text: I was frustrated because  im excited to eat here after reading the reviews but The food is very plain and ordinary, i have been to better AYCE sushi. Fish are not fresh, breaks apart easily. Sauce lacks flavor. The shrimp tempura is saggy, not crispy anymore. Miso soup has no flavor of miso in it.   You cant order half rolls which is a bummer but wise on there part  Servers take forever to get our orders. They would grab our empty plates and leave in a hurry. I expected them to come back since they took our empty plates but they never did. We have to literally wave or raise our voice to get there attention.   I wont come back.

jNIN8ocw4j5cEVg8Mr1Q-A.text: Very good and clean. They have YUZU!! They have a late night happy hour that starts at 11 and is rad. Food and service is on point and very friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bueXQmG-nH_3PwZ11TzjcQ.text: The food and service here is amazing. It is definitely a go to place to eat sushi!!! Great for dinner!

2L879A4OMy2sbM4N4U8z1A.text: Very clean and spacious restaurant. We came for the sushi burgers and they were very good. You can choose between a normal rice bun or fried panko rice bun. The normal rice bun falls apart easier and the fried one is a bit hard but gives a nice crunch to the burger, so take your pick. Overall a great experience and something worth diving to

puhYJi3g01BZ5k2xmc_pfw.text: I hate buffets, but I love Jjanga. This sushi buffet is not your typical sushi buffet joint where taste is not a premium. This place, which also offers a la carte sushi, is incredibly delicious. My husband and I are sushi snobs and this place gets a huge thumbs up from us. Don't let the buffet part fool you. Nothing about their sushi is "buffet quality". Our faves include Taste Like My ExGirlfriend, Next Time, and Screaming O. Btw, they deliver through GrubHub!!!!

Zpuun0ihLpPIZxBl1XTAeg.text: I came here and tried the habachi because I wanted to give them a second chance from my past expierence.   The food was great! It was very well priced and tasted amazing. The only issue I had was the shrimp was overcooked.   There was so much food I had leftovers. I am very glad I came back to try it.

sziY7JaBTF1hznPDOESc8A.text: This place was amazing from beginning to end! A friend recommended this place to us and it did not dissapoint! We came here for the hibachi and I got the Jjanga special. Sooooo good! Don't forget to ask for Joshua aka Blaze. He's the best.

2yDNueMCAVHrIQFtX-Ysfg.text: Fresh sushi, sauce is tasty,Great service....if someone didn't try it yet, I would recomend u to try it, not much sushi rice also

o4XG1ZujMOHsnWBfVgR0WQ.text: My girlfriend saw the online video for sushi burgers and we had to make the detour to try it. Totally worth it. Great people, super helpful with vegan options as well

87q95oKO__vzLg4Mu_-WiA.text: If you are looking for an AYCE that offers a "no rice" selection, this place is awesome. This is one of my fav sushi place. So yummy

wt7IM2tDJjP2ZtzQj4vjVw.text: Service was slow. Our server forgot about us. We had to ask another server for our dessert. Maybe they need more staff.  Food was okay we didn't get all the orders we asked for.

0wnuFMOAY-FH_jESAhi2xQ.text: This place has bomb sushi! I'm obsessed and I probably come four times a week just because it's affordable and so delicious! The touchdown, crunch roll, and jackpot special are by far my favorites! If you don't like crazy things I highly recommend trying out those rolls because they're perfect for someone who's a picky sushi eater! Try this place out!

vUV7cWDKVg1-NDHeBsAcWw.text: Nice restaurant. Decent menu and fair quality of food. Be warned...Sushi burger is NOT part of the AYCE menu and if your order it, there's no turning back (...can't convert to AYCE)!  Nigiri cuts are small, Amaebi does not come with the fried heads and service is mediocre (saw our waitress maybe three times). For this restaurant, AYCE is the best value; ordering a la carte for the small AYCE portions leaves you feeling robbed!  "Normal" nigiri cuts of fish are almost 3x the size...

CmjpNf6ImpidLPKppydUqA.text: Benihana who? Is all I should say from now on. This hibachi is way better and cheaper. The staff is very friendly, and the show is very entertaining.  Plus the sushi is on point too. Great job Jjanga.  And thank you chef Joe for the good time.

1GRLI5iX6kNuDmRQNIdKBA.text: If you like to eat sushi this is the spot to indulge.  Great menu with hundreds of different types of rolls.  All you can eat menus is a great value.  We love this place. Will be back for more.  I liked the rice less rolls.

jhM-O-a-2vasCcf-wGncRw.text: It was our first time going here... we had the naruto roll (no rice) and it was amazing, it didn't fall apart like most no rice rolls do but it had enough flavor. The playboy roll was my favorite, and coco shrimp as well. Also you must order the garlic edamame....its so delicious and maybe one of the best garlic edamame I've had. The sake was okay.... could've been better. Excited to try more stuff I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coco shrimp &amp; Playboy Roll

26A_HGS21y_F4r129BUSWg.text: My current, favorite sushi restaurant for either their Happy Hour (3pm-6pm everyday) or AYCE (Lunch $20.95 or Dinner $25.95). My boyfriend and I did a la carte our first time eating here, and the total came out to $50, so we figured eh we should just do AYCE next time since we're spending the same amount.  The interior of the restaurant is very spacious, clean, and modern. The have an area for either Sushi or Hibachi (like Benihana style). I have yet to try their Hibachi menu - however, what I really appreciate about their sushi menu is the addition of new and exclusive items. I was tired of seeing the same items at every, single sushi restaurant like the Hawaiian roll, Vegas roll, etc etc. This place actually had brand new, creative concoctions!  I HIGHLY recommend the Sponge Special Sushi Roll. It is a tempura roll with so much fresh goodness and looks like a sushi masterpiece. Their nigiri (salmon belly and white tuna) are also very high quality with a great fish-to-rice ratio. The fish practically melts in your mouth! Wow I think my mouth just watered...

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sponge Special Roll (my favorite!!)

n36fNkBX__-wDs6Z6tJDiQ.text: This place is a staple in my team's restaurant list.  We go here at least once a month and it's always the best. We haven't found anything better.  This place is seriously the best

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. That special garlic tuna good good. Compliments of the chef

i4dJw90p3mN6EN-bDj3qEQ.text: The Best sushi in Las Vegas  Everyone is friendly cordial & very polite It's always so crowded there .  The sushi is fresh & very delicious .

y5rAs2HV3GHJi7JKOG1wzw.text: This is by far the best sushi place I've been to! The service is great, the place is spacious and not as cramped as other sushi places, and the food is AMAZING.  Upon entering, we were greeted by a friendly host. As we came late at night, there was no wait. My party of two was seated at a comfortably large table, which was great because we ordered a lot! We ordered an array of appetizers, from grilled mackerel to Korean fried chicken and a bunch of others, with all of them tasting fresh and delicious! Our water cups were never empty in between food, and our waitress was kind and accommodating.  When it came to the sushi, we ordered a variety of nigiri. The yellowtail by far was the best I've ever had at any sushi place! The tuna and salmon nigiri were also great! Great quality and fresh tasting!! This place left me and my friend completely satisfied and happy. We will definitely be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All you can eat times!

4VdoIogKURXctFs3i4rckQ.text: We made the mistake of coming to Jjanga on a Friday night around peak dinner hours... Expecting to get a table right away. NOPE. There were... 3 parties in from of us... And I was with a group of HANGRY PEOPLE- way hungrier than me actually! SHOCKING I KNOW! But since I'm very proficient in getting what I want.... After a good 20 minutes of waiting (I could see the heads of those I was with BOILING WITH HUNGER RAGE) I stood in front of the host table not bitchy by any means, but I kept a stern expression on my face... And it worked because the hostess made an acceptation for us, setting up a tepinyaki (sp?) table for us sushi eaters even though the sign said this is not possible...   When we were seated, we were initially IGNORED and we thought this would be the theme for our meal but NOPE! Once our waitress came to us, our food ESSENTIALLY FLEW ONTO THE TABLE in almost no time! My husband ordered a rather intricate roll but BAM, it came out in negative two seconds! And my crispy salmon skin handrolls, those also landed on the table in record timing! The rest of the group was just as happy with the service speed because soon enough they were human enough to talk without biting anyone's head off! Ha!   The concept of ALL YOU CAN EAT here is pretty great, as long as you don't make ANY MODIFICATIONS... But my whole order was modified thanks to my food "issues" (intolerances/allergies people).... This NOTHING was counted as all you can eat, but OHHHHH WELL. My husband made up for that, and while the first 4 rolls he got were tasty, the last one made him HATE sushi - lol! He had to be "rolled" out of the restaurant, and felt VERY SICK the rest of the night, but not to the point that he had to hang out in the bathroom. This just goes to show that you should PACE YOURSELF if you do the ALL YOU CAN EAT "challenge"... Ha!   We all can see why this place gets good Yelp reviews, the food is fresh and delicious (my mom was obsessing over her uni and salmon roe) and everyone else adored their eats! Yum Yum!

Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon Skin
Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon Skin

HalwCK7MsFSr0O31PmGWTQ.text: Jjanga, I been here only twice in this location. The sushi comes out really fast and fresh. Make sure you leave room for their Korean Ice Cream Sandwich!   My drink never became empty and that's a good thing!

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YAYlZj7hRReVBvEavl6PZw.text: We always love coming here. They make us feel like family or at the very least a friend that would pick you up from the air port at 3am. The staff is super friendly and attentive. They always remember your likes and dislikes even if you don't. The staff is always quick with a smile and even faster with food. The food is great and they always seem to be trying something new.

mrE5I-cvv1DGa1W-nIdd0Q.text: This review is way long overdue. I have gotten my friend Liza R. to become a regular with me here. :D Yesterday we were at the sushi bar. The special hand rolls are the way to go! We came for AYCE lunch just so we could eat some Monkey Burritos! They are under the Special Hand Rolls section of the menu, and are easy to overlook with all the other choices on the menu. Don't overlook these!!!   We tried one of each of the special hand rolls, and the Lissa hand roll was pretty good. The Monkey Burrito is by far my favorite. I think it is a combo of the delicious soy paper and the sauce they serve on the plate. Mmmmm! It is served as two pieces, and they are the perfect serving size.  Of course I always order some yellowtail, so we had some Yuzu Yellowtail nigiri and hamachi. The Something Wrong 69 is a good roll.. very filling! There is a roll that is mostly yellowtail and it is amazing. The mussels are our favorite appetizer.  The service is sometimes hit or miss. We were only drinking water and it was not busy when we were here, so we didn't have any service issues. The sushi chef was a female, and she is very attentive and fast.   The prices for both lunch and dinner AYCE are very reasonable. You can get a lot for your money here. It has a very clubby vibe and is a bit loud...very fun and energetic!

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Screaming orgasm
Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cocain
Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Unagi with quail egg

i3ZIkIBGIzivLLL2SU0iMw.text: This is a unique sushi restaurant that has a lot of special rolls that can't be found elsewhere. The service is excellent.  However, the freshness is very inconsistent. I just ate here at 10:30 PM, and the freshness was very low.  I feel like this place has potential if they can step up the quality of ingredients and get better sushi chefs that can make tidy rolls. As it is now, despite the unique and interesting special rolls, I honestly feel it deserves 2 stars. Most rolls are sloppily made and the freshness of fish and roe just isn't acceptable.  Food 1.5/5 Service 4/5 Atmosphere 2/5 Value 2.5/5  Tobiko  Red pepper flavor, found it inedible, red pepper flavor was strange with tobiko. 0/5  Korean BBQ Roll Oversize roll with imitation crab, oshinko, bulgogi. Bulgogi was good. The imitation crab had too much mayo, and the mayo has too much vinegar. Oshinko is excellent. 2/5  Salmon Roe Not very fresh, somewhat of a fishy taste. Edible but some of the least fresh salmon roe I've had in a restaurant. 1/5  Red Rock Roll This is a unique and tasty special roll. 3.5/5  Sushi Score based on 2 visits Freshness 2/5 Special Rolls 3/5 Sushi Value 3/5 Sushi Overall 3/5

VvNtCwclYRIJRp1bWWvR_w.text: We decided to check out their late night all-you-can eat sushi. From 11pm until 2am, AYCE is $20ish. We were seated immediately and greeted by our friendly server. The menu is well organized by types of rolls (shrimp tempura, spicy, veggie, etc). We ordered some appetizers and a few rolls to start. The fish was fresh and the apps were good. The gyoza were tasty, but a little doughy. Not the best we've had. The specialty rolls were huge, stuffed with fish and the sauces were awesome. We were happy with the food, but the service really slowed down by the end of the meal. They dropped our check and it took at least 10 minutes for them to come pick it up. We will definitely return, but maybe for lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Specialty rolls- sauces were tasty. The bottom roll (veggie tempura) was so good!!!
Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Specialty rolls. Sauces were tasty!

tnb3C2yJRBW0jyTEERWKVw.text: The food was amazing! I came in to try their sushi burgers, but I decided to try their AYCE menu too. My favorite roll has to be the playboy.  Although I loved their food, the service sucked. It took forever to seat us, and the waiter barely checked up on us. He was gone for the most part during our lunch. I'm usually understanding if the place is busy, but it wasn't. There were only a few tables, and it still took him a while to get to us.

AQSsA8KVAgFkFR1Ay65AaQ.text: I love trying different sushi spots but I think I have found my favorite! They are very attentive, even their bussers would frequently ask if we would like more sushi for AYCE.  Their fish tastes very fresh and the house-made mango sake tastes amazing.  Our server Martel was phenomenal. He provided superb recommendations on delicious sake, appetizers, and rolls.  10/10 would recommend Jjanga.

vxZiccUbXJm1CWKXqpaK3A.text: The sushi burgers and the quality of the fish was really amazing. It's worth coming out here when you're in Vegas and it's only a couple minutes from the strip!

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1QSKIItlu-hOwzHDY1kbPA.text: Took the fam to sushi. There was a thirty minute wait which was understandable. We had AYCE, yeeeeee! Wild sushi party, I go crazy. The salmon was scrumptious. The green tea ice cream, warmed my heart. Not to contradict myself or anything. I would recommend Jjanga. It's worth it.

5cCGJ4GXtbew09bKJlOkSg.text: 3rd time back in a month. Great service, great food, awesome value. Never disappoints.   I haven't tried the hibachi side, but the AYCE sushi is a must-have. Fish is always fresh, flavor is amazing, sake choices are great, and there is so much to choose from on the menu!   Some personal favorites are the house peach sake, Screaming 'O', Cocaine, Calamari, Monkey burrito, Jackpot Roll, Something Wrong #69, and so much more....  Service is always great, there have a been a few mix-ups when I've gone at peak times, but nothing too crazy and always understandable. They've always done something to make it right whether it be a comped drink or whatever.  The restaurant is very cozy and inviting. Seating is comfortable and plentiful. Lighting is perfect.   I'm thinking of going back tonight :) it's been too long.

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The infamous &#34;Korean Ice Cream Sandwich&#34;. 3/4 of it anyways

C5JbVr_gEC4IzZpdUVtmOg.text: The sushi rolls are delicious and the wait staff is very attentive. However, if you choose to do the all you can eat, there are some stern rules printing right on the menu:  1. Absolutely NO Sharing between AYCE customer & A LA CARTE customer. 2. You will be charged A LA CARTE prices for LEFTOVERS including SUSHI RICE. 3. Ordering time is limited to 45 minutes for lunch & 1 hour for dinner. Dining time is not limited. 4. Parties of 6 or more will be charged a service fee of 20%. 5. AYCE cannot be used in conjunction with any promoted coupon, bonus card redemption.  It's a little off-putting. Also, the 20% added on parties of 6 or more is a service fee. Not a gratuity.

o3gYkH7IKJ9YeINC3266bQ.text: Home of the panko fried sushi burger! Naturally we had to stop in to see what the hype was all about right?! This was our first stop on our Vegas trip.   They have a all you can eat sushi menu which includes the sushi burritos. Some items are reserved for dinner only. They also serve Teppanyaki. As much as we wanted to indulge in the all you eat sushi menu we had a pool party to look forward to that day. I got their sushi burrito, which was okay. It wasn't anything special. It was basically a Cali roll in a burrito with a side of spicy mayo and eel sauce mix. BF got their panko deep fried sushi burger slider sampler. Which came with versions of their sushi burgers in a slider size. Jjanaga burger: spicy crab, spicy tuna. Karai burger: spicy tuna, spicy soft shell crab mix,salmon. And the bulgogi: thinly sliced Korean bbq beef. The fried panko breading on the rice buns really made a difference in texture. It seemed to hold up a bit better than the regular sushi burgers we've tried before. The flavor combos on each were good.   Overall really enjoyed this spot. Can't wait to come back to try the all you can eat sushi menu next time we are in town.

YgYYQIEcqOOMRiQaq-OaTA.text: A group of us met here for teppanyaki.  This was one of the best times I've had in a restaurant in a long time. Of course, in most restaurants, we wouldn't be laughing, calling to each other, have a chef toss fresh eggs with a spatula, and just plain have a lot of noisy fun.  I ordered the basic dinner with the add ons of lobster and filet. We all got soup, a salad, and then watched as our well trained, very experienced, and very funny chef did his magic cooking noodles, fried rice, doing the almost required flaming onion tower, and then cooking the proteins.  I had asked for my filet to be extra rare and that's the way it was. The meat was very tender and tasty and the lobster was very flavorful. My soda was refilled often and service was excellent.   As must be the case with teppanyaki, a chef who is a ham as well as being proficient is a must and ours was! He had a great personality, was full of life, made a lot of silly jokes, made us all laugh, and cooked things exactly as we ordered. Getting the steaks cooked the correct way was a fine accomplishment. Periodically, Jjanga would stop by and ham it up with our table. He's a fun person and a very personable guy!  While I don't do teppanyaki often, this will be the place I come the next time I want to have a dinner show with some good food.

YnguBnyTa_XwMRdM-3m2_g.text: My boyfriend and I saw a video online about the infamous sushi burger, and I did some research to locate where this restaurant was. Amazingly enough, it was in Vegas, where we had a vacation planned. We just returned home to Florida a couple weeks ago, but wow this place was AMAZING. There was a bit of a wait when we arrived but nonetheless, the burger was HUGE and so worth it. I actually found it surprising the burger was priced super cheap. We'll definitely be back when we visit Vegas next!

xwFUc8r3ZWI1MEcZ6vafuA.text: One of the top AYCE sushi houses in Vegas! I go here way too much and they know me and treat me like family! They have a full bar to go along with my yummy sushi! To make it better when I am craving meats I come here and have the hibachi! The fried rice is bomb!

irwgYVoXWCZaUziGYdUzXQ.text: This place gets all the stars! Their menu was so easy to navigate, the rolls were tasty and came out in a timely manner. But really the service was what had me raving. When I came in the servers had a really efficient system of waiting all the tables! Not once did I have that lingering "where's my server" or "where's my drink" feeling. They were ON. TOP. OF. IT.  And all with a smile at that! I wish I lived closer... then again that would probably be dangerous. P.S. the ice cream sandwich is worth it. I was super full and still wanted a second helping of that deliciousness.

dIAPzJf-Wshtrw8MkO4WCQ.text: Went in for Mother's Day at this location. Our Chef was awesome and enjoyed his time cooking and serving us, even though my grandmother in law was complaining about the fried rice and how she knew the "secret" sauce. But that's how she is and our Chef respectfully put a smile on his face and continued to keep us entertained. Waitresses and other staff were helpful and friendly and quick to serve us.  In ordered the steak and lobster and that was delicious. Will be back soon

mp6HccrfTmOZQhppUZTz-A.text: My family and I came on a Friday night and although we knew it would be extremely busy since it's a popular place, we waited 30 minutes for our next round to be served. I know it was busy, but by the time we got the food, it was the wrong order and we weren't even hungry anymore. Some fish tasted rotten and our soup was cold. Once we got the bill, I quickly paid, yet while we were waiting for our server, a cockroach started climbing up the wall beside my daughter. When we told the waiter, he simply said "okay" and grabbed the roach with a napkin like it was no big deal. By that time, we already lost our appetites and quickly left. Seeing the roach made me wonder what else could be in their kitchen crawling about.

utM8qh21v_i9pWbFZfuP2Q.text: Honestly, will never come back here again. We came for the AYCE and I have never waited so long in my life for items and some things that never even came. I waited 30 minutes for a cucumber salad. Seemed like the chefs were just hanging out and not making orders. We went on a Monday evening, it wasn't that busy to have to wait 20+ minutes every time putting in a order . Just overall experience was blah and the food was very mediocre. Don't waste your time or money.

We opted for lunch sushi, sushi burritos ( bulgogi sushi burrito) , and chicken teriyaki with fried rice for the kids! I was definitely impressed with the menu, so many different options! _r8Lqdud2KIhCjibGTdchg.text: My parents have been raving about this place for years but every time I've been in town we haven't been able to go together. Finally we made it for an early Mother's Day and have had an incredible meal. The all you can eat is an amazing deal! Fresh fish, great service, and a relaxing environment. If you want fresh sushi, with no frills and a great chill atmosphere - I highly suggest you check out Jjenga! I can't wait to visit again so we can come back here. Thanks especially to Susan for the amazing service.

BCaZMnaAHbyYt5eU91O4Rw.text: I really like their crab mix, honestly one of my top favorites if not the top in town, however their salmon and yellowtail is always rough and hard to eat. This makes me sad to say, but just need to remember to avoid their raw fish all together. It unfortunately is very low quality fish.  The restaurant's redeeming qualities are the crab mix and rice.  With so many other sushi and AYCE restaurants in the area it becomes hard to justify eating chewy tough salmon.

uzmAQe-VPi7YHwcIK31zmQ.text: i eat my fill, and then roll out of this restaurant satisfied and round as a blueberry. my loins yearn for the garlic tuna, and the FRENCH FRIES? hold the whole heck up, a sushi restaurant with great fries? let me just take a number right quick. i could also bathe in the hibachi soup, it's incredible.

GboKWQ4WQaQbQIZTiADG9A.text: Jjanga is a ONE and DONE for me. $26 a person and their sushi didn't really do much for my taste buds.  Jjanga drowns all of their rolls in sauce. It completely overpowers the actual fish and other ingredients used.   They have a surf and turf rolls. Described as "filet mignon and shrimp roll"  Sounds good right? ......it wasn't...  I had to check with the waiter and make sure it was the right roll. The "filet mignon" was paper thin and buried under sauce and crispy onions.   And for the side of chicken wings. They served them with no seasoning or sauce.   Its like they didn't even care to try and make the food appetizing.   Only roll I enjoyed was the "big easy"  As far as the service goes, I had no problem with the staff. But won't be back

yGdTIwodjq39xF31ROW9_Q.text: I am not thrilled at all. This was my 2nd time here so I have to share my observations ;) The food is mediocre the least to say. I only liked the shrimp and veggie tempura, edemami and the gyoza...noone can mess these up...so we are moving on to the rolls!This is where it gets really interesting: So I asked for a baked one and I  ordered Alaskan Roll If you frequently go to Kabuki you know what it is like...so nothing to compare to those...next is Surf and Turf...dont even think about what you always get at Oyshi...its something far fetched from it...bottom line you have to come here with a very opened mind and see what happens you might like it you might not but let me share it with you if you dont like what you get you will be charged for the rice! Im not kidding! Read the small letters on the All you can eat menu...Also we got the bill be4 my mango mochi arrived so I have no info on that either...not my cup of sushi nor place to return so I decided to give an extra star for the staff polite effort

lteSg9QR_go_mbnielbXBA.text: I've had positive AYCE experiences at the other Jjangas across town, finally popping by this one for their exclusive sushi burger menu- available lunch hours only, according to my server. Service at the bar was polite and attentive. Location is also outfitted with hibachi seating.   The Karai burger on panko bun is $11 and so enormous I couldn't fit it in my mouth without removing the top bun- and I can fit a lot of stuff in my mouth, so already I was impressed. The bun bottom bun held up well despite being overtaxed by the full load. I actually ended up setting it down and forgetting the bun altogether to eat the toppings off with chopsticks about halfway in, because I was getting full. The soft shell crab, salmon, crab, and sauces combined well and were complemented by fresh, crunchy lettuce. The portion alone is worth the price, I left more than sated.

eV0bVkX-xEPJByKGyw00hw.text: This is officially my favorite sushi restaurant! Not only is the food great, but it's consistently great!   Last night we were seated super quick & got to sit at the sushi bar. Starting with some nigiri, we ordered salmon, Cajun albacore, garlic tuna & tobiko. All tasted so good, but the garlic tuna really stood out!   After we finished our nigiri we ordered.... more nigiri! And some rolls! The rolls that really stood out were the red rock, playboy & dancing eel. All 3 of those rolls were just outstanding, we'll definitely be ordering those next time we're here!   As for some other items we ordered! The calamari was great, French Fries are a must, & the golden scallop you can never go wrong with.   Finally, service was awesome through the entire night! Staff made sure our cups overflowed & we had plates of food in front of us. They have a decent little bar too!

1ps0T2VFvKZr5VEh4BcQ7g.text: First time eating here. My mom and I did the hibachi. The food was very good and reasonably priced as well. Although the chairs weren't that comfy and when I opened up my napkin for my utensils my fork was dirty yuck lol. They did get me a clean one and the staff were very accommodating and polite.

x-ZZpqvZUGC8ZY7vaOb71g.text: This is probably one of my favorite sushi places. The have a nice bar area with great drinks, food and service. I love the vibe and smiles they bring when I am there. I love bringing my friends and family for special occasions or just to have a simple drink. Thanks Jjanga !

Afk72g6Rrbbm5flz7xZnNg.text: How can this place be 4.5 stars? I came here yesterday and the grade of sushi we had was the worst we've ever had in any place in Vegas. The Salmon was so fishy and all the pieces were all room temp. Do you guys realize you have to store your food so it stays cold. Nobody wants to eat warm sushi. The service was horrible, everything was so slow and the bus boys did not clear any of our dishes off of our table not once. By the time we ordered dessert there was 15 dishes still on the table. It just baffles me how this place was rated so high.

KIMCt1_AISThMtyHNwuouw.text: Seats are uncomfy. Like, no back support type stuff. With no seat cushion.  But I'm to the food... I start with tempura then Give me nigiri.  Like, salmon belly, Eel and cajun albacore. Maybe yellowtail.  Always cold and fresh. Order the dancing eel roll And the spider roll.  Unit and oysters Are one order per person. Same with tataki.  Attentive servers Make for a good paced dinner. A good go to choice.

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

k7zjvw10bTA2vwICDtO73A.text: We have seen this restaurant for a while and this is our first time having sushi in Jjunga. We're salmon fan and after we had whole bunch of salmon, we can say that this place is one of our all u can eat sushi bars  I'm surely that we'll come back here soon.

_qiQNbQKJBzVsjCZufJ81Q.text: The quality of the food is not bad for the price. We had a table of 8, and 3 of us were doing AYCE, while the other 5 ordered A La Carte. Two things really bothered me:   1) When we were ordering for the AYCE, 2 out of 3 of us had ordered when we were told by the server "I think this is enough for now." However, the 3rd person still wanted to add 3 more orders of sushi but the server repeated the same thing, so goes without saying, we did not get the 3 extra order. After our first round was finished he acted really surprise that we finished, when we told him from the get go that we were going to be ordering a lot, but that we will definitely finish. I get that they do not want people ordering food and wasting by not finishing. If he had said what he did during our second round of ordering, then I would understand, but during the first round? No. If we did order too much and did not finish, and he told us once, then charge us for the waste, there is no need to repeat. Needless to say, we finished everything.   2) We constantly had this one person (perhaps the manager) that was always walking by our table. Yes, I get it that you wanted to make sure that no one ordering AYCE was sharing with those that ordered A La Carte but do you have to walk by that many times? He might as well have sat down and watched us eat.   Overall, the quality of the food was good, but the service needs improvement. There's more subtle ways to go about doing what they did/say. Also asked for an extra sake cup, and napkins, numerous times before we got the things we requested. At times they put the A La Carte items on the side the 3 AYCE people were sitting. We even grouped ourselves like so to make things easier for them to serve and monitor (as they were doing) us too, but that did not work out.

gTmPNZ4CoP88kTn1C1HovQ.text: Great customer service and great sushi! All you can eat option is great with many different varieties to choose from. Sushi comes out super quick and tastes great. Highly recommend!

02r6coJXUJB93kv5ZajDzQ.text: Great place very good atmosphere, and the food is great as well you can't beat it! Definitely should come here and try it for yourself. Can't forget it has the best happy hour in town!!

V0HYPMyJD1uXslmxcqm8EA.text: My favorite sushi place in town! Susan is usually our server and that girl rocks!! Their nigiri is always fresh and they are pretty fast in bringing out all of our orders. It's definitely our friend with my group of friends!

UU_6gpCGzApA0lo9HCz8Ag.text: This place is AMAZING!!!!! The staff is friendly and the good is soooo good!!!! I recommend the "Johnny" if anyone doesn't want rice in their sushi...... The "Cajun" Special was particularly awesome and well balanced.... over all I am DEFINITELY coming back

KmzLA70JVfAOKbYj3oWiaw.text: Sushi burger was delicious  get it fried otherwise the regular rice one gets a bit messy. Parking was good because there's a parking lot with enough space. Staff was also very friendly.
