IhTIwCgdH1LNy4tJd65yCA.text: Updated Review!!!  All I have to say is this place has the best service and is a great dining experience. A must visit place. You won't be disappointed!!! A lot of fun  My mom and I use to be regulars there. Suddenly everything started to change. The service got slow, the food mediocre, and the hostess was rude. We had to walk up to the counter to pay without even receiving a check yet. When we asked the hostess to combine our cards (yes they were from the same location) she refused. My mom and I refuse to go back now!

7SCj-mj408ZafiDmucAdoQ.text: Without a doubt one of the worst dining experiences I've ever had. I've gotten better service at McDonalds. The restaurant was not full all yet everyone is SO SLOW. No one checked on me, asked if I needed anything else and then when I tell the rude incompetent server I'm ready for my check, she disappears for so long I decide to walk up front to check out. The two guys up front also completely rude and don't care about the shitty service that's going on. Whatever, wouldn't be back if this was the last place to eat on earth.

ndZ8hK5AWdqMoEZ2eCWq5w.text: Went here with my boyfriend for the first time and sat at the bar where the service was fast and delicious. I highly recommend the no rice rolls as they are filling even without the rice. If you're thinking about coming it's definitely recommended!

UwGSiBKDHUTuIEQjUGy-tw.text: I am a vegetarian and I really like places that put effort into making specialty vegetarian rolls. I got the April roll and tempura roll. The April roll was the perfect amount of spice with a good texture. Their menu is huge with lots of good options!

GDjfIs1nckSruWyVEjwbyQ.text: Great place for sushi and the service makes it extra special. Went to another restaurant and the server was rude so we left.  Friend mentioned this restaurant and we have it a try. The service was great and the AYCE sushi was worth the price and more. Fish very fresh and everything tastes very good.  Will def be coming back and the food is good but the service is why we'll be coming back for more!

qzEyqHSdSgLtQYJu9ggzRg.text: I am only grading the AYCE sushi.....3 is about right for this place, very friendly staff owner or manager on top of things, did seem a little worried we might order to much of the AYCE at first... wait staff very friendly, clean and nice atmosphere... As far as the sushi goes, nothing special very average, pieces on the small side as far as sushi to rice ratio... Just eatable nothing special & not bad, much better alternatives as far as AYCE sushi goes in the LV area...

JOokIbBkGYtfnG-QBosbaA.text: Great sushi restaurant away from the strip. Cajun albacore is top notch. The Korean ice cream sandwich isn't bad either.

-PoYsZErOSDGytWjkFD4CQ.text: My husband and I come here often...Moon, Susan and Ellen treat us like VIP's!! We are always greeted with a warm welcome and don't even have to ask for the things they know we like...Their food is incredible and their tapenaki is awesome too!!  You will not be disappointed!

K1k5H1HURO_FWkIUbJzSgg.text: I love the Avo Q roll.  Love.  This restaurant is super hip, with friendly staff.  Definitely my favorite sushi spot in Vegas.

Uq_ZDig74JPdsa9jbeRHiA.text: I had to try this sushi joint over here over the weekend, and was quite impressed...  Ive heard a lot about it so gave it a try and its definitely on our weekly stop of places to stop by at when needs a roll or 2

T-Ny7mKaysAQc6W9F_02tA.text: Interior is nicely decorated. Love the atmosphere and the modern vibe when I walked in. Staff was very friendly, and the food overall was pretty good. The Unagi burger with the regular rice bun is a must have.

I3-erGjlygIKxzNdB5kRxA.text: Great service and the Jjanga burger was very good! Good size, too! Loved the deep fried rice buns! Will def come back for the AYCE.

-hG_unbWavyPlkjpjczuwQ.text: The food here is beyond amazing, service had been great, the sushi burrito and sushi burger is amazing, definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone in the area. Also the prices here are amazing . The only thing that saddens me is I do not live in this state so I won't be back here for a while.

SoNffjUtYcbeQRG2MDIKyA.text: Great sushi place. The food is tasty and the place is clean.  Service is fast and friendly.  The food is also well priced and fresh. The hibachi is amazing.  They give a good portion and the cooks are entertaining. Great place for family dinners and birthday celebrations. Love this place!!!

DgyjztMGH9LV9TgYZQS6uA.text: Too bad there's no negative 5 star . What a disappointment ! The place closed at 10 pm tonight , our party showed up at 855 pm. To make a long story short, the last hour of service sucked, no napkins, plates or chopsticks was given . Had to get our own stuff ! The hot tea I ordered was lukewarm water that was served twice !!! And they charged me !!! So I told the waiter to remove it from the tab , then he gives me back the "corrected" tab , and the hot tea was still on the tab ! I spoke to the lady manager and all she could say was "sorry" . Well , that's that . Jjanga, you just lost a patron , that will spread the word :)

J-BmocAQ7AtIISihlkiGbQ.text: Last night was my second time at this location. First time, two weeks ago, was a pleasant experience enjoying dinner with a group of workers from our-of-state corporate office, 5 in total. We were seated right away at 6pm, and by 7:30 we were done, already paid and wrapping up when a male manager approached our table and requested us to leave since there were many people waiiting to be seated. We were all disappointed by the request, being the first time we were ever requested to do so at any restaurant, we still did nicely and politely.   Last night, we went in (7 people) for dinner and were seated in the same section as the first time, and got the same server. We all chose AYCE and barely started ordering appetizers when, again for the first time ever at an AYCE sushi place, the server said we were ordering too much. I could see her later talk to other servers who were taking quick glances at our table. Must I say that I lost appettie over their attitude? Food was good, but not enough to take rude comments from servers and being looked upon as hungry gluttonous people. There are other AYCE sushi places in Las Vegas who will welcome a party of 7 who will pay as much as we did, with a generous tip,  considering that we ordered items from a-la-carte as well, and who will not give you rude comments.

XbRmo-dhV98H3vWV_suJ0A.text: The food here was really good, and affordable. I ordered the Unagi burger, which was a fun and new experience. It was pretty big for its price. I don't know any other place that sells sushi burgers. The servers were friendly and helpful. I would definitely come here again

xPWaKDzAUrwGgxBzQZES8Q.text: Jazz is a very entertaining cook! Had such a great time with her. Can't wait to come back and enjoy another meal.

oLY-RRpJx0dSBfTHG0RGLg.text: Amazing place!! Great service! Will be coming back again soon! My favorite sushi place! Make sure you get the Korean ice cream sandwich. Great prices for a la carte and for all you can eat!

-z35LXHRx91rATTg95DRvw.text: Came down to try this place After passing it by many of times (we live right up the street). I cannot believe how fantastic this place is. The food is great! From the sushi, the apps, the dessert! All fantastic! The service was great. We normally frequent other AYCE spots but I think we may be coming here more often!

_sJddfHEhEfz4uPpTGjg_g.text: Always go here for AYCE sushi. It's one of our favorites in this area and the servers are all nice and attentive. We've never had to wait very long for a table either.   We like the options their entire menu offers compared to other sushi places in the area because they have a wide variety of appetizers and skewers and non-fish options for those who don't eat sushi that much. I also like how their menu is laid out by grouping their specials, spicy rolls, deep fried rolls, baked rolls, etc.  Only reason I didn't give a 5 star is because I wish they allowed half roll orders so you could try more rolls during your visit without having to stuff your face.  I think they also just started doing their late night happy hour like their Decatur location which is $20.95 AYCE Mon-Sat from 11pm-2am.  Also don't forget to get a stamp card!! But you can only redeem your free AYCE if you come in with your card fully stamped - you can't redeem your free AYCE the same visit as when you reach it.

ZzlfRZyLI2-SU0JZV565ug.text: This place is overrated. We went all the way from LA to try it because it has 4 and half stars, but overall we were all disappointed.   1. The place doesn't look that clean, or it could be it's kinda old.   2. The food isn't that fresh. If you care a lot about the sushi quality, this isn't the place.   3. We ordered a rainbow roll,  it has no shrimp on the top, and no avocado.   They have really interesting names tho for the sushi, and the price is okay, that's why I'm giving 3 stars. If just the food, probably only 2 stars.

pmamjJLDnHWg4B4XHePs1A.text: First time there was great. Very cozy and social atmosphere. The service was great. Every waiter and waitress makes every table their business so there's never wait when you want something. The sushi selection was awesome. We are definitely coming back. The only thing I was not impressed with was their sangria. Meh. But the waiter did tell me it wasn't popular.

B6M9wzoHcShCpx5rouSkfQ.text: Wonderful service all servers will make sure you are okay and help you despite the place being full! The food was amazing and the sushi burgers are MUCH bigger than you think! The crispy buns are so delicious please give it a try! The classic rolls are cheap yet AMAZING! I adore this place and I'm completely satisfied thank you!

Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

u4JcnwaMwPcYI3GkKkkdyw.text: It's all-you-can-eat sushi. What's not to love? They have a huge menu of appetizers, sushi, and specialty rolls to choose from. There's enough on the menu that after two visits, I still haven't tried all the rolls I'd like. It's best to go with a friend so you can share and sample a bunch of different rolls. So far, the yellow yellow roll and sexy time roll are favorites.   It is all-you-can-eat so if you're a sushi snob, it's probably not gonna be your thing. But if you just want some yummy sushi for lunch or happy hour or whenever, it's great.   My only complaint is that I cannot be trusted at any all-you-can-eat establishment. I always eat more than I can handle. Both times I've been here I ate myself into a food coma.

yZs4e4-JRsYcKeEIeMupcw.text: My go-to sushi spot ! Good quality sushi and great taste !  The restaurant is clean and the service is good and they also have hibachi tables for steak dinners !

rW8r2Y4AikwSFrhUOk4mdw.text: While in Vegas AYCE is a must! This place was our first visit and its been well enjoyed. The staff was friendly and attentive. All rolls and appetizers were great, ezcdpt the chicken teriyaki roll it did lack some flavor. We will bw back! Wait on a Friday night was about 20 minutes - average wait time.  Price is just right and they have a great variety of sushi and non sushi items

GybKaZHqzwoH-Lk47HFWSA.text: i'd give it zero stars if i could. the staff at night on 12/03 were just awful. no one took our order for 30 mins, we didn't get to order as much as we wanted for the ACYE because they were taking so long. Heard the sushi chefs make smart remarks about wanting to go home however we had arrived an hour and a half prior to closing, maybe if they took our order sooner we would have left sooner too. the nigiri was disgusting, the tuna was too thick and there was just way too much rice. the rice was disgusting, it tasted funny from the jump. not to mention nearly everything we ordered just tasted a bit off? anyway, avoid this place.

sD6abD1CjbFUCJDW-x_2aA.text: Jjanga sushi burger was good. I recommend it. The sauce was great. Atmosphere was nice. Servers were great!

eInONJycr4vKEeBrVJsnTg.text: We ordered the Sea Lover lunch special. It was amazing! The volcano shrimp alone is enough to make me want to come back. Everything else is just a bonus. The salmon hand roll was delicious, and the skin was perfect. The sashimi was really good!   The ambiance is nice and warm. I'm definitely a fan of the music playlist here.

krKg1CRowAesDtC_6ljIMA.text: This review is based on my to go order. I'm not huge on sushi rolls, but that's usually my go to at places like this for to go. I ordered the sexy time roll. It was crispy rice with spicy tuna and jalapenos on top. I recently became a fan of this because Sushi Roku does the best version of this that I have ever seen. It was decent, but the spicy tuna just kept falling apart and crumbling away. It was very difficult to eat. Next, I got Stacy's mom roll. That one was very good.. satisfied my sweet tooth for something more on the rich side. Lastly, I got the Joe's special roll. It was shrimp tempura and cucumber inside, and tuna and avocado on top with spicy ponzu . I really liked this roll, however the shrimp inside was stale and hard. It tasted like a shrimp that had been fried but unused for at least a couple hours. Overall, it did satisfy my craving and I will be back. My only suggestion is that maybe they can do newly fresh fried shrimp on to go orders ... seeing as how you are paying 3x the price for to go instead of patronizing the all you can eat option .

a95NWyR77CV3w_Immx2mbA.text: Sushi burgers were great! Too full to try other things on the menu, but everything sounded great too. The place was clean and all the servers we had were helpful and friendly.

WFaX2ADti96YKDm17KoIsw.text: Jjanga is a great choice for sushi in Southwest Las Vegas. They have fresh fish and good selection for nigiri and sushi rolls, and an expansive menu if you feel like opting for steak or a sushi burrito instead!  As a sushi lover it has become my go-to place twice a month, as it is not overpriced and very consistent in quality. I cannot help but order the artfully crafted cucumber wrapped roll with a side of their ginger mayo  Solid 4- almost 5 stars, hands down.

sYbushl8Vw6dGNxn956Q5A.text: I visited just this Jjanga location during my trip.  BUT I visited twice... Consecutive lunches.  I wanted to give 5 stars so bad because their fish is fresh, their fish:rice ratio is nearly perfect, the location seemed clean, and the variety for the lunch menu was awesome!!  The heavy use of sauce and cream cheese just kept me from clicking that last star.  Many of the baked and deep fried rolls have cream cheese.  I'm pretty sure you could ask them to skip it, but I thought I'd give the menu, as it is, a fair shake.  There are some fresh rolls that are killer, I had the Washington, the Double D, TNT, Johnny, and a dozen nigiri orders (all of which were perfect).  The Double D is my favorite so far, but I haven't tried their rainbow roll, which is by far my favorite.  All that raw fish.  And even if you don't like raw fish, but you somehow end up at about sushi place, they do veggie and cooked rolls.  I'll be coming back here whenever I'm in town.    Thank you for satisfying my need for fresh sushi, Jjanga!

Y8-qijw4qhDdsqL05D_3NA.text: Heard this place was good so I went to check it out with friends. Food was pretty decent but our server that we started with is what brought the whole experience down. Her name was JJ and heard she was training but you can't train someone with an attitude from the start and playing it off fake later. We had a dish sent back and that's what's set off the whole experience cause when another server took the dish back and reported to our main server she had an expression of a dirty look. So I requested another server to help us since JJ was not very attentive and her presence disgusted me. Her appearance was not very professional with hoop earrings and piercing on her face as well. What an unfortunate first time.

r4iAiiGn7sJUeCFrAIvhpA.text: The most amazing food and service. Taste, service, friendliness all very consistent!! I have trouble each time I go as to whether I am going to do all you can eat sushi or the hibachi grill. Everything is always fresh. Owner, Managers, Wait staff, Bussers, Hibachi Chefs, are always happy and they all help each other out, we/I never want for anything, they are right on top of it! Their prices are very reasonable, especially for the amount of food you get! I like that they are open past midnight and nobody seems perturbed or like it is a problem to serve you at 100am!!! I just love love love this place! It's a must go if you live in the area or just visiting!!!

STJUpsqAvKlqU_fKsZIcRQ.text: This place is the amazing! The price and the quality of food is tremendous. They have so many different choices of sushi to choose from, one more delicious than the next. Their ingredients are fresh and everything tastes incredible. The vegetable and shrimp for here is easily one of the best I've had. All other sushi rolls are incredible, With many choices spanning from spicy to non spicy choices, sushi featuring  shrimp tempura, sushi without rice, vegetarian options, and one can easily ask for any sauce on the side.  They also have baked options of sushi that come in many combinations. They have many items on the menu having nothing so do with sushi which opens the menu up to pretty much everyone.  Along with this, they offer dessert, an impressive array of Sake, and the service is very friendly.  They do have Teppanyaki tables and they have a bar.  Dinner, all you can eat, is $24.95, while lunch all you can eat is about $20.95.  I have come here 5 times already, and each time is really good!  Highly recommended!

l7V4lA-n2_hi87DkhH-gyg.text: Love this place, great service every time we come here, including all the extra sauces. Heather took great care of us & kept checking on us after each round. Fantastic food & beer every time!!

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sfqq3KIkoPzpXI5t7Nm7mw.text: Not much to say- wasn't bad, but wasn't exceptional either.  Service was pretty good, rolls were ok but they had very little diversity of fish ingredients. Seating was like most every other sushi shop with AYCE-

yU_G_yyhsifpjEUjhkIlhg.text: I came here early on when they first opened, and contrary to the rave reviews, I did not have a great time. We opted for the AYCE sushi.   The rice that they use for their nigiri sushi was not seasoned. It was just plain white rice with no flavoring. I was a bit shocked. Also, the quality of the fish were not that great compared to my other go-to AYCE sushi place. I didn't get too many rolls, maybe one at most, since I'd rather eat the nigiri's. I'm not a huge roll fan, so if the rolls here are amazing, maybe this place is legit than I realize.   I appreciate their wide selection of other food items they offer; however, all the other items were mediocre at best. The crab ball was the only thing that I liked, and probably ordered multiple times.   There's a clubby, fun vibe here, that some may really like. Perhaps I was too sober to enjoy the food.

Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5AjsHNO-tEQ5fSLFfnMoKg.text: For awhile I was going to the location on Decatur because I use to work in the area. This location recently opened just a few min down the street from where I live.  No restaurant is perfect every visit in service, quality, price etc AND there is no perfect all you can eat sushi restaurant anywhere (each one has it's good and bad) but this place definitely has earned all 5 stars.    Service so far is consistent and VERY friendly, price for all you can eat is the same as everyone else, their ala carte prices are FANTASTIC $3 for all their basic sushi rolls and they are the same size and quality as anywhere else. Their tepenyaki prices are probably the best in town. The portions and quality are far better then some other places too.  Geisha House used to be great and they have gone way down hill over the last 2-3 years.  The tepenyaki show to me is average I think that's because I've seen it so many times over the years from so many different places that it doesn't really thrill me anymore (especially since tepenyaki has become more mainstream as well). With that in mind, I'm also ok with the show being average as long as the price, portion and quality of food is there and it DEFINITELY is.  Also their sauces are NOT the typical 3 sauces you find at other places. Theirs is SO much better!    I've read that a few people gave them low stars because something was forgotten. Trust me it's not intentional and everyone here is eager to please.  From everything I've seen on all my visits now  (I've already been there at least 6 times since they recently opened) and every visit has been great and I continue to recommend this place and have brought my family there as well and we RAVED about it for 2 days!!! They will DEFINITELY fix the situation for you. I am led to believe it was a customer problem.   Quality of their food (sushi or tepenyaki) is excellent.    Again, no sushi/tepenyaki restaurant in this city is perfect but they do a fantastic job in all categories and you are definitely missing out if you don't go here!!

AJXGpMxouSviZHGgmeDrPw.text: Jjanga is our favorite sushi place. The sushi is not only excellent but the experience, customer service, and employees make this place shine. Sushi chef Sponge have served us on our most recent visits, making rolls that alway exceed our expectations. We have tried the Vampire, Taste like my ex girlfriend, chu chu riceless roll, spicy tuna (only $3!!!!!), and a few others. Their menu prices have now changed and Jjanga is now more affordable than ever!! The place is alway clean and friendly, bright yet personal, we always have such a wonderful experience with the staff. Ellen is so fun, I feel like the staff at Jjanga are family. We were coming often even before the prices changed, now Jjanga is easily affordable a several times a week! $21 for three HEAPING rolls? #sold. Don't walk, run. You won't regret it.

VqEyJjr5Zm12wKc3qWXN_w.text: Me and my guy were in the mood for sushi. We have a usual spot we go to for late night all you can eat but were getting a little bored with it and the service is starting to slip. A friend recommended that we try Jjanga out. She said their menu is unique and their fish quality is outstanding. She was absolutely on point. First off the staff is awesome. Our server was kind and gave us first timers some great recommendations. The sushi chef even prepared something off menu for us. It was a refreshing gesture you're rarely graced with. Second, the food is great. They have a HUGE variety of rolls with off the wall names. Our favorites tonight were "tastes like my x girlfriend" and "the cowboy". I've eaten sushi all over vegas and have yet to come across anything like this. We will be back and I recommend you stop in as well.

Dg6U5vktUeNm_AAxIsZjSA.text: Went in this afternoon for AYCE. My main man Nate the manager took care of us and is a big reason we are regulars. Next AYCE is on the house!

5yg8ZxNXGzYOKUmbZRUZhw.text: $26 for an AYCE sushi isn't a bad deal, especailly at Jjanga, where the food is way above average for an AYCE, ambiance is upscale (again way above your typical sushi joints), and number of dishes available are way way above average.  This place is a bona fide gem, a place we plan on coming back to frequently.  Let me get the couple of minor negatives out of the way.  First, the service was not bad by any means, but not necessarily great.  Maybe it's on purpose to slow down the ordering, but the attentiveness wasn't exactly proactive.  We had to flag down the wait staff to get our orders in past the initial order, and the table next to us actually left complaining they were not getting any attention.  Once that happened, however, the service picked up.  So it may have been an anomaly, but as it was, it gets a passing grade but not exactly an A.  Second, the fish portion of the nigiri were smallish, although I liked that the entire nigiri was modest in size as well.  I hate when the nigiri pieces are so monstrous that you need to take two bites to eat a piece.  The positives are numerous: 1) Quality of the fish were comparable to what you would find at very good sushi joints.  Not on par with the top-of-the-line, but it's also not $90 pp either. 2) The quality of the menu is outstanding.  They have dishes you just don't find at AYCE, such as amaebi, uni, oysters, several sashimi dishes, and about 10,000 roll dishes.  Note that for some of these high-end dishes, it's one order per person max each.  Still, get one of each and you'll be more than full.  And then you still have unlimited orders of some of my faves, saba, ikura, albacore, hamachi, etc.  Also has couple dozens of appetizers, desserts, and several choices of soups.   3) Great, upscale decor and lively atmosphere, topped off with k-pop music.  TVs all over the place so it's also good for game days.  Seating could use some improvement, I don't like those stools... 4) We didn't partake, but the hibachi is a good complement. 5) Some of those servers were cute!  All-in-all this is a can't miss, high-bargain restaurant that doesn't make you feel cheap for seeking an AYCE.  I rate the food 4.5, atmosphere 4.5, and service 3.5 for a solid 4.5 stars.  I'll round down, hoping their service matures enough for a full 5 star rating next time around.  Table-for-1 Factor:  They have sushi bar with at least a dozen seats, and I can see myself noshing on my own despite the festive atmosphere that may suggest otherwise.

PZvd-myTiOfzxw6j5AnzjA.text: This review is for the sushi portion only. We haven't tried the Hibachi yet, but plan to.  There's a lot of sushi places and the all you can eat sushi places are more common now than ever. That being said, very few get it right. There are some that score highly with certain aspects e.g. atmosphere, food quality, service, etc. but hardly ever do any of these types of places get everything right. Well.. this one does.  Walking in, you'll soon realize how big this place is. It's big enough to have both a hibachi area with multiple tables and a designated sushi area complete with a full sushi bar. Ambiance is nice and modern but still with some of that traditional flavor. I especially liked that the walls had large stylized posters of their hibachi and sushi chefs. One of them was even wearing a captain america mask with a train whistle -- his name was "choo choo." I could already tell i'd like this place.  We were greeted by a man named Nate who made sure throughout the entire time we were there that we were enjoying ourselves and being taken care of. After he sat us, he'd stop by multiple times to ask if everything was okay, give us suggestions, and even drink with us. The thing is, he wasn't even our server. To be taken care of to that extent by someone who wasn't even your server is pretty awesome. On that note, our server, Antonio, was also excellent. He had a really bright personality and was extremely helpful with recommendations, having conversations with us, the whole experience. He was really funny and also gave his all to make sure we were having a good time and that we were enjoying the food. I never had to flag him down or ask for refills or anything. We were sitting at the sushi bar which limited our interaction with the server, but he was great. Nate and Antonio are awesome and I hope to see the both of them again whenever I come back (which will be often).   Okay, now on to the meat of the review. To put it bluntly, the food is very good. We tried a bunch of the nigiri, rolls, appetizers, and drinks. I'm big on nigiri and can't say I had anything I didn't like here. My personal favorites were the garlic tuna and yuzu yellowtail. Not only does the food here taste good, but the presentation is also excellent. Rolls were also really good. I liked the Joe's Special and Fresh men which had no rice. Some of the names of the things are crazy like "something wrong #69" and my personal favorite "burning your ass." Although we sat at sushi bar, we didn't catch the sushi chef's name but she was very attentive and quick. You can tell this place is serious about good food, but also has a sense of humor which shows in the menu and in the service. Nate made us some shots that we had never hear of or had before and all of them were really good. We had green tea shot, gummy bear shot, and a green sour one that I think only Nate knows how to make. Everyone liked all of them and we are definitely coming back for more.  Overall, I have to rate this place 5 stars. I honestly can't think of a single complaint or issue. We all likes the atmosphere, service, food, and really enjoyed ourselves. If you like AYCE sushi and want to have a good time, this is the place to go. We haven't tried the hibachi side yet, but we definitely want to. Since it's JJANGA, i'm sure it's going to be awesome.

JcRi6GyhF6V81OHC-6B4xw.text: I'm in town every 6 weeks for work and it's become a tradition to visit this sushi place every Saturday after we are done for the week! Staff is friendly, service is pretty quick, and the sushi is fresh! Definitely my latest favorite spot :)

fXFf86ErRXTMq3ZMZ-BecQ.text: I'm a die-hard sushi lover and this place is second to none!!!!! Chef koo koo is the epitome of professionalism and fun!! Always an amazing experience here!!!!

CUUXkyXVjAZODhgxEpG4WA.text: Came with a party of 10 and the servers were on top of it! The Fat Ass roll was my favorite fried roll. Great prices too.

GVaYVA9f8a7nAGnQN5apww.text: When it comes to sushi, we always go to our usual but we wanted to try something different and so we decided to try this place.  BIG MISTAKE! I should have read the bad reviews and paid attention to them rather than allowing the other reviews persuade me into eating here. Poor sushi quality, salty appetizers, and poor customer service! I don't understand what all the hype is about?  When we went, the place rarely had customers in it unlike our usual sushi place, where it's always packed because of the quality of food and service.  Were the reviews all made by their employees? The price is the same as our favorite AYCE sushi restaurant BUT we are definitely NOT coming back to this place.

os4z6wRU0D_wkHvR8LJ7Xg.text: Great service! Always get fresh cut fish and the choo choo special is ammazee balls. This location is definitely my favorite.

HbKsYzVsXVZ7bqncf5ZbaA.text: I have a stamped card buy 10 get 1 free. I have 7 stamps in the card, 3 more I'll get a free one.  We have 4 people, but they don't let me pay for 3 and have the 4th person for free.  Also the manage there is not nice at all.

iLbwa_YnCRYquHXu-l3hNw.text: I love coming here! This place never disappoints! The sushi and staff are always on point!!!

0cLKumzOXnsgV2YPWDdQ9Q.text: Upon getting seated, which takes about 1 minute even if theyre busy, the server came to the table right away to ask us what we wanted to drink. We were here after 11pm which is their happy hour. The all you can eat price is LUNCH price, but the red items are not available unless you want to pay non-happy hour pricing (regular dinner price). The server explained this very clearly which I love! The service here is AMAZING!!!! The servers are so fast and efficient. Ellen and Moon are awesome! Customer service is on point. When we ordered our first batch of nigiris and rolls, they came out SO QUICKLY, I was so impressed. I have been to so many other sushi places and they're not as quick as Jjanga sushi. I love this fish here. SO FRESH and delicious. For rolls, try the double D roll and burning your ass roll. Yummmm!!!! For the nigiri, I LOVE THE Garlic tuna, YUZU yellowtail (please also order yuzu yellowtail sauce on the side), salmon, superwhite tuna, albacore. Yummy!

U7wHwHrkmpO4dLwKK8RvTw.text: Been going here once a week for a year and I'm giving a 5 start reveiw. Great wait staff and food. Highly recommended

AHAcyti6fOSj-oThKJhhXA.text: Went here with my boyfriend and some friends for my first time. I had heard lots of good things before trying it, so I was excited. I tried a variety of rolls and nigiri. Their fish is what you call quality and it was all fresh which is always a plus. The cuts of nigiri were the perfect size and the ratio between the fish and rice was on point. I feel like some sushi spots tend to put too much rice. I loved that they had a no rice roll section. Try the spring mountain and the tuna naruto roll. Super bomb! The staff was super friendly and they came by with chef's specials and samples of drinks. I wanted to give them five stars because everything tasted amazing and everyone was so nice, but I think the staff was also slightly overwhelmed that night. I was with five other people and we noticed that from our first order, we had three rolls missing and a few orders of nigiri missing. So I had ordered my missing rolls and nigiri again and just figured they were really busy. I eventually got my nigiri and still wasn't brought a roll that was missing the first time around. My friend asked the waitress about it so it came out soon after. Throughout dinner my friends had experienced the same thing with some of the items they ordered which was a little frustrating since they had the time to make us samples, but didn't accurately deliver our order.. Other than that, I enjoyed the food and would definitely come again. The service could do some improving but other than that, I can't complain.

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Golden scallop. You can order one per person so enjoy it while it lasts!
Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic tuna, super white, yuzu hamachi, sweet shrimp, smoked salmon, cajun albacore, and a spring mountain roll mmmmmm

VHL_OmBH0MUUoSvCLbeTeQ.text: Have been going to jjanga for over two years and I'm so excited they opened a new location that is close to my house. I take friends and family here anytime they come to town. Try the grapefruit sake, it's very tasty. Love the atmosphere of both locations.

gG6hw_e8Gv3LgwldfHnZjQ.text: Love this place for all you an eat! Lots of no rice selections for the carb conscious. Fish is always fresh and their server/hostess always remembers me and my friends.

hukCGL7NNeZLKbKBKsdDvQ.text: We eat here about once a week, it's the best in town, and I've tried most of them! Ask for a choo choo roll, it's not on the menu you won't be dissapointed!

srzldP4fWu9iSbGwnRFPPQ.text: Jjanga is one of my favorite sushi spots in Vegas. The customer service is always on point and their fish is always fresh. I love taking friends and family here to enjoy the place with me.

ChZGIhhuE3_R0mRXBZ_Sxw.text: I got AYCE dinner and the service sucked! I had to wait forever to get anything and when the food did come out it looked like it was thrown together. I ended up getting full on garlic edamame (which was good) NOTHING SEEMED FRESH! I will never go there for dinner again $26 wasted!

Hk3eRhSDCkbcMMOSSQXCeQ.text: This is our first time here. I was weary after reading some of the recent reviews. But, it was busy and the staff was on it. I loved that I asked for favorites and was pleased with them. Surf and Turf roll was amazing.

o8vs08-zaw8gwlOj8QKaBw.text: This place was horrible, service was sucky they didn't give a shit about the customers and they weren't even that busy half of the restaurant was empty. The nori was chewy and stale, the spicy tuna was gritty just overall worst sushi I've ever had in my life.

gtm-c20OPUJQYUyLm012Hw.text: I went to this restaurant because I saw the sushi tower on their Instagram. I bookmarked the place so I would not forget to stop in when I visited LV someday. The sushi tower came out exactly as it looks in the pics and it was delicious. We also ate at the hibachi table, 4ppl fri night 5:30. Everything was really good, place was clean and attractive. Make a reservation.

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KYSicQ6y2iH3XDjYdrerqw.text: I mean how can you go wrong with an all you can eat sushi that also has a teppan grill?   The ambiance is relaxed and inviting. Located in south summerlin area, and open late. Check check check. The all you can eat menu is fabulous and includes some really cool things to try like sushi burritos and a ton of veggie rolls.   I was feeling like a purist the night that I went (due to a self induced hangover from hell) and got just some miso soup, a kappa maki and some yellow tail and salmon sushi. Ha! My dinner companion however, ordered a ton of the really cool rolls and I was able to have some bites.    The staff was friendly and fairly quick to bring our selections out. All in all I'd come back any time, especially if I lived in summerlin and didn't want to venture too far out of the west side bubble.

W5scbD12oDQngelCX0DUCA.text: Co-worker suggested we have lunch here. It was a great suggestion. I was ready to return before I left. Food was great. Atmosphere upbeat with good music . My suggested Check it out !

E7o0oOb-ouf7evpcYJ1naA.text: Since Jjanga sold the chain of restaurants he had, the service and quality had gone down hill. I use to drive from Centennial Hills just to go there when there are plenty of other sushi restaurants who have almost the same menu offerings.   The rice to fish ratio is twice what it use to be. Rice is cheaper than good quality fish. The new ownership is more concerned with the bottom line than good, quality food and service. The last time I was there, one person got sick after eating the sweet shrimp.   We had ordered drinks from the bar and we had to ask the server why our drinks hadn't been served. She quickly told a gentleman, who was more of a manager than server, comes over with our drink order. Now, if you want soda, that come quickly. But if you want sake, you're going to wait.   As much as I use to love it when Jjanga was there, I won't be going back again. As much as I'll miss the grapefruit sake, the food doesn't justify the repeat business.

6L4b4AZPgsFuFPnO4bLD8A.text: This is the best sushi I've ever had in my life! Awesome!  I recommend to everybody to try at least once in life! Amazing!

58Wk36VQyxWBi1muWucPmA.text: Honestly, I did not like their new sushi burger rice bun. Everything in it was superb except for the crunchy fried battered rice bun. I admit it held everything in together but I don't recommend ordering the fried bun. Instead, just don't do it fried because in my case, it ruin the experience. It was too hard and crunchy like a mouth full of dry cereal without milk. Think that, but harder.  I will go back and try it again without the fried rice bun because I loved the bulgogi inside it.   I also gave the Sushi burger 3 stars because it was too expensive for something that didn't satisfy me. A sushi burrito is much bigger and worth the price. I bought 3 burgers at a total of $30.   However, I still need to try out the dine-in hibachi and sushi experience. Btw you only get a stamp card if you dine-in and not take-out.

We started ordering different rolls from different categories. I honestly enjoyed all of them! They were all freshly made and tasted like a regular roll you get from anywhere else. Also if you write a review, you get a Korean ice cream sandwich which is very yummy! :)

ONODU8YEbzrXnVzgDbdjSg.text: Talk about yum! I came in on a Wednesday for a quick lunch around 1:15pm and got out by 1:45pm. I sat at the sushi bar and ordered their lunch special combo something called sea lover and it came with miso soup, a shrimp skewer appetizer, tuna sashimi and a specialty roll for $15! m2o3dyaT-kbZCXGP8YElLA.text: AYCE made to order sushi?! Yes, please.   I'm always really skeptical of buffet sushi because the quality tends to be poor at most places. Not the case here. All dishes are made to order.   I've been to Jjanga twice, and both times I have left extremely full and satisfied. The all you can eat menu is $20.95 for lunch and $25.95 for dinner. The fish was fresh, and there are so many options on the menu, so I think the price is more than fair. My favorites are the pink lady and candy cane rolls. Their hand rolls are also delicious, and you can't go wrong with traditional nigiri. Note that you will be charged for leftovers, and you're limited to 45 min of ordering time for lunch and 1 hour for dinner -- basically, strategize a little and don't over-order! The menu is HUGE, so it might make sense to look at it online first to get a general sense of what you might want to order. Make the most of your ordering time, and enjoy.

kRpL6bcVAgoC84XSoX16YA.text: SO YUMMY! The sushi here was extremely fresh and delicious. Service was very friendly and we were taken care of. I recommend any of the shrimp tempura rolls... so tasty.

ICOLpwsB0z1ecV2JzKvtLA.text: There fried rice is not the same!  When they cook the fried rice on the hibachi they have a big bowl of rice to cook the fried rice. The rice is yellow colored not white. I find it cheap & disgusting, easy way out to cook fried rice. And the rice was too chewy!

6WvE-HdJf0h62qsusBIrPA.text: We had a family dinner there  The good.     Very reasonably priced Entertaining  Casual atmosphere Nice owners  The bad. -tngKr4g4AqVMnv492D9_A.text: Love love love this place!  They take great care of us!  We keep coming back for more.  Sushi is on point and so is the hibachi!  DELICIOUS and great staff

9xU8NjYsHHQ-kfxyiyTLQg.text: We walked in on a Thursday around 11 pm (literally, an hour ago,) we got seated and ordered our AYCE sushi and appetizers.  The hot items came faster than the sushi. The waitress was pretty attentive and the owner was nice enough to charge my iPhone because my phone died. The food was good but not phenomenal.  The nigiri took forever! What pissed me off was when the owners friends came in  (I'm sure the 2 guys he hugged were his friends,)and ordered, they got their food within 15 minutes. We were there an hour! It was not busy and there were 2 sushi chefs just talking to each other. I remember the chef had this obnoxious graffiti hat. My friend suggested this place with high regards, but due to the speed and lack of priority from the chefs, we don't find ourselves coming back.

v6bw1T7O6dxEyR0lHqa-Fg.text: Great and quick service. Took less than 15 minutes to get seated, and immediately got served. Fish quality and rice portions are nice. The servers constantly checked up on our table. My favorite roll had to be the Pink Lady. Would definitely recommend to anyone who is a fan of spicy rolls! Additionally their appetizer options were plentiful and even my friend who doesn't like sushi was still able to enjoy his experience. Overall would definitely come back!

ynJnOtrY9N-CLw77eimcug.text: Service was great and the food was better. Quality fish, wide variety of appetizers, and awesome atmosphere. Great for families, dates, and gatherings. Their desserts are pretty normal for a sushi place but they do have an ice cream sandwich I can't wait to try. Would come again.

_rzXhd26fA7nTnHkEjnKnw.text: This place this week has gone viral because of a video going around Facebook and Instagram.  They do all you can eat, but I came here to try their fabled new "Sushi Burger" which unfortunately is not part of the all you can eat menu.  The first thing we noticed was the great music. Classics like Sinatra and the Beach Boys.  We ordered the Jjanga Burger, the Bulgolgi Burger, and the Unagi Burger. We went with the panko encrusted rice buns which I believe was a mistake. The buns were hard, and not easy to eat. Next time I would go with the regular rice bun.  The kicker was the service. Not terribly busy but definitely a healthy amount of patrons, but our service was slow, unresponsive, we felt forgotten a few times, and the check was pushed on us without us asking for it which made us feel that we had to leave.  They did give us free ice cream which was very nice.

ZKfGrfd87ncpJN4UXmuDKQ.text: I love Jjanga steak and sushi! It is right around the corner from my house and I was pleasantly surprised at how fresh and delicious the sushi was!  Staff is super nice and my order is always ready fast for pick up!

2bZJB8qu3yDL4jlO5XVPdQ.text: Saw a facebook video about this place on Facebook, SUSHI BURGERS! I was so excited to try it since we were visiting Vegas from Phoenix, AZ. I decided to get an Alaska roll since that is my go to simple roll as an appetizer. It came to the table and it was so bad. I have always liked Alaskan rolls everywhere and this place managed to make it bad.  Moving on to the BURGER. I got the bulgogi burger not fried. The bulgogi was so sweet and sticky and the sauce was thick. Not like bulgogi at all. Tasted terrible. My boyfriend got the JJANGA burger with friend rice buns, it was messy and it fell apart. He did not eat much of it.  We saw a sign that said free dessert with a 5 star review so that's why this restaurant has a 4 star overall rating. Its a shame that people will spend their money here.   Now both my boyfriend and I want to barf after this nasty food. So sad that we had to leave Vegas on this bad note.

0leFuEsGRGIX-2nnoMpOmg.text: This is probably the best Sushi spot I've been to. It's an AYCE Sushi restaurant and it has Hibachi. The Sushi was well prepared and the service was adequate.  My only issue is, if you over order a bit, you have to pay the Al a cart price for whatever you don't finish. Plv8EVSwEBu5nLxUHj5NiQ.text: I have been here a couples mainly for their famous Sushi Burgers and they never seem to fail. The first couple of times I ordered dine in and this time I ordered take out. They brought out my order within 15 min, maybe less, and was freshly made! I do recommend that if you are just looking for a quick bite, this might not be the place for you. Usually at night there is  a 17-20 min wait to be seated but definitely worth the wait.

sQyQak0eWtRa9QnE_ZA9Fw.text: The food was great here, but the service was lacking. It took over 20 to 30 minutes to get sat at a hibachi table, and the waitress didn't come by for even longer.  We had a party of six, and all prefer to eat light because of our diet. We decided to get three meals that included four items each. For those of you who do not know each item counts as 3 ounces worth of meat, at least that is what we were told. So we were to get 36 ounces of meat with this combination. We also could have opted to get four meals with three items each and it would have yielded the exact same amount of meat.  What the waitress did not tell us is that she would be charging us "Sharing charges" for each person that did not receive a full meal. We told her that we did not all need soup and salad and she said that she could waive the sharing fees because of that. But when the check came, there were two sharing fees on it. I asked about this fee, and she explained the reason that they had to put them on there, but we did not all receive our soup and salad. After a little bit of arguing back-and-forth, the waitress said that she would take off one more sharing fee but would still charge for one sharing fee. Except, when we got the bill, it had all of the sharing fees on it anyways. We paid our bill and got the heck out of here! I don't think that I will be back, at least not anytime soon!

NFcHX2OK6jl_XWtsDo_RnQ.text: I searched all over for a place that had AYCE sushi as well as hibachi because my friends and I were craving both. And yes, while they do offer both, the concept is a bit deceiving seeing as how you cannot enjoy both options simultaneously. There is a separate side for each option. You have to choose what side you want which was a huge disappointment to my group and I. Some of us wanted hibachi, some of us wanted AYCE sushi and some of us wanted both so having to choose was really a bummer. We all decided to go with hibachi because at least with that option you can order sushi as well, the all you can eat is just not available there. I sort of understand their reasoning for it being separated but that doesn't change the fact that it's misleading. If you market yourself as a hibachi and AYCE sushi place, we should be able to take part in both. That was our sole reason for deciding on this place. Aside from that, the food was pretty decent, ambience was nice and prices were great. You get a lot of food for what they charge. Just be aware that both options are not available so you and your group must be all be decided on the same cuisine you want.

_FcG0XmNuLDl-J8cmZy5KA.text: First of all, thank you chef Tony! Our food was amazing but your attitude and commitment to the  experience was second to none! My wife and I come to this place a few times a year and it's always a great dinner! We have been to other hibachi places in Las Vegas and New York City and this is still the best! A hibachi grill is made by the chefs that serve you and chef Tony is among the one of the best! Thanks!   My wife had the chicken and shrimp while I had the shrimp, chicken and steak. Everything was made to perfection and quality you expect in a service town like Las Vegas. I have eaten and traveled in many cities and countries and sometimes you feel spoiled living in Las Vegas. This place was good and the service was amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XGMKIkQkKgU5_WFITOT4OQ.text: This is the place to have the best sushi burger. Get the crispy panko crusted bun. I guarantee you won't be disappointed. Great food and great service. It's quite a drive from the Vegas strip. But it's worth it. Check out the specials on the bar board menu. You can't go wrong. I'll make sure to come here again when I'm in Las Vegas.

x3RRSoszUUcqKZ19kI576A.text: Saw an awesome facebook ad for this place and decided to go try it! I ordered the jjanga burger which had spicy tuna, crab, avocado, seaweed salad, and craipy rice to hold it together! It was the best thing i have tried in vegas during my trip! I highly recommend this restaurant to any sushi lover!!!

5HgQER37lPhWxtnpduFUeQ.text: I've been looking for a good ayce sushi spot on the SW side since Kobe closed and I think I just found it. They've got a great late night happy hour like nothing I've ever seen. Unagi was so buttery and soft. Spicy salmon might give you heartburn. Try the Korean fried chicken appetizer, it's perfectly fried and the sweet chili sauce is bomb. Our food came out fast, server was very attentive without being pushy, music was good too. I ate too much but I can't wait to come back and eat more.

GbfR54NYMbnTEscU3AjOlA.text: Our go to sushi place! Love the fresh food and outstanding service! We have never had any problems. Never had to wait long for a table and super friendly staff!

Cz2o_vfn-lz9LIEu8PDU-A.text: Jjanga is our go-to sushi joint. We found our usual order which usually consists of the bulgogi burrito and the jackpot special. The have such friendly staff and our orders cone quickly. Overall, Jjanga is a must-try if you're in the Southwest area.

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JjODp32UGurOcB-NT8XA9Q.text: I'm so glad I've finally found a quality sushi place near me, the coco shrimp roll and korean bbq roll are my favorites. The place is clean, service was friendly what more could you ask for, this is a must try place!!

nhz3lWbzxqtGz21zNHO38g.text: We came here because our usual place was closed and I'm so glad we did! We did the hibachi dinner and John was the one that cooked our food. The first thing that won me over was that we were able to get 3x the rice since we didn't want the noodles or the vegetables. Other places, you would only get extra rice and not extra EXTRA rice. And the rice was delicious! It's even better than our usual place. I got the filet and shrimp. John cooked my medium rare filet perfectly. He also made us a special sauce that was amazing! On top of that, John had us try a different way he cooked the chicken with the yum yum sauce and I can't wait to order that next.  The food was amazing but the service was even better. John was hilarious and made it a point to actually talk to us and tell us stories. We were in a group with another family and by the end of the dinner, we were all talking like we had all gone to dinner together. And that was because of John. While we sat there talking after dinner, one of the ladies offered us a green tea shot on the house. That was so nice of them to do especially since the shot was so delicious! I can't wait to be back here!

aay7oypTDCdk6ItLyHJDfQ.text: another visit to this sushi place... same friendly and cheerful staff... awsome food the makes you come back for more.  we love coming here during sundays after chuch just to enjoy the good food and the music they play.  Go 90's music!!!

HvfXC9bXCqmZjrD7FhmZqg.text: I love this place. Outside great. Server nice and cute. Food great. Yummy Karai burger. I love food. 9/10. Came here after watching a video on their sushi burger and it delivered. They play good music outside like nice elevator music.

n2OZLrZchHZr6dKLCQlElw.text: This is our 2nd time coming here and the food and service does not disappoint. Cocaine salad was absolutely delicious and is a must try for first timers. My favorite is still their assortment of fresh 2-piece sushi that they offer. It gives me a chance to try all their different flavors but stay far away from the Egg Sushi. Yuck. It's very sweet. All in all, 5 stars

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 piece sushi assortment. Eel, salmon, and tuna.

7MAdaEg4YM6M-SNZLP-yWA.text: They don't have the staff to support an all you can eat. Restaurant was not that busy but it's a 15-20 minute wait between orders. Wait staff runs around with nothing to do as the food sits on the counter. Our waitress in particular didn't put in half our order and we had to wait forever for the rest.  While the food is excellent, portions are also disappointing and not very sharable.

aS3i9wD6jcK3wZcfF2GSgQ.text: Ordered delivery, portions were small and the sushi was room temperature, warm. I shall not order delivery of sushi again. The Grubhub driver may have taken more than one order on a hot 104* Las Vegas Day. Live and learn.  Next time I will dine in only, when in the mood for sushi.  My advice: Avoid ordering delivery sushi when it is extremely hot outside.

jJrvr0UO9q2rK3GUE6-s1w.text: No matter what you are craving that day Jjanga probably has it! They had an a- la carte options AYCE options and even a hibachi grill. When I was there I ordered the sushi burgers, and they are extremely filling and heavy duty. They tasted awesome, and they were well made but they can be a little too much if you don't like heavy meals

7wl77WM33vQ23dfyU1oQOw.text: Found this place on yelp when my friends and I were in Vegas for the night. It's not near the strip, but it's a nice location and well worth the drive (or the uber if you don't have a rental).  Got drawn in by the sushi tower which I've seen on IG for over a year. The wait was worth it. Fresh fish, flavorful sauces used.  We had two people in our party that do not eat raw fish and their vegetarian and/or deep fried options were delicious as well. It's hard to find a place that has an extensive list of non-raw rolls.   Interesting note, it's a fusion restaurant so they have hibachi tables as well. Might have to try that part of the restaurant as well.

uQa7XozT8naji-BIQGym7w.text: We came here for my sisters birthday and had the tapenyaki. My daughter was entertained and our chef was very friendly ( 5 stars for service )  We had reservations and were seated and served right away. The food was good. We tried the chicken, Calamari, steak, and shrimp. Steak was hands down my favorite with a tie between calamari and shrimp. It is a lot of food so come hungry and be prepared to have left overs. For the amount of food you get The prices are not bad!  I took one star away because at the end we had to ask 5 different people for a spoon, stopped getting refills and pretty much started to get ignored. As it got later I think they may have been getting busier but the sooner they bring a spoon, the sooner we can eat our ice cream and leave so it's not really a good excuse. That aside it was an enjoyable dinner in terms of fun and food.

kaQXE0KGA4dATz_f3DVSDg.text: Great place for Sushi anytime of day! I love their original rolls and some of the sides are the best I've had in town!  And they have a sweet raspberry ice tea that is definitely delicious and recommended to try out! Friendly waiters is a plus, always.

Co5wLTafYVfsoI1B_4p9Bw.text: I read several other reviews using the word mediocre to describe the sushi here, I would have to agree. Came here today, both my friend and I got AYCE (which is an excellent deal $21/lunch) but, I should have taken more time to read the menu there was almost no rolls without shellfish almost every single roll had shrimp, crab, or eel. This isn't uncommon with sushi restaurants, I'm used to it... and every single place I've been to is always happy to substitute or leave out shellfish, except here. I ordered a few different rolls but nothing tasted that great. Most of their rolls on the all you can eat are deep fried or baked and I don't usually go for those types of rolls but I had very little to choose from seeing as of how all the shrimp rolls where out of question. I wanted to add lemon to a couple rolls (again never had an issue with this anywhere before)....here, they just sliced up big chunks of lemon and brought it out instead of adding it to the roll? Why? Seemed lazy to me. They also don't have tamari here, so if you're gluten free bring your own soy sauce? The best thing I ate was the veggie salad roll actually.  Our waitress was nice but a little bit slow to bring napkins or notice when we needed something but she was very friendly. Our table got really over crowded with dishes and I accidentally spilled the sake trying to reach around, I don't think they noticed.  So, if you prefer fresh rolls this isn't going to be your favorite place. If I ever go back I will just be sure not to order AYCE and hopefully not be too hungry and then I can stick with a poke and sake.

Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OyYR33WNP_soN2hZ88L7NQ.text: Love. Friend told me this was the best place in town so had to try it myself and OH MY LANTA!!!! Amazing! The sushi is so good and the no rice rolls are great. The staff is friendly and quick! If you love sushi this place is a must!

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Naruto roll!

UwN7Atnedw_CuG2KXRQjMQ.text: Wow, I had no idea that this quality of AYCE sushi was so close to my house! This place is awesome! For the price, I can say hands down that this is one of my favorite sushi places to go splurge. You can easily get what more than what you paid for, as long as you pace yourself and order smartly.  They have a variety of awesome rolls and nigiri that will definitely fill you up by the end of the night. I like that they had options with or without rice in the rolls and different options like soy paper. And if you aren't in the mood for sushi, they also have the Hibachi grill.  This place is perfect for people who don't like sushi as well, since they have a lot of non-sushi options on the menu. I think this is one of the best places that I have eaten in Vegas so far, which says a lot. Many sushi places that offer AYCE tend to be sub-par in the quality of fish, but this one I can say delivers quality at a great price.

d4-UhUFHt08ar-UnNI4PbQ.text: First time ordered from here. Tamago sashimi should come with 3 pieces. Look at this! Charged for $6?? And not even have 3 pieces! Ridiculous! Will not order again from here.

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tamago.

0OWTzz5Hy2NU-xQWYkygfg.text: Love the atmosphere and the customer service. They have a great lunch menu on their tables and their habachi is delicious. The chefs are hilarious and try keep their customer engaged. Sushi is always very fresh.  They have a happy hour meni from 3pm to 6pm and it has great deals. They have california rolls and avocado cucumber rolls for $3.00. They also have shrimp tempura for $4.00.  Their all you can eat lunch menu is around $21.00 and dinner for around $26.00  Their servers all come to check on you. Its nice because you dont have to hunt down your server like other places. Try their hot tea, it's delicious.

UWMFHfLfw7PVuiBquGhdaw.text: Excellent sushi spot, quick service, fresh fish, amazing staff.  Joe was my sushi chef and omg!  the pics just don't do it any justice.  It was just as tasty as it was appealing!  Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Rock

PE5LT7xxJeZH631QQlKGLA.text: You know how I've been searching for the best ayce sushi place in Vegas?  Well . . with all due respect to Jjanga, that there search continues.  I mean, with such an expansive ayce lunch menu, I had some pretty high hopes of finding at least one item worth yelping. Alas, the sushi, as well as the hot food, was pretty much meh.  meh, meh, meh, meh.  meh.   The sushi: Ordered the Big Easy and Something Wrong.  Both rolls were equally unimpressive and possibly bordered on downright disappointing.  What got me was the flavor profile of the fish for each roll was completely drowned out in a sea of whatever special sauce they were using to dress it up.  The nigiri was two uneven pieces of mangled fish (to which I totally regret not taking a couple pics for proof) and tasted almost as bad as it looked.  Now I know ayce sushi may not be premium grade fish but at least make it look presentable.  jeez Jjanga, can't you folks try to pretend you know what you're doing?   #hackmyfoodwhydontcha  The hot food:  just don't.  Next time, I maybe leaning more towards quality instead of quantity.  But it is Vegas . . . and they are known for their buffets . . . so that's gonna be a big maybe that borders probably not.  And at this rate, I believe scientists will finally have a picture of the Higgs Boson particle before I find my ultimate AYCE sushi spot in Vegas. And they've been looking for awhile!

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9WKkAmK0iZmgJwyQNEZXDQ.text: AYCE JJANGA sushi  Servers were very friendly and very prompt.  Even though it is AYCE, quality if fish was very fresh and delicious.  When you order, food came out very fast.  I would definitely come here again when I have craving for sushi and rolls.

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jjanga sushi buger

7_wGRkQrB5bz-1IHoLnA3w.text: We have spent every special occasion in this sushi place. Quality is top notch! I'd say they're the best in town!

1rfbZdpDKkzdFKvyONDVfw.text: On Wednesday, my boyfriend and I came to Jjanga Steak & Sushi per his recommendation. We ended up coming a little bit early, between 4:30 - 5:00 P.M, so we didn't get a chance to do the hibachi, but we ordered off the happy hour menu.  Tons of selections at this restaurant during their Happy Hour. My boyfriend and I picked out a few selection, their Bulgogi, Miso Beef, Vegetable Tempura, their sushi tower, and fried green beans. All of the food was amazing! I didn't try their sushi tower, but I had everything else. The bulgogi meat was scrumptious. The flavor of the meat was out of this world. The Miso Beef was not over-cooked and the Miso was just slightly added to the meat. The vegetable tempura was fried, and a good change once in awhile to vegetables.  The location is off of the 215/Sunset area with a shared private parking. The ambiance in the restaurant is somewhat casual, but can be a great date night spot! I would highly recommend this place!

fAnnAnAY1whRlPw3Bf7hfg.text: The best sushi, spicy mayo is delicious. Baked muscles are great also. I eat here at least once a month! Only sushi place I'll eat at or sushi ya after they took Jjanga away

fe1zE6wpXL_8vMby6w3Dgg.text: I've been coming to Jjanga for quite some time now. This most recent trip, however, was a most memorable one, for obvious reasons...  Service, in my opinion, has improved tremendously from years past, and it showed on this trip! If I'm not mistaken, a woman, I believe her name was Susan, was constantly checking in with her staff, making sure that they were all on the same page. As a former food-service professional, these little details make a great difference, even if the customer is oblivious to it.   Everyone from the hostesses, to the servers, to even the table bussers, constantly checked in with my good friend and I to see if everything was okay, or if we wanted to order more food. Typically, you don't see table bussers checking in on customers, however, this was a noticeable difference from previous dining experiences here! Yes, they were busy, and yes, you could tell staff was tired...they STILL provided exceptional service, despite all of this  I commend the front of house and back of house workers on a great job well done! We'll definitely be returning for no good reason at all...this is just our go to spot!

EoHLVzYUHi3rp6_BMmGGTA.text: The beer was good? Not clear on who our waiter was, four different people tried to take our drink order.  Ordered octopus, received disgusting scrapped calamari head. My husband's a chef on the strip, please don't pull that BS. We clearly ordered 2 appetizers and 3 rolls, 1 roll came before 2 appetizers, last roll came 30 minutes later. I'm industry so I handed over my credit card too ashamed to call anyone out. Not sure whom to talk to, as we have had 4 different waiters. Super disappointing.

FcUzL8ZOjXjRXxkNr6cH9w.text: I have been craving this #sushiburger from @jjangalv since the first time I ate this 4ish months ago. The last 3 weeks I have been really wanting to go. And so worth it for $9.95. #  #jangaburger #forkyeah #vegaseats #lveats #vegasfood #lasvegaseats #vegasdining #alreadycravingit   #jjanga #jjangasteaksushi #lasvegas #vegas #vegaslocal #ilovevegas #vegaslife #offstrip #LML #friYAY

jjpVypwB0HtHffUhkkmfig.text: Blah.  Wont be coming here again.  Food was bland.  Nothing special.  Soho for happy hour and gorilla sushi for ayce are so much better.

C8ippYE4y5yfq8ldefgU9Q.text: I recently came here on a Friday night with my parents for an early birthday celebration. The food was delicious, but I have to dock them one star for not being able to serve alcohol for whatever reason.   How can you sushi with no sake? :(   Either way we still chowed down on some AYCE sushi. My favorite items were the garlic tuna nigiri, yuzu yellowtail nigiri, playboy special roll and the baked mussels. Out of everything I tasted it was all pretty tasty and came out super quickly. I was kinda disappointed to hear they didn't offer half rolls either which limited my stomach space for trying more of a variety. The options of rolls, apps and desserts was quite plentiful. There's definitely something there for everyone to enjoy.   None the less this was still a good dining experience. I'd like to come back again to try the hibachi dinners.

Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Playboy Special

_zy3mtBTtaBFqX8rF1_VKw.text: WOW, WOW, WOW! BEST SUSHI. PERIOD! How to emphasize how amaaaaazing this place is? So it's my first time in Las Vegas with my boyfriend, and we wanted to check out this place because I had read it was the #1 sushi restaurant in all of Las Vegas. Boy, it did NOT disappoint and it only EXCEEDED expectations with every bite. Yum!  Our waiter, Alex, took very good care of us and was very kind and welcoming. He recommended we try the monkey burrito and that first bite was literal heaven. The fresh taste and mix of textures was delicious! And I'm a sucker for anything with crab, so it was definitely one of my favorites.  We took advantage of the all-you-can-eat lunch menu (it's available 11:30 am-3:30 pm for $20.95 per person and it's honestly one heck of a deal! So much bang for your buck) and ended up getting an appetizer (the Bulgogi was fire!!!!), 6 different rolls, a burrito, AND Korean ice cream sandwich. That's incredible! And the portion sizes are just perfect to allow for you to try different things without getting overly stuffed, and I have quite an appetite so this place met my foodie needs. Bold flavor, mix of different tastes, so perfectly put together each time- best experience in Vegas yet! Can't wait to come back! The rolls we got (which were all highly delicious and worth a try) were: XXX (My all-time favorite), screaming honey, playboy, kiss me, dancing eel, and sexy time. Try EVERYTHING and anything!   The Korean ice cream sandwich was extremely pleasant and a light dish, but highly satisfying. The wafer it comes in was delicious and I loved the mix of vanilla ice cream and red bean. I will definitely be back!

YgQedvKE7V3GFB_9wGoxZQ.text: I've been to this place since it's been open and even before, since I was a fan of the original location on Decatur.   Quality of fish - 4 out of 5 Fish to rice ratio - 4 out of 5 Selection - 5 out of 5 Service - hit or miss, but usually averages about 4 out of 5. It really depends on time. If you go before dinner rush, service is on point, but once dinner hits, it's downhill.  Favorite rolls- Pink Lady, Screaming Honey, Naruto Favorite side menus - jalapeno poppers, tempura, udon  Overall a good place...

0_6yH1Qs6PPXv8Q9kWZqVw.text: So we came here and have fallen in love with Jjanga. Great ambiance, good music and above all PHENOMENAL food. We just moved to the area and were worried we wouldn't find our "next sushi spot" well... we were pleasantly surprised. It's become our new spot and as I'm sitting here writing this review, comes another delicious plate... yummmmm

UvA9Qz536PdXKQglJ8AD7g.text: I had no idea what I was thinking, going here for AYCE when there were so many other AYCE establishments right by my house with even better quality.  My sister and I came in and there was only one other person dining. We had no idea what we wanted so just randomly picked rolls with names that appealed to us.  Everything was just an okay type of good. I've had sushi with eel sauce and once you have sushi with eel sauce, you cannot go back.  Well I noticed something when our rolls started to come in, they all had just about the same presentation and the same ingredients. Therefore, three of my different plates of rolls tasted pretty much the same and was on the dry side :-(  When we ordered dessert, the server tells us that they ran out of green tea ice cream so the only ice cream they did have was chocolate. Man, I'm disappointed to even be recommended chocolate ice cream.  Our experience at this location was underwhelming. I might give it another try soon but that soon could be delayed by other AYCE establishments.

7MpYFEwqlKLCKTWcZhRAkg.text: Its been awhile since I tried this place and I wasn't really impressed ? It looks as if the place has been improving since the last time I was there ? So I wanted to give it shot again ? I had order Togo and had a few of the items After I made the order it said it would be 45-55 minutes? That seems very long ??usually I can usually get stuff in around 30 minutes to 40 minutes tops for Togos  But I thought they might be busy so I arrived in at about 40 minutes They looked a little busy I went up to hostess and picked up my order it was in 4 boxes I kid you not it felt like there was nothing in the boxes it was extremely light ? I drove home in 5 minutes and started with the chicken satays  it was barely warm and was super dry , flavor was average at best The beef skewers were ice  cold and once again very dry ? I then had the California roll they were just average nothing special I wasn't expecting anything special on this one cause it's pretty boring roll  the bulgowas probably the best thing but it was ok Looks way better on the website ? I don't know if it's me or just didn't have the greatest experiences ? I doubt if I'll ever be back ?

Vii6nFH0YyC--w_V4uxuRQ.text: I have a love hate relationship with AYCE sushi. I typically don't like these locations because I feel the quality of the fish usually suffers. What brought me to Jjanga first was the sushi burgers. I order mine tempura style take off one bun and eat it open faced with jalapenos on top. Do what I do, it's delicious.  On our 4th visit we decided to do the AYCE option for lunch at $20 pp. This time we were with our newborn son with stroller in tow the hostess/manager wanted to seat us directly in the aisle, when we asked for another table she said those are for larger parties. We eventually asked to be seated at a booth and to have the outside chairs removed so we we could put the stroller on that side of the table while I sat on the end. The restaurant is big but the sushi area is quite small, if they allowed us to sit at a hibachi table that may free up some space. Anyway I digress the rolls were ok, some of the rolls are the same as my favorite sushi place and even though it was the same ingredients theirs didn't quite stack up but it was good enough to keep us coming back as it's close to our new home.  3 stars for the sushi and an extra star for the burger.

AteYoDGclEokaUyI_6-SmQ.text: I'm literally sitting in the restaurant right now, horrible service, the lady taking our orders are dodging our requests, we are a table of 10, they messed up 5 of our orders, and 8 of us were waiting a crazy amount of time, I waited 30 minutes and had to call a waiter to get my food, and they didn't even make it yet, we definitely will not be returning especially after telling them what we needed and they still got it wrong! My mother and i got the AYCE( All you can eat) and it seemed the waitress avoided us to order and when we managed to get them to finally come over to us and order, they would take forever to bring it out and we had to call them over to update on it and then they made it, it came it out like it was thrown together.

ffsyZF9BgTLUFGmn9uWpPA.text: Went here after work and really just wanted a few rolls. Website daid it closed in 25 minutes when we pulled up. We said we were willing to even take our rolls to go but still denied. We work right down the street in the Gramercy plaza and often go here after work and we were very disappointed to hear they closed at a different time then what their website specifies.

U4RMEXpuLjy4Dxq5WX8oHw.text: When I found out that one of my favorite AYCE sushi restaurants had a closer location to me, I was pretty excited, but the experience ended up being lack luster.  They split the restaurant in a sushi side and a hibachi side, which leaves the sushi side kind of cramped. My aunt asked to be moved because she felt uncomfortable, but they told us no despite the fact the table she wanted was the original one they were going to give us. They didn't give it to us because we decreased our party from 8 to 6. The service was very inattentive. It was really hard to order when we were ready.   The one reason I loved the original location was because they had a solid sushi to rice ratio on their nigiri. But they load the nigiri here with so much rice, which is a huge turn off. I would honestly drive a little extra to visit their other location.

AoRZMBkLni9GQ2oXBNdm_Q.text: Highly recommend this sushi restaurant o n the southwest side of Las Vegas.  Service is amazing and the "all you can eat" is great!  Atmosphere is fun... bartenders are friendly and fast.  Always good people and good eats!!!

od9PNHIys3pDLtcidMbpWg.text: This is the best sushi restaurant in the Southwest.  Friendly service.  Susan and Alex are the best!  Highly recommend!!

zwgjCIqDsC4bDKKV2uyZ5Q.text: FILTHIEST place I have ever eaten before. If you go here, just take a look at everything behind the kitchen area, the bathrooms, the walls, the bus tubs, the thermostat. My goodness, every thing in this place is absolutely filthy, not just dirty, but pure filth. I snapped a photo of the outrageously disgusting thermostat. I have never seen anything like it in my life. Filthy. Filthy. Filthy. Some sushi was good, other things just ok. I can't ever come here again though because of the filth.
