KNy8M-cqo-J0ENyBLWgxAw.text: This is probably my new favorite sushi place in town. I was extremely impressed. It seems as though it's hard to find a really good sushi place out here. Their rolls are very fresh & well put together. The service was amazing as well. I definitely recommend!

vQd_9rkde_bBgyxU5gkkEA.text: Great food! Sushi one of the best in town! Great place to bring the whole family..kid friendly and fast service!

ZMlXjdB7Td9q04RGexK4Rg.text: I'm so saddened to give this excellent sushi bar and restaurant a less than 5 star rating. I love the quality and variety of sushi offered at such a great price considering... creative rolls, no rice rolls and options, sushi burritos, salads and all of the Japanese sides. All of the sauces are amazing, yet jus the forewarned they're heavily sauced so if watching your 'macros' simply request light sauce or no mayo-based sauce ie yum yum.. That being said, this is the second time we have dined here with sub-par Service. Half of our table was AYCE and the other half simple ala carte ordering. Ordering was kept simple as a courteous to waitress, yet as the meal progressed we were pretty much forgotten on several occasions, with the waitress no where to be found even after sushi rolls were left sitting, ready at the sushi bar. Even after Kindly requesting more prompt service and attention, the waitress insisted that anyone could take care of us... I wish I could say the restaurant was overly busy or give some other excuse for such lack of service and indifferent answer. It could be a training issue, not really sure. We even tipped 20% over the 20% included gratuity not paying much attention to the bill. No sure if I can recommend this location or bring friends or family to this location. A little embarrassing to say the least and too many options available in this town!!

22gpDe6KkS-7VK2hlM2igQ.text: Went here for lunch the other day for the first time, service was a little slow but food was good. They have specialty items on the items including sushi burgers and sushi burritos. The also have an All You Can Eat option for $20. The reason I'm giving this place a 3 star is because I went back today for lunch and stood at the front for almost 5 minutes (behind two other people that had already been waiting there to be seated) when we finally decided to leave and go somewhere else. Not even "I'll be with you in a minute", nothing.

s4cpxSxYwG81Np4DxdJpsg.text: Good food. My gfs favsies. Love your all you can eat sushi lunch and dinner. Yummy food and really big sushi rolls. Sometimes almost to much ha but it's very good and always good.

jtZoZezEJtdpI7GrT4Lfbw.text: Absolutely love their sushi burgers. 2nd time coming and it seems like the portion keeps growing so you def get your moneys worth!! Good luck trying to finish this if you get the combo

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aEQ4kEoSQ6j7yaopvw0KWQ.text: Favorite sushi spot in Vegas! Great, fresh fish and they have YUZU- seemingly a hard find here in the valley for sauces. Definitely recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu front

n9LlGstKBn1LPmUrWLuPFQ.text: The ambience is like an upscale zen, but once you're inside you better be ready for some fun! They have the hibachi tables and chefs in the front and the sushi bar and seating on the side. This isn't your average sushi place where you are all squished in one room. It's very spacey and gives your more privacy. We have followed Jjanga to each of his restaurants and I plan on continuing that tradition until the end of time. The sushi is fresh, and they accomodate to your tastes. My first time doing the hibachi will be on my birthday so I can't wait! Clean, friendly staff, great food!

QmOFC16gP3eQ7PiqjeKesQ.text: Brought my bridal party here after our wedding rehearsal. Food and drinks were always on point!! Try the gummy break shot!

cqO9kSaU0wYCjakpwfI5Rg.text: Totally love this sushi place. Always come here and it's been an amazing time. Service is kind of slow but I understand that they are busy. All and all very good place for sushi around the corner from my house.

2N7ciZmyVziUQArc66--Sg.text: Their all you can eat menu is really tasty and good! They even have rolls with no rice on them so you don't get full right away. The atmosphere is trendy but laid back. Great variety and awesome quality sushi.

LAxHTambNVHBVI6qGvBQQw.text: This place was really good but I wish I knew about the language of their menu from the get go. Don't bring kids here if they can read :p

WHT82s89JjSlBhD2-6RXQg.text: Bomb dot come but food took a long time to prepare obviously I wish I didn't have to wait so long in between each dish when it wasn't that busy

MlUqXS2Do4Tfprmygqa_kw.text: This place was highly recommended by my co worker. Now I come here every time I'm craving for sushi. It's fresh and it's not overfilled with rice. Love it! This is my number 1 sushi restaurant!

RENRWEuQ8ICGCt7UWO6_Iw.text: Great atmosphere and service. Food was amazing ! We were worried as our old jjanga changed (Decatur) and we no longer like it. This is the original crew, who cares, and puts everything into their food and service. Very much appreciated! You can tell it's bad ass and they care when the owner is out there, asking how things are, helping with service and tables. They are all in, and as a food service person myself it is very refreshing to see others take this type of care. Will be back ! You will be out go to sushi date night! Thanks guys!

4yDoXSsP9HNZPwWRfr_-GQ.text: JJANGA is one of the best Japanese restaurants I've ever tried. Good tepanyaki and good customer service. I come here ever Friday night and JJANGA has never failed me. Every staff and tepanyaki chefs pretty much know me and my family there. Also the Sake is very good.

7uFi-LJ7cZxMvNVttG1qGg.text: Thanks jjanga for the good food and great drinks! Their grapefruit sake and gummy bear shots are the best! Service was on point and the music was just my style, but it can be a bit loud fyi. I will for sure be back again and again :)

qQyJT8aMMrRbJ8qOCoXbUg.text: This is one of my favorite places for All You Can Eat Sushi. Good service and great food. They actually have a new menu now which is still just as great. My favorite roll is the Threesome Special. Their rolls are not filled with too much rice to try to get you full fast unlike some other places. Love their green tea ice cream and green tea mochi!

KpsO9NjK4d6QsJkylQ5cAw.text: Love this AYCE!! Highly recommend the big easy and the threesome special. All you can eat options also include sushi burritos and no rice rolls! There are also non sushi options including bulgogi and udon. Definitely coming back for more to check out the famous sushi burger.

EDJK9ktZC7BYGCRHl6s_zQ.text: This place is amazing! I came here with a friend for lunch and got the lunch AYCE price. They have a large variety of rolls for a decent price if you get AYCE. I highly recommend the Pink Lady and the Joe Special. The aesthetic and decor of this place is super cute. I will be coming back to try their sushi burger!

dpM2aVZ1YauhMzSvTThKRw.text: I finally tried Jjanga for a late dinner the first time I went here.  I had all you can eat sushi.  I tried their bacon roll and another roll that was spicy.  I love bacon! So I ended up liking their bacon sushi roll a lot.  I also tried their sweet fried tofu which was super delicious as well! I wish I had more now that I'm thinking of it.  We had an enjoyable experience.  Our waitress was very friendly and knew a lot about the menu when I had questions about the sushi.  She checked up on us and was very hospitable.  The atmosphere is great, it's spacious and modern.  The seats are comfortable and people have a lot of room on their table for food.  I had hot green tea as well, which has unlimited free refills.  I also tried the green tea ice cream, which was really good too.  At the end of our dinner, the lady that rung me up gave me a punch card and put two stamps because one of the waiters accidentally messed up on our bills and gave us a different table's bill.  They apologized and were friendly about it.    The second time I came here I tried hibachi. I loved their hibachi! It's probably so far...my favorite place to go to...in all of Vegas.  Our cook was lively, friendly, and funny.  He did a lot of tricks and pretty much had a whole skit. I had scallops, fried rice, vegetables, spaghetti, chicken, and shrimp.  Their sauces were yummy! I enjoyed two out of the three.  It was plenty of food, but definitely worth it because I had some left to take home. I would go here again for hibachi or all you can eat sushi.

Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. all you can eat sushi for $25.50

l_TpJ_0i4EL7LTbhNG_CAw.text: Great sushi at a reasonable price! Try their sushi burgers, my friend says they're really good.

P02y5cDHVvM1JX9AuOXOpw.text: Hands down the best AYCE sushi in Vegas. Coco is the best chef always creates master pieces for my family. Real portion sizes for AYCE not reduced size like some places. Great atmosphere, great customer service, and kid friendly. I highly recommend coming here solo, with family, and/or friends.

JI9gIS_GmEKxY15wcUNtwA.text: This place is super delicious! I've never had a sushi burger before, so it was such a unique treat. Got the Karai Burger, which comes with spicy tuna, crab, and salmon. Pretty good service too. Next time I will probably try some of their rolls or nigiri.

qVWeW6Wg2Uh07sN4fFCGCQ.text: OMG I have never had sushi this good before. The sushi burger was incredible, the fish tasted fresh and the panko crusted bun had just the right amount of crunch and the burger was HUGE! I could only eat half! Love this place!!

lP0O7iW8clNdLB6uK3bnoA.text: Awesome AYCE!  Fast service and great fish.  I loved the chicken wings as well.  Will definitely be back.

knN9U4ML1mPHXC6lgu_AmA.text: Great service! Found this place through a Facebook video, and so glad I did! The sushi burgers were so delicious! Happy hour prices were also a plus! Would definitely come back here!

KnzhQcXavWog3GJxAfBGhQ.text: This is one of our favorite AYCE sushi restaurants in Vegas! My family and I come here at least once every couple of weeks for the quality of sushi, service and the fun atmosphere

N0TRo8GBoyg3ML2zSf0P3w.text: Really fun atmosphere and music. I got the Sexy Time roll and Mexican roll and both were delicious. I came with a group of 7 and service was very efficient.  Would definitely come back and get all you can eat.

hkVOmmMACAq5FLLto6OZ7g.text: Yummy food!  For $26 we ate a ton of sushi and had a great time trying new things with friends from out of town.

43nDHfn4UXQdSR1_o2Trpw.text: I was excited to try a new sushi place. My wife a I like to try new places with good ratings. So when I saw 4 1/2 stars I knew this place must be good. So we went to try it out. They sat us by the sushi bar. The table and chairs are made of food. The seats have no cushion. So after a few minutes of sitting down your butt starts  to hurt. Very uncomfortable. The chairs are dark and light color. The dark color is because they are dirty. There was a guy cleaning the backs of the benches while people were eating at surrounding tables. Cant they clean after hours? Not very pleasant to know. What else is dirty in this place. We got all you can eat. The fish behind  the sushi bar in the glass case. The more I looked at it. It didn't look to fresh. There was some bottle of medicine on top of the sushi bar, along with a pill bottle on the back wall in plain sight. There were to wood decor boats on top of the sushi bar. They were full of dust. While we were eating the sushi, it tasted pretty good. But I should say they put tons of rice and hardly any sushi. Once we left my wife and I both statutes to get stomach pains. Almost like as if they use msg or something. I usually eat a lot more sushi when we go to other all you can eat sushi places. So maybe they do use msg or something. I will never go here again. Take in note the place looks nice when you first go in. And we excited to eat here. I wasn't going to right a review. And I usually don't right a review like this. But when I get a stomach ache after I eat something isn't right with the food. That's why I did a review like this.

gOPmeyMZrC9lznWEpz4V0A.text: This is one of the best sushi restaurants in Las Vegas. Thr food here is out if this world and the drinks are very affordable. I give this place extra stars if I could. I recommend anyone to try out this establishment and bring extra friends for the hibachi with the live chef.

5v9w6RQPeXqy0MoELZKYnA.text: We love this place. Always awesome service from Moon, Ellen and Susan. The best sushi in town and forget about the garlic ponzu!!! Wow need to come!!

gw0YjKkMzUTumvMWuhk9Zg.text: The best All You Can Eat sushi in Vegas!!! The staff and service is just as amazing!! This is a must go when in Vegas!!

VdH_ZTcjoTwU1XF2mD8AYQ.text: Great place to have a nice lunch. If you don't want to eat all you can eat, they have great prices on classic rolls and appetizers. Great place for a quick lunch! Great service as well!! Alex was very kind and took good care of us!!

aWPNV110vI4J4iM03_X75w.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE !!! Probably the best sushi in town! The line is usually long and the habachi is moderate but all u can eat sushi is awesome! Most importantly the service rocks & the owner is fantastic !!

q7sHnUV82DoNN1boDiHVag.text: First time visiting this place and honestly I'd be ok if it was my last as well. Hubby heard rave reviews about it and I also saw the high ratings on Yelp too so we were excited to try. Walked in during lunch time with literally only 5 tables in use so not busy at all. Hostess is on the phone and in front of her is some disgruntled customer. Totally understandable that she's dealing with something. What I have a problem with is her back is to us and when she finally turns around she doesn't even bother to acknowledge that us and the other people have gathered waiting to be seated. This goes on for more than 20 minutes. The hostess doesn't signal for help from other staff nor does anyone else come to seat the customers. I was ready to bounce but we decided to give them the benefit of the doubt. We were finally seated and everyone else was nice and attentive. We both did AYCE sushi and honestly it was unmemorable. The rolls were all very similar and nothing really stood out. A lot of items were omitted from the AYCE and whats left are just generic choices. We drove 25 minutes to try this place and it was not worth the drive.

kWg0U5-mZcMDpQyDI_6ElQ.text: My boyfriend and I dropped through here on our way from Vegas to LA during Christmas. Boy, we were so glad they were open! Nothing disappointing here. Even during Christmas, all the wait staff were very kind to us, which really stood out because everyone working on Christmas is usually in a bad mood. We tried the sushi burger slider trio, the monkey sushi (with soy paper)  burrito and the tempura udon combo with California rolls (We were really hungry and ordered way too much food...) But it was all worth it for a long drive. I'm really grateful to the employees to give us a good experience on such a big holiday.

_j0zj5ISuVCd82h3zC3ATw.text: Jjanga is one of the many AYCE sushi places in Vegas that I just recently crossed off my list of places to try. I came to try their sushi burger, but instead ended up staying for the AYCE. One difference here is that they are primarily Korean so in addition to the sushi, they also feature many Korean dishes like KFC, pumpkin soup, and bulgogi, amongst others. Their sushi is great, but the biggest downside of Jjanga is their ratio of rice. In fact, if you're doing AYCE, don't even bother getting the sushi burritos, as the one I got was 80% or more of rice.   Rice ratios aside, I did enjoy many of their specials including the salmon belly, uni, oyster (Korean style), and golden scallop. They also have the other half of the restaurant feature hibachi, which I have yet to try. Although Jjanga probably won't be my go-to AYCE sushi restaurant, I would return to try their panko crusted rice bun burgers, which some reasonable at $9.

iSzURyWfhf23HUK0S1liyw.text: A very happening place and quite busy but we were seated fast.  I truly believe in their statement that they want to be the best.   We ordered the jjanga, karai, and bulgogi burgers. They were HUGE. So much we actually cannot finish them.  I do think everyone should try this at least once.  Their all you can eat menu is big too but will do that in a later time.  Servers were attentive.  Bring you appetite!!

oDs1BmoG-1_Per7j8oiqyQ.text: Great price fun atmosphere yummy food! We love this place for a date night and can also bring our kids for the hibachi as well! 100% recommend ! And will continue to eat here with the family :)

TnxMMVzTkWmAe72DSQlO9g.text: Really unfortunate how this place has gone down in service and as well as quality of food.    Dining Experience: As soon as we got seated, our waiter left us for a good 10-15 minutes. We didn't even water or any plates on the tables. When we finally got a waiter's attention, the food took about 25-35 minutes to come out. Funny enough, out food that we got weren't even the ones that we had ordered. When we told our waiter, he had no idea what we even ordered and it took another 30 minutes to get our rolls and nigiri out. Eating AYCE, that takes us about most of the time you're allowed to eat there.   Food: I noticed how they change a few things on the menu. One of my favorite things to get here were the baby octopus. They limited it to one per person and it's small :-( and not even half as flavorful as it was before.   Overall: I used to love going to this place. I always raved to my boyfriend that we should finally go together and try it after so long. It was very disappointing. They've really knocked down on the wait for food, quality of food, and so forth. I was expecting so much more from this place due to my past experiences here.

TO_x9GYqPyQxVPQxlikmww.text: Came here for lunch with my friends and had a great experience. We had the "All you can eat" for lunch and it was well worth it. Its a great place for causal everyday dining.

P3pwKHrgbeulJ4DLMQ3Tsw.text: JJANGA is my go to sushi spot!! I felt compelled to write a review after our kick ass last visit though. Came here Saturday night to redeem a free AYCE I earned and it was PACKED! We only waited about 10 minutes for a table which was surprising. I come here a lot but usually during lunch and sometimes dinner during weekdays and I've never seen it so busy so it was a different experience. I was absolutely shocked at how attentive the staff was!! Our server frequently came by to ask if we needed to order more, our water was filled as soon as it was at it's halfway point, and other staff members inquired if we needed anything throughout dinner. Everyone was so friendly too! Good job and keep it up to whoever is running this restaurant!

V-ViwkzXVgXcPABF6yCS1A.text: I can't wait to come back! Be prepared they don't do half rolls so come hungry !! The sushi was so fresh and they have so many options and cool twists on sushi and appetizers. I don't think I ever got my sushi so fast at any restaurant and we were able to sit immediately. The hours are great. The service was good and there's so many seating options!

zj8WmPctdMp-kd5bdq8Q7w.text: Fish is dry and overwhelmed in sauce. The quality has gone downhill. I personally feel like it's not fresh  and will go somewhere else despite it's convenient location.

QXoUz-x6agqaSQ7YRfP7Ag.text: Food quality has dropped severely!!! Jjanga has been my favorite AYCE spot in Vegas for years now, however after recent owner change things haven't been the same anymore. From my recent visit for lunch food arrived real slow but for dinner they were really quick but forgot part of our orders. The quality of fish and rolls also has dropped from what they used to be. Also still annoyed that they made Omakase a fixed menu vs truly chef's free-reign at making anything they want.

2G4V5wD-POtGTnu0iTNJJw.text: If you've seen that viral Facebook video of that sushi burger, then you know you can get it here.  It's very similar to a sushi burrito. The "patties" are made of rice. I suggest getting the Panko crust for that extra crunch.  The sushi burger, called Jjanga Burger, consists of spicy tuna, crab meat, and seaweed salad. It's wrapped in a brown paper to help keep its shape. You can get the burger alone for $9 or get the combo for $13. The combo will get you the burger, fries, and a drink. I'm a fries girl, so I ALWAYS go for the combo. My fiance on the other hand says he can pass on the fries  I deducted a star because the first time I had this, my fiance picked it up to go and he was carrying 4 small size clear cups. He said that they don't have any other size cups so they gave him 2 of each to equal a medium size. Wouldn't it be easier to invest in bigger size cups?  Other than that, I've already been back 3 times. I love ordering it to go. I work 5 minutes away and it only takes 15-20 minutes to prep.

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This sushi burger tho.

C0vxF5JG15Rg6v6yqtVQGQ.text: Went there for lunch with 2 of my friends today. Biggest disappointment was the service. The food was average but the wait was long. We order AYE for lunch. o9fREFB0f4OKALuJMye7fg.text: 1000+ reviews, 4.5 stars, AND close to where I live. I've tried coming here 3-4x but always left because of the long wait times. FINALLY, i said enough is enough, i MUST try it. Tried to make reservation but they only take it for parties of 4 or more. I went in around 8pm and it took about 20 mins to get seated. I am glad I tried it, because now I know I don't have to return and wait. no mo fomo  We were seated at the bar and the servers must've been confused about who serves that section. We were approached by about 3-4 different servers asking if we wanted a drink or to order appetizer. I guess it is better to be overserved than underserved. Ok, i won't complain about this.  I've easily been to 20-30 different restaurants that serve AYCE sushi and knew exactly what to expect. I didn't expect the freshness or taste of sushi to be the best. Coming in with such low standards already, the taste/quality of sushi was even lower than my subpar expectations. The rice tasted hard and stale, it didn't matter how good the fish was. Here are some of my comments about things I've tried:  APPETIZERS: Screaming orgasm: 0/5 -- do not get this please! it taste like stale beef jerky. Volcano shrimp/green mussel/shrimp tempura: 3/5 Garlic parmesan edamame: 5/5 -- liked this a lot  SUSHI: Salmon skin roll: 3/5 -- not bad, would get again Ono nigiri: 5/5 -- this was the only saving grace of the meal, the rice was bearable because it was drenched in the sauce Salmon/yellowtail/garlic tuna nigiri: 3/5 Surf & Turf roll: 1/5 Koo Koo Special: 2/5 -- the 2 is for the spicy mayo lol Yuzu salmon belly sashimi: 2/5 -- man how do you mess up salmon belly  DESSERT: I'll give them 5/5 for having melona popsicle  Here are some positives: -- attentive servers, nice chefs -- their chococlate ice cream (i am sure it's thrifty or something LOL) -- the edamame -- their teppanyaki smelled good  I should've known that a place that also tries to do teppanyaki cannot have great sushi. I am of the mentality that you can't be good at everything, so just pick one thing (sushi) and killll it. There are a lot of awesome AYCE sushi places in vegas but jjanga is not one of them.

K009CvwqA0GscTzxhU6GgA.text: Checked out this spot while I was in vegas, I'd heard 1st about this spot VIA social media outlet INSTAGRAM. Always see NICE FOOD PICS on their IG. So I told myself let's check out this spot.   Came here for a LATE DINNER around 1130pm on a Sunday night and it was a slow night and lots of open tables so my party and I got seated right away.   FOOD MENU * So to make things clear their MENU 1st of could be a little confusing cause they have their AYCE MENU choice then they also have a section for HAPPY HOUR and also their ALA CARTE section which some choices are not included in their AYCE MENU CHOICES. (so honestly a little bit confusing)   FOOD SUSHI * Their NIGIRI's was OKAY I would say as for portion wise via fish CUTS on their fish it's so small  it kinda reminded me of some other AYCE sushi joint in vegas. The Quality for the fish was good I would say but I've had better at some AYCE sushi joints in vegas.   *We ordered their OYSTERS Which is just 1 PC order per person in their AYCE menu and for some reason idk if their was a miss communication among the waiter staff and the chef's but damn oysters took hella long to come to us. If I'd recall it probably took about 25/30 mins for our ORDER of oysters and it was only 4pcs as well (SMH) And on another hand I ordered a Sushi roll and the waiters gave me two different rolls so I was confused on what did I actually eat and order. But much props to our two servers they were kool dudes.   Parking * lots of free parking in front of the Resturant   Would I want to come back and eat here again / PROBABLY ahhhhhhh not quite sure.

iJjldk1UwJVqa7j3PiAG8w.text: I came here with my friends as they had said it was really good when they tried it so I was super excited as I love sushi. We walked into about a 20 minute wait and went to the bar where we had a couple Japanese whiskies. The bartender was nice which gave me a very positive feeling about the place. The two of us ended up sitting at the sushi bar which was pretty cool to see all the action.   Then we started eating a sushi it was a lot of rolls with unique names that were pretty okay. My biggest problem with this place was that the sushi chef didn't listen. he took her orders directly since we're sitting in front of them and I told them no mayonnaise on the one no sauce on a different one because I don't like too much sweet or fat sauce is on them and prefer them plain but he still put them on there.   They also completely forgot to service one of the side dishes, seaweed salad, which I was really looking forward to. Because of the lack of listening in the service from both the server and the sushi chef, plus I didn't end up liking one of the rolls and didn't eat it is why I give it two stars. By the way if it wasn't for the good bartender who is really nice and friendly I probably would have given this place one Star.

ATV8zZv5TnMzvIXjoNzGNQ.text: The summary-- nice place with great staff and good food.   What makes it along the best in my opinion,  they have cheese curds!  Sushi and cheese curds- life for this guy originally from Minnesota is now complete.   It's Monday so I am looking for a new place to try.   Today my quest brought me to Jjanga.  After driving out the surface roads into what seems like another city I finally found my destination.  I quickly realized my GPS didn't tell me I could have just taken the 215 to Russell and then turned onto Fort Apache.    Upon entering the plaza I saw a myriad of dining options and of course its headlined by Jjanga.  It's a pleasant entrance and welcoming environment.  There is a fairly long sushi bar staffed by 4 chefs.     They have a fairly large selection on their all you can eat menu.   As usual I declined the appetizer portion of the menu when asked by an attentive server.   I got my usual nigiri order cajun albacore,  garlic tuna,  and yuzu yellowtail.   They came cut very thick which I understand is more traditional than most of ther places I frequent.  They were tasty but the cajun seasoning wasn't really my favorite.     The Korean bbq room was next and definitely was a new favorite of mine.  As I'm savoring this roll,  I'm looking at the front of the menu and browsing the appetizers to find out what they have.  I found much to my amazement they have cheese curds!  I was guessing this couldn't be True but I placed an order for then and also the one time order for the Golden Scallop.    While I'm waiting I try the Burning Your Ass Roll.   It was good.   Not that spicy but good.   I also tried the Coco Shrimp Roll.   It was fairly amazing with the sweet coconut flavor permeating throughout the roll.     Then it comes.   The cheese curds.   Yes there are cheese curds at a sushi place!   It is an order of about 6 and they look like a small version of some you could get at a bar in Minnesota.  They were amazing!   The Golden Scallop also was amazing it fell apart in my mouth, every bite was delicious.     I also tried the Kiss of Fire roll which was good and came with a nice kick.  The last of my rolls was the XXX Roll which was a great ending to a great dinner.   And yes I had to have one more order of cheese curds.     All in all Jjanga was with the trip and I encourage anyone living nearby to give it a try.      It's a little more than some places but only by a couple of bucks.  If you're from the midwest and like sushi and cheese curds Jjanga is definitely worth the visit.  A lot of the rolls you can find elsewhere,  cheese curds you can find elsewhere but the combination plus the great staff and the tastefully decorated environment make me a fan of Jjanga.

0ScbDdbELOk69PBukMPbFA.text: I saw their sushi burgers on Instagram and I knew I had to try them. It was a good decision :) Located about 20 min (by car) off the Vegas strip in a strip-mall , Jjanga offers ample seating inside and a cute patio outside. We were there on a weekday afternoon so it was pretty dead, but we were greeted by a friendly host.  We quickly perused their extensive menu as we knew exactly what we were looking for. I ordered the Unagi Burger while my friend had the Sushi Trio, and we also shared the Sushi Tower. The food was yummm and very filling. I did think my burger had a whole lot of rice and not as much other stuff but it still tasted good.  Overall a good experience and would consider going back whenever back in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Unagi burger
Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi trio
Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi tower

OQu10NPZzgihxADFFiC7zQ.text: If you're looking for an All You Can Eat sushi place there are definitely better ones than this one, however the service here was amazing! If it weren't for our awesome server Krystal, I definitely wouldn't have enjoyed this place as much as I did.  We didn't do All You Can Eat, we just ordered by the roll 4 rolls: California, jackpot, TNT, and Mexican. All of them were mediocre. Even the California roll was poorly done, however it was only $4, so it makes sense as to why the avocado was browning already inside the roll. Also, if you're an avid mochi lover (like myself) they definitely don't give you enough mochi for the price that you pay.   Overall, I can't say I'll be back again, unless I have another get together there. I have definitely been fo much better sushi joints in town (Sushi Loca or Yama Sushi) check those ones out.

zQJ3_GdL_p75fPcofLyI2w.text: Everything was small for the price and a bit messy compared to pictures on yelp I expected a little more. I'm disappointed that the red crunch on the rolls isn't hot cheetos it's just dyed tempura. The service was not so great took forever to get out food during a regular lunch day. And to get our bill it  also took a while. But! The food we ate everything was delicious ! Im not sure I'd come back. I'm from California and I came a long way just to try this place and it was just ok.

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It&#39;s NOT hot cheetos! so sad it&#39;s just tempura dyed red.

EDgbr8iBJixC8j4gLzMXpQ.text: Taking reservations is a big plus when dining out with young kids!  Great assortment of items from appetizers, sushi, and rolls.  I like that they have healthier no rice rolls available on the all you can eat menu.  The seared salmon I can eat all day here and love that everything tastes fresh.  A little disappointed that there are limited sashimi specials on AYCE menu.  Service was attentive.  Food sometimes is a little slow or gets backed up on busy days/times.  I like that my little ones aren't charged especially since they don't really eat much if anything sometimes.  I believe under 3 is free.  Pretty loud in the restaurant, which is good for my kids so no one can hear them crying or throwing a tantrum haha!

krmx15xt73R5L1SsG3YJuQ.text: I ate by myself for the first time in a real long time and decided AYCE sushi would be the best place to do a little me time eating. I ate here a couple times before and my experience was well, meh. With that being said, I figured 3rd times a charm and they were going to wow me. Unfortunately that wasn't the case. They take away a lot of the normal AYCE choices from the lunch menu and move them to the dinner menu pushing to pay the extra $5. And then on top of that they're best know for their sushi specialties.... burritos, hamburgers, cupcakes etc.  not my cup of tea. I'm a nigiri girl and I'll put em down like a champ. By all means I'm not bashing the only other close sushi restaurant but I'm not making it my first choice, second or tenth. The wow factor was lacking and so was the sushi. Sorry Jjanga, you're really not that deserving.

OS1BjqDCE7dhruEJzLh4Lw.text: Again, leaving Hawaii. I left all my go to sushi places. I love Vegas and it's AYCE culture. The service is very efficient and all the servers are very friendly. This restaurant also has four hibachi tables which is cool and the other half of the restaurant is for sushi. The menu has  a good variety of appetizers, nigiri, burritos, classic rolls and other house special rolls. The drink menu has a good variety of sake, cocktails, beer and wine. The sushi is good and the rice is small enough on the nigiri that you can enjoy the fish. It is a little loud in here with the combination of people, music, and hibachi performances. This is definitely a locals spot because it is waaaay off the strip. The ambiance is nice and is very hip! Now, if you're from Hawaii.... this place is like Genki Sushi, sooooo IF YOU KNOW... YOU KNOW.  Still a good spot though!

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. red tobiko!
Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Garlic Edamame - this is hella spicyyyyyyy but good
Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. L-R: Salmon, Seared Salmon, Yellowtail, Tuna, Inari Special 2pcs and Garlic Tuna (*i did not like the garlic sauce on the tuna)

BDlfdV8ZwOpDU4cxE8bu7A.text: Great atmosphere, great service, great nigiri, all around great experience. Come here if you want to do sushi the right way!

sg_noDmS9NUpBSFL3mj8lg.text: Probably the worst experience ever. I came here for my birthday dinner and we ordered very simple things like seaweed salad, spring rolls to begin with. 30 mins passed by and I saw other tables get their seaweed salad and several other items. We canceled our order and NEVER GOT asked why or what happened. We had to pay for a few 2 items we got a la Carte items and they messed up our order got my parents a whole bottle of saporro not two draft. And didn't even bring my soda. The worst part of this all was just the people who got here in 2 minutes got their food within 5 minutes it's such a big slap in the face and not even the manager asked what occurred. Horrible customer service I left with a headache.

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fVx5qWLHiicE8QdmILV-Tw.text: Good food for the price, but wayy off the strip. Likely a locals spot. I am a sashimi type of gal so I was a little bummed that I was limited to only a couple orders of certain dishes, there is a limit on the items listed in RED on the menu. Fish was very fresh ans tasty and the service was great. Friendly service and clean establishment. If you don't mind a drive off the strip hit this place up.   CONSUMER BE AWARE! Anything left on your plates you will be charged full menu price for! DO NOT ORDER WHAT YOU DON'T INTEND TO FINISH! IT CAN ADD UP QUICK! $$$$$$$$

xbQcf0lbBg8b4Q_WB0qwug.text: The food is so amazing! I love sushi and the fact that they are located 5 minutes away rather than being closer to the strip like most sushi restaurants.  I really like the their variety of rolls, how self explanatory everything is on the menu. They even have a Hibachi, so every now and then I like to switch it up. The staff is so nice, great customer service to make you feel welcome.

6nxENzes7LjVa8lxTN-0jQ.text: This place has honestly been my favorite sushi spot for the longest time. My boyfriend and I frequented here every week for well over a year. Our servers have always been amazing and know us and talk to us. The managers noticed we didn't come in one week and asked what happened and I said we were out of town for my grandmas funeral and they hugged me and it was really sweet. They are like a family there. Ray and Nick are the coolest guys. Nick always took time to catch up with us and make us feel welcomed. We unfortunately moved across town so it's just too far to go to. But I love the service and servers here. The food is excellent. It's hard finding sushi on this side that is as great and welcoming like Jjanga. The garlic tuna, halibut, mountain roll are my go-tos. Their bulgogi is my favorite around town!!

XujfTnBthSkD7osjSSZnrQ.text: I liked their sushi burger creation. I got the regular rice bun and it actually together really well and it was really filling. The deep fried bun looked good also.

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi burger with regular rice bun. Karaoke burger without spicy sauce.

zniVhIr7UpDXuvBgbou3dA.text: Food is good. Service not so good.   I've been here a half a dozen times, all of which the service has been mediocre to horrible. My brother is a fan so that's the only reason I've even returned. If it was up to me I probably wouldn't come back. Expect to spend around 1:15-1:45 minutes total. I wish the food was worth the wait but I don't feel that it is. Last visit they screwed up our orders so bad that they forgot about our first list of items we ordered, brought the second order of rolls before we even received our first rolls ordered.  It's a shame they can't get it together.

hQHoGbIgC4svxLv3epkPbA.text: This was one our favorite sushi places until tonight! Not busy and we are a table of 3, we get seated and ignored. My husband tried numerous times to get someone's attention.. 15-20 mins into it we flag down the hostess and make our order. BOOM food comes out quick... BUT then to get ahold of anyone for a refill, extra anything it was such a hassle! The finale was they lost my husbands card and said they computer was down.. 30 MINUTES LATER trying to leave, they didn't offer us a single thing. Complete and utter waste of time, I'm glad they had to post a review on yelp everywhere! Liars and no customer service at all.

fcW5uD3f92vjHPLIVNRQQw.text: Jjanga burger with sushi rice bun was AMAZING! Fresh! I swapped the Tuna for salmon. No regrets. 10/10 will be back :)

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gJY73braqY2wsRn3Q1NbLw.text: Just visiting and happened to be in this area. Saw great reviews but it's fairly decent.  Ambience is great, service great, sushi is subpar. Very small rolls from what I ordered and quality is a bit below standard I'd say.   Reasonably priced for what you're getting but would expect a bit more given the amount of positive reviews it has.

L4hDEQooFn1C2nTF-IbKNQ.text: It was my first time here and I could honestly say this place is more hype than it ought to be. We had AYCE for dinner. The nigiris weren't as fresh as other sushi spots and the rolls tasted similar to each other. There are a lot of items that are one per person and it surprised me with a few of the items being one per couple. The location and customer service definitely has potential towards better ratings.

R6spKRM619c2nJfamQwFtg.text: Can we talk about our awesome server Alex?! He is literally one of the main reasons we come here. I'm always a little disappointed when he's not here. Beside the best service the food is absolutely amazing. I could never find any complaints about the food. It's so good. Everything on the menu is delicious

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

p2hAN8xUOrvHQuul2kNdSg.text: Very good food Will return drove for 30 minutes. Very good of selections. If you want a good place you have to come here.

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sCapKzQcAqnYs10ffXogmg.text: After hearing about this place we had to try it . We walked in around 330 pm on Monday 3/26 & it wasn't busy . Three other tables with one just about done eating . It took a few mins for someone to greet us , than got  seated. That wasn't a problem. Service was very slow and our waiter was complete trash !!! Young asian kid was our server . After getting our drinks he asked if we're doing all you can eat which we did . It took nearly 20 mins to get a few orders of nigiri & one roll. I asked what's a popular roll & his reply was look in the back ! Than we asked if the surf & turf roll was good , he replied "I don't like it ". Upon delivering our Hawaiian roll I asked what was the pink sauce on the plate & he shrugged his shoulders & walked away. Nigiri wasn't fresh , it was mediocre at best . The surf & turf roll was TERRIBLE, the seared beef was RAW ! We had to ask another employee to refill our waters. We decided not to order any more food cause we were being ignored . I wouldn't recommend this place at all . All the way around it was a bad experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Unappetizing surf &amp; turf w/ raw beef . It had a weird flavor .
Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Uni was discolored &amp; tasted old .

cpvYi6lBAM5Gn9jQT1ZURw.text: This is a hibachi spot to go to in Henderson. Also just tried the sushi they have here and it is pretty tasty and fresh!  I love the chefs here and they are very entertaining and fun to watch and they make the tastiest food!  I've gotten the jjanga special for the hibachi and it is sooooo filling! If you have an appetite this is the place!  Food is five stars for sure but service is a hit or a miss that's why I'm giving them a four star rating. Some times they are attentive friendly and quick. Some times they are short, rude and quick to get you out... busy or not!   But I will definitely keep coming when I'm in town

5HtrHQmDJYUca4WItV6wsA.text: This shit was so cash, ngl Bruv. Sushi burger like stepping into a time machine and discovering fire, that's how good it is. It is literally EVERYTHING. Pictures are pretty and all but ONCE you see it in person and take that first bite, it is truly heaven. Definitely coming back for another date night

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RiwSUenDGckiWVe_9cmwGQ.text: Been here a few times. The price is about the same for AYCE elsewhere. Food is decent, mussels were a bit overcooked and rubbery. Great service though and waiters/waitress kept refilling our waters which is a plus. For $26 dinner, I'd say go for it.

2y9bnaGoe6BjnE6s8AiBXw.text: Great service.  Came in specifically to try their "burgers".  Oh soooo good.  Had unagi one.  Only negatives was that it was a bit greasy and filling.  Being chinese, it brought back memories of when we would cook rice on stove and the bottom of the pot was stuck with crunchy rice.  We would scrap it up and add a piece of meat or dip in a gravy/sauce.  A delicious one bite morsel!  Would love to go back for their burgers and/or try their AYCE sushi menu.   That looked great too :) Definitely cannot do in same trip.

4knL7zt_Nel9HmeTDJOUvw.text: Great location,  tasty sushi, fresh, fun time . We came here with 4 friends and ate like kings

oCvbejlFko_8Ke-wSgvM0A.text: Excellent friendly staff. First sushi place I went to in Vegas and I won't have to look else where. Can't wait to try their happy hour specials and it looks like they're open till 2 am. I'm one lucky guy to live 2 blocks away!!!!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gReA8PVVTtPjaCW2Jl14aQ.text: Great sushi at good prices, I went there many times for lunch and dinner. Their fish is fairly fresh and their service is good too, but sometimes they will have some servers working there that don't care as much about the business and that's why I rate this one 4 stars. The manager should be able to identify when servers are not performing accordingly. But putting the service apart and taking a close look at their food, I really like their no write sushi options and all you can eat deal. You can't go wrong with all you can eat if you are that hungry.  Thanks to their commitment to build a better restaurant,  is they have acquired their alcohol license, allowing customers to enjoy a crash Sake, or a Japanese beer while dining there. This is a good option if you are looking for something affordable and safe.

GJRaywTHFJkZ0-FPFPVHUA.text: you know it's a good time ... when you finish eating and you didn't take any pictures of your food, but you can't stop ranting and raving about this place.  JJANGA you did it !!!  It started right when we came in and met Ellen.  Talk about knowing how to treat your customers right.  She was very personable and welcoming.  This was our first time, but we felt like this was our normal hangout spot.  We started off with drinks at the bar and it kept getting better from there.     We decided to try hibachi and met Tony ... he was awesome and kept us entertained and cooked us a scrumptious meal.  Not gonna lie we were a loud group being just the three of us but I think we kept him entertained as well.    Our group each tried one of the specials so we got a variety of meats and seafood and our recommendation is try try try everything !!!   For drinks I recommend the grapefruit sake ... Probably dangerous because it was so delicious but you gotta have sake when you eat right ???     Overall it was sooo fun and I would definitely recommend you bringing friends and loved ones here.   If you see Ellen, the manager say hello and buy her a shot she works hard !!!  Oh and Tony too ... Thanks for a great time JJANGA !!!

aRQvt6J8hvUrC2Ar3nINbw.text: I have been to the other Jjanga location, which is good, but I have to say this was great. The sushi chef was friendly and fast with our orders. The fish was fresh and all of the food tasted excellent. This isn't close to my house, but I will definitely make the drive for quality AYCE.

fa7Dii5L9ES7Et3NAg3KSg.text: This is a AYCE fine dining restaurant. Lol. The options were endless, presentation was top notch and food was delicious! We came on a Saturday when they opened at 11am so we had the place all to ourselves. We had an awesome time stuffing our faces.   The staff took orders after orders with a smile and obviously lots of patience from fickle minded me. I was quite overwhelmed coz I felt that I didn't order fast enough and I forget what I ordered!!!! One item here and there instead of the the normal "writing down your order on a slip and have it for reference". Other than that, I ate everything I ordered and craved for more but with kids, it's almost impossible to enjoy and eat enough food at a AYCE.   I recommend you get the dinner AYCE menu. It's available any time of the day and It includes dishes that is not available on the lunch menu.   Example, oysters, sea urchin, (it's printed in red on the menu). I would also recommend you to not come too hungry to a point of being delirious (hurhur) so you can pay extra attention to the menu and what this awesome restaurant has in store for your tastebuds and your money's worth of food.  We didn't, so we will be back. For now I'll leave you guys with pictures. My baby is screaming for my attention now. Lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango mochi, green tea and red bean ice cream
Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy tuna crunchy roll
Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried baby octopus! This was Delicious!!!

2CZU8yvM9miXLricppG8JA.text: This place is delicious! We decided to come for a teppanyaki dinner and we were able to be seated right away. We came on a Thursday night and The sushi bar seemed to be more crowded than the teppanyaki side.   John was super kind and created a show as well as a wonderful dinner. I would definitely request him next time I go.   We ordered the jjanga special as well as the two item entree. The shrimp cracker appetizer (which kind of tasted like crab) was super yummy and was a great start to the dinner. Wasn't a big fan of the salad but the soup was unique and yummy! For the entree we had shrimp, lobster, filet, and chicken. What I like was that if you paid $9.99 extra, you could get an extra order of soup, salad, rice, and noodles and then share the entrees.   Since it was super filling we did not get to try desserts but there's always next time!!

aOEjxSjUNt4wBW_bSWhtjA.text: First time here, based upon the recommdation of a co-worker. Atmosphere is nice, several grilling stations as well as a bar and the obvious sushi bar. They do AYCE but do not offer half rolls which is a drawback, in my mind, when exploring a new menu. The menu is fairly deep offering selections based upon spiciness,  tempura,  baked, deep fried and more though 'spicy' is a featured word on the menu. The servers were pleasant,  efficient and the food pretty good.  If you're in the area,  stop by but a bit out of the way for me to be a regular.

uILFQ7hJ41SeZjvlljP-Cw.text: Wonderful service. The coconut shrimp was the best roll. I enjoyed the baby octopus and garlic wings on the appetizer menu.

VK31LVnjEoHTRzs9HzxpKg.text: Alex was our server and he provided great service. Good sushi deals and very kid friendly. Love the Korean ice cream sandwich!

3LHFxb5KorFAXJT3DCuWcA.text: Love the sushi burritos, i think the best in town. The sushi is very good. Costumer service is good but sometimes takes to long to get the order.

GFmSpchEWJuAqSy7B6bdJQ.text: Awesome, fun, and delicious hibachi restaurant! Hip and a great place to hang out or celebrate a special occasion! Ask for Jojo, he's a blast!!

MrbzlPoFOJwM38FmNdoV3w.text: Place is amazing, great happy hour deals and delicious ayce, will always be coming back to this place to hang/eat with friends! Love the manager ellen, shes the best

PVjj73IR3PdgUVa39OfugA.text: I'm a huge fan of this place. Since my significant other is Asian and forces me to eat at every Chineese, pho, hot pot and dim sum spot in Vegas (can we go out for a steak or burger? Of course not...). I can say this is the one place I will never try and get out of going to.  The sushi is excellent for the price, the staff is extremely friendly and the atmosphere is fun. I travel quite a bit for work and always try and find a good sushi spot. Nice to know that Jjanga is at the top of that list and it's right here in Vegas.

OJgHPnHDb5gNJtrX3XUreQ.text: So came back today for AYCE and man was it a crappy experience. We waited forever after everytime we ordered and it was the host who took our order twice and we waited about 10 minutes for someone to come bring us our check. The down time today was really nuts and there was plenty of staff.

EeWZxgMEBXq0j_jr4aU98Q.text: My wife and I recently moved to this part of town a couple of months ago. We found his place one time on a whim. We walked in and were completely surprise. We didn't expect this kind of restaurant so near us. It was full lively well decorated. They have the hibachi still cooling as well as some of the best sushi I have eaten in Las Vegas. It is a good place for just 2 people or a big group. Definitely worth trying out.

AzosAuwBUdFSaul5797Jgg.text: First time here all the sushi was fresh and good.  Will definitely be back. Great food as well as great service. A lot of choices on the menu and they all sounded delicious. Would recommend for anyone with a big sushi appetite!

0dWzJOYEuK4Wb1vi93Y8_w.text: This place is great! Jay was a very attentive server and we got to sit right next to the sushi bar and watch the chefs! First time I've ever seen a girl sushi chef, says alot about their restaurant culture that they just care about the kraft which by the way was WOW try the lox roll

yPz7GWEG_5hKh0EEMGaJuw.text: Great spot and super close to the house!  Friendly staff every time we eat here AND they got teppanyaki tables!!

67Nqe9jHlZuwjte7rIZ6aw.text: For dinner, it was around $26 for an all-you-can-eat excursion. Prior to dinning at JJANGA the idea of AYCE sushi was never appealing to me. However, boy did my perspective change after visiting! The provocatively named dishes were hilarious, very vegas-esque, and delicious. The menu had a very nice variety. I was very pleased to know that I could have as much mochi ice cream as my heart desired and as my stomach could contain. Although, the mochi was $2 and some other items on the menu were pricey, so I would suggest not dinning a-la-carte.   The staff members were very friendly and extremely patient. I would definitely dine here again the next time I visit the area!

R9iHKYyI4G9SxjHCI_QKzg.text: Ordered to go: Burger sushi was good. Burrito sushi was way too much rice. The rest of the sushi was just ok. Rice was a little bit over cooked and load of rice on everything. If I ever go back there again, I have to make sure to request easy rice. Moderate service.

60xUqPPob9xKDq5q_Vlwpg.text: Quality of fish - 5  Service - 3  So you average the big 4!   Why is it when you go to a sushi spot that they ALWAYS forget to bring things to the table? You strategically try to time your orders to overlap so there is a constant flow of food to the table and then like clockwork about 30-40 minutes in there is like a huge 15-20 minute pause of people sitting around holding their chopsticks going wtf?! Its usually because a few orders were over looked and now everybody is ready to go home and tap a nap and not finish eating. If Jjanga could get the quality of service down as good at the quality of fish then id always be here. Im so glad they opened the new location in the Southwest though... i wont stop going, just not as often.

Ae0ihOuNIwyj-FO_hGj7oQ.text: Everyone has a, "go to," sushi place, and this one is ours. My boyfriend and I come here anytime we have date night. It's usually always steady and the servers are always attentive. We rarely ever have to wait long for the food we order and they never mess up. Which unfortunately happens to us almost every time we venture to a new sushi place.   They offer half rolls at the bar, and my favorite part is the deserts. AYCE ice cream come included, which is awesome considering everywhere else we go they give you one tiny scoop of ice cream and you leave with your sweet tooth completely not satisfied.   Their cuts of nigiri are rather small, but so fresh tasting and the flavors are on point. Which is big for us because it is 90% of what we eat when doing AYCE, besides, is size really that important when it's AYCE?   The rolls I've only had a few of, but they've never disappointed.   The music is your typical K-Pop mixed with modern day Kesha/EDM type, they also offer Karaoke in the room next door along with teppanyaki.   Fresh fish, delicious selection, awesome deserts, and great service. What more are you really looking for in sushi?

c4laNnT0WvB_qEw0dKGyaA.text: Love this place! Hibachi and Sushi are definitely something you have to try! I've been coming here for a couple years and the service is always top notch!

ByHCy-Vck1zMs4i1Q5DqTQ.text: Jjanga is so clean and has such great service!! Definitely recommend the sun devil roll and the late night happy hour is great!!

r4bnZy3xRfjnqzZyD6FMMA.text: Very good sushi place. AYCE is a must! Customer service is excellent and sushi came out quick. Would definitely come again.

afCJrMwrzYJlVkovVZEoEg.text: Came in around 9:45pm to try the sushi burgers with friends. Asked the waiter how big the burgers were- he said, "One will fill you up." We doubted him (because we love to eat) but he was right. Tried the karai burger. It was delicious!! Honestly thought it was gonna be all hype but I genuinely loved it. The ambiance is also 5 stars. Super cute and chill decor, Early 2000s r&b/hip hop playing (also our fave), and the servers were so friendly. All the waiters check on you, not just your own server. Definitely coming back to do AYCE because there are SO many rolls!!

YLrtwP7VrZqPxlc-KNBKxA.text: Two words: Sushi. Burgers.   The food was fresh, good, and happy hour was a great deal. This will definitely be a regular spot.

FTMO3yE4uZhRGTbF9wm-mQ.text: We like to come her for Habachi and love that we can get sushi at the Habachi table also.  Some of the wait staff are not to friendly but this last time we had a very nice waitress and we love our Habachi chef. We seem to get the same guy each time we go. He's funny. The sushi prices are really good. The Tuna Karai was really good. This place has a lot of options Habachi tables, regular table area, bar area and sushi bar. Love this place.

u3Yb2DYNi71jw4-ZmONJPg.text: Big changes at jjanga sushi and not for the good either. Slow service poor quality in fish . We said something and server said oh ok. Had to hunt for service tonight. Jjanga get you act together. I think we may need to find a new place over an hour sitting and we had to cancel our order and leave.

2ni08dyreWt031Fi6zCeqQ.text: Great AYCE menu! All the classic sushi staples and even some interestingly new/different options. The super white tuna is AMAZING!!

lN-G1JLIES16vXL8IRJgbw.text: This review is only for the sushi side of Jjanga. There are a ton of AYCE sushi places in Vegas so in order for a place to stand out it has to be amazing. For me, Jjanga is amazing in some ways but have some areas they could use on improvement - thankfully some areas that can be addressed almost immediately. My friends & I stopped by for lunch on a Saturday & the price being at ~$20 was definitely amazing. Not only does their menu include what you'd see at a typical AYCE sushi place (nigiri, rolls, appetizers) but it also has a section for sushi burritos & they have fries which is different. So the $20 definitely goes a long way. In terms of the sushi, the fish tastes fresh however there seems to be something different when it comes to the rice.. the only way I can describe it is the rice seems to break apart when you try to pick the sushi up with your chop sticks leaving a huge mess & also the fish seems to separate extremely easily from the rice. Something just seems off.. The appetizers were okay. The edamame tasted old & the fries were nothing special but what do you expect, it's a sushi place. It also took way to long to get appetizers (around 20 min) that we didn't even want to order another round cause we knew it would take forever. The service was a little sparse & it seemed like our table as well as a few other tables were left wondering when someone would be back. The dessert includes four different ice cream flavors which you can choose as many as you want & it was actually really good ice cream.   Overall, the fish itself was comparable to what you get in other sushi places in Vegas & the dessert is great ice cream. However, the assembly of the sushi doesn't seem right with the rice, the service is not amazing although everyone is extremely nice!  The appetizers do take a long while so if you're planning on ordering something do it at the beginning. All in all, I would come back because of the variety of choices on the menu & the price!

NmNu23gX-VlGH0pvtFi9pQ.text: The unagi burger was delicious. The eel here is pretty good. Loved it!!! Must try if you're in town!

ogwvhpNOVcHNg73nEPkQyA.text: Can't say enough good things about this place...the all you can eat option is awesome. Extensive menu including appetizers and dessert and specialty items like oysters. If you're super hungry it's so worth the price. We easily eat more than what we pay for. Never been disappointed with the taste or quality and the service is always great. Highly recommend this sushi joint.

The signature rolls are definitely unique if you're looking for something different to try. I give J Janga a 5/5, and I'm here at least twice a month.

SV8OZ0gDvtbmbzJNQITE0Q.text: This is my new favorite sushi spot in Las Vegas. I looked up the reviews on yelp before coming and let's just say it did not disappoint! We got the A.Y.C.E. Sushi. The service was prompt and the sushi was excellent. We will definitely be back.

A9e3JGUFlMK7CDhGbwpN1A.text: Wonderful  food.  Quick  and easy  place. One waitress  was a little  snobbish  when  I asked  for the  check because  she didn't  wait on us.Well we really didn't  have  a waitress.  The hostess  helped  us. So sorry  I didn't  want  to skip  out  on the  bill.

yqWWmEDhIWK1C2CPS-kAzQ.text: I'm VERY disappointed in my service tonight. I come here all the time for sushi and love it. Tonight I had hibachi for the first time in a long time and our chef obviously knew the other guests at the table. He gave me and my two friends a far less amount of rice, veggies, & meat then the other guests as he made multiple rounds on their side of the table. He also cooked the other guests food before ours and after they got their food, he started cooking our steaks. Due to the large lack of attention to our side of the table I wasn't able to get words in onto how I wanted some of my food prepared, even though I told the server beforehand as well. I just felt like it was uncomfortable that we had to listen to them making plans to hang out the upcoming days and only talking to each other. The food was good, but the service made the experience very unenjoyable.

xtndQ5hQKtKTxyc6Zb1kuw.text: My friend introduced me to this place and everything was great the first time around.  First time we went, we sat at the bar. Service was quick. At the end of the meal, my friend and I saw they had a deal where if we rated them 5 stars and showed our server that we would get a sample of the Korean cream cookie or what not. I tried to ask a server how that works and they said they don't sell it and didn't carry it, so I'm confused! Instead I settled for red bean ice cream.  Second time my friend and I came not even in a week's time, this time we sat at the tables closest to the wall and away from the teppanyaki tables. Service was a little slower but expected because we were not at the bar. Our beverages were filled constantly which I really appreciated. Means the busser/server was actually keeping an eye out for us   However dessert time came and I ordered red bean ice cream again however I was not PLEASED AT ALL! I don't know how long that ice cream has been used but the red beans were SOUR! Definitely a no no for me. Might be a while before we even consider coming back here.

2T91kmBW37QGmaqQyye2rg.text: I have to give credit where credit is due - positive changes in the service & improved quality in sushi inspired an updated review.   The fella talked me into giving them a try again, since he always had good hibachi. I was hesitant, wanting AYCE sushi, and had terrible sushi the last couple of visits.  The one downside we found out upon walking in, is that I couldn't do AYCE sushi on the hibachi side- and the fella can't have hibachi at the grill on the sushi side -so minus a star before being seated. Once seated, service was great; refills on point, no asking again & again for things or wondering where dishes were, all much improved from times before.  Sushi side: I tried the yuzu yellowtail, the veggie screaming "o" salad and the Burning Your Ass Roll promising spice. My mind has been changed on their sushi- tasty and fresh all around. Good spice and textures on the roll - getting that one AGAIN. The salad was a little clunky and over-dressed, maybe a squeeze of lemon or chopped tomatoes to cut the richness would have made it perfect. All-in-all I am looking forward to coming in for AYCE sushi for another try.  As usual, a good hibachi experience... actually, the our food off the grill was better than before - they used a different butter/oil that was not the pink-ish one they used to use, and the result was a very tasty mix of veggies, noodles, medium rare filet steak and DELISH rice... really good rice!  There's a little work needed to strive for gold, but I give my most recent experience here a solid silver and much improved.

FwXIDQy6iTDROxBlB8AXOg.text: 3.1.17 4:00pm One chef was not friendly, no smile, rude, not happy to be at work & the other barely looked up.  We were the only two at the bar & there were two small tables, not busy at all.  We ordered All You Can Eat $25.95, usually a great deal as you see from my previous reviews... however Koo Koo was not on this shift who is the best.    Also there was a horrible stench of sewer like the sink was backing up behind the sushi counter.  I would've walked out, but we didn't smell it until after ordering.  The Age Dashi Tofu was horrible.  Fried tofu in a soupy mess so the fried part melted off.  $3 of wasted calories.    The FreshMen riceless roll was watery & had too much radish & only a sliver of avocado for the whole roll.  I usually get this to so I know what it's suppose to taste like.  $9  Something Wrong 69 is also our usual, but was just ok.  $9  The best part was the small seaweed salad $4, salmon & yellowtail sushi, 2 pcs $4.  Wonder why when I ordered 4 salmon we got seven pieces not eight.  Also we never got the octopus & the sushi in the right fridge was better than the sushi bar fridge on the left cause our second plate of sushi was ok.  Nothing special.    For $63, All you can eat was not worth it this time, thankfully we had a large sake!  Very sad to say I won't be back for awhile.  Quite awhile.  Horrible experience.

9BIf-ekib5zFxrSXDog1YA.text: Provides AYCE (all you can eat) and a la carte services with a wide variety of sushi's, meats, and desserts to choose from. Service was exceptional; our waiter and waitress came to our table frequently considering we did AYCE for lunch.   When I usually go to a new restaurant, I tend to ask what their popular items are and our server was able to do just that. He recommended the Something Wrong #69 (which we got- it was ok) and also pointed out the "No Rice Roll" section (we got the Freshmen- it was alright). My boyfriend and I loved their Grand Canyon sushi which is listed under their "Baked Rolls" portion. The dynamite topping was soo yummmm, which reminded me of a sushi roll that we both seem to always order back home in Hawaii.  Overall, we're satisfied of their quality of sushi; fresh, tasty, and affordable!

x3pCD9OiZvgVCDFrzE_ETA.text: Little man wanted sushi but requested to try out a new sushi place for vday. Yelped some and VOILA here starts our dining experience.   The decor was different from other sushi houses. It didn't seem dim and the restaurant had more of an open feel. They have a bar near the entrance that allows you to enjoy a cocktail while waiting.   We arrived at the perfect time because it wasn't busy YET! They have both sushi tables and tepan tables so you could enjoy either. We opted for a sushi table. Our server greeted us promptly and took our drink order. The food came out quick, really quick actually. So either they were prepared for tonight or they just got the food prep down. Quality of sushi....fresh! Sweet shrimp, yuzu yellowtail, garlic tuna and uni!  I tried the Q roll which is one of their riceless rolls and wasn't a huge fan, a bit disappointing. I had heard alot about the riceless rolls so i was curious. The white fish thry used tasted tough and cooked so definitely not the flavor i was expecting. The AYCE menu is larger than the other AYCE spots I've been too, so I was able to try a lot more dishes Vs just sushi or nigiri.  Service was great, they work more as a team there it seems. So you don't just have one server, but multiples.   Looks like we found another AYCE joint.

oBE85_yEzu7tydFo7SdLEQ.text: Been a little sushi obsessed lately so here I am writing another review for yet another sushi establishment. Sorry, not sorry. Like others who have reviewed before me, this is an all-you-can-eat type place, so snobs need not apply. You get good, tasty, creative sushi for a good price, and that's all I require.   Not only is the bang for your buck good here, the service is also great. Bringing out plates and clearing as you go; always coming back to take your next order. I love that they don't rush you out and give you time between each dish. The ENTIRE MENU (minus the very few items in red type) is on the all-you-can-eat menu. So, go ahead and get 6 orders of potstickers... you and your $20 deserve it.   The potstickers were crispy and not greasy. Definitely a top appetizer choice. Some of my favorite rolls are the Yellow Yellow, Sexy Time, and the Fresh Men Roll. First two are spicy, last one is no rice. All amazing and different.   There is a lunch special menu as well that mainly consists of Sushi Burritos and poke bowls, but looks scrumptious, although I haven't tried it yet. Also, if you aren't in the mood to gorge yourself you can always order a la carte. Although, if you decide to get more than two rolls, you might as well go all-you-can-eat.   All in all, a great quick spot to pop by for lunch during the day, drinks in the evening or a date night. Great atmosphere and music. Definitely will be a regular given how close it is to my workplace. Dangerously close? Probably.

O72wiZsOiDAujXOphbCQDQ.text: I used to work next to jjanga and really only took advantage of their bar, which was always fun and a good time. Since I've moved on, my family and I have dined with jjanga, hibachi style, and have never been disappointed, ever. Even the pickiest of kids get down in the food and entertainment.  Last night, the wife and I got to go out to eat, no children!!! Instead of hibachi, we finally were able to sit at the sushi bar and have some fun. Our hostess, Ellen, made us feel like we were VIPs, always making sure our glasses were full and really cultivating that welcoming atmosphere. She truly excels in making her guest feel like family. She makes it look easy.  We started with crab balls, which were perfect. Spicy edamame was a great snack. Grapefruit sake.... More please! We started off plain Jane sushi wise, with a delicious rainbow roll and some halibut and Ono. Everything was perfect with the ono being the star.. Then we tried the candy cane roll, the Hawaiian, and a riceless Naruto. All delicious, with the candy cane really being the all star of the whole night. We then moved into shrimp tempura rolls, something wrong #69 (at the sushi chef's recommendation) and another great roll that I can't recall the name of... Wife tapped out here and left me with a lot of sushi to down myself, I really didn't have any problems!!!! We finished with a few rounds of shots, some strawberry mochi, and positive vibes.  Jjanga had really become one of my go to places. The kids love it, they treat you like family, and the cuisine is way above par. Very, very great. I'm already looking forward to next time.  Also, many kudos to the restaurant staff, especially the sushi chefs and the bussers. We walked in around 7 and the place was slammed. Fully packed house, and everyone was polite and welcoming. They didn't transcend their stress to the guest, which is huge. The sushi chefs had tickets up the wazoo, but you would never know. They were calm, cool, and collected, and we just watched them pump out beautiful roll after beautiful roll all night long.  Shaun

sce-Yypt5CzGjShdML8IIQ.text: I love their sushi here, it's always worth it to opt for the all you can eat versus just paying by the roll because you will be left wanting more after that first bite!  The service was great and my water cup was never less than half. The wait for food wasn't that long and the atmosphere was dope, they even had a couple hibachi tables for all you Benihana folks. I was happy with all the rolls I ordered (5) and even helped my dad finish his, even tho it's against the all you can eat rules but he needed the help and I do what I want. If I could, I would make myself throw up just so I could have more room in my tummy to eat more of them bomb ass rolls! But that's wasteful af and I figured I've indulged enough, I gots to chill. By the end of the meal, I was too stuffed for dessert and went into a food coma, which means it definitely was an amazing meal!   Awesome sushi place to go to off the strip, it's cheaper and less crowded.

-VJ8_2T9IF8AVKDBZ-G1sQ.text: They get the fourth star for the recycle material of their go containers.  I was impressed with that.  Not so much that they sent it in a plastic bag - but better than most.  Don't bother ordering the side salad.  It was like a few leaves of lettuce and some shredded carrots.    Sushi was okay.  A little warm for my taste, but I was ordering from home.

h9B2qI88TKEdcVuxuV2iow.text: Jjanga   I saw a video on Facebook about this sushi burger and thought to myself - I had to have this! It's a different concept from the usual sushi, sushi burrito, sushi bowls. What made my burger amazing was the deep fried rice bun.   This burger will fill you up. I barely finished it and it's only $9. I tried the Karai burger which had spicy tuna, spicy soft shell crab, salmon, cucumber, lettuce and special sauce. It was too big to just take a bite out of so I ate everything separately. Still amazing.   Also, there is a Korean Ice Cream Sandwich with red bean, vanilla ice cream and Mochi for dessert. It's free if you write a review. I wasn't too big of a fan of this dessert. It tasted a bit stale.   Overall great customer service. I would come back here to try another burger.

AFV6pvPL9rsNlyQ-jffE2A.text: Love this place. I've been here so many times and it never disappoints. AYCE  the best in Vegas

KZW4yL5aAHVtVKb9Jkup5w.text: OBSESSED! (And honored this place is my 100th yelp review btw!) I am dubbed a "sushi snob," but this is seriously my new Japanese go-to for AYCE sushi! We just moved and are new to the area, were very skeptical about trying new places (and only ended up here because SOHO on Jones are closed!) -- but we've been here TWICE in the last two weeks because it's THAT good!  All-you-can-eat lunch (from 11:30AM-3:00PM) is $20.95, and dinner until close is $25.95. SO WORTH THE PRICE! They have a very extensive menu with appetizer side dishes, soup & salad, special sashimi, nigiri sushi, vegetable rolls, hand rolls (sushi burritos!), classic rolls, no rice rolls, and a looong list of shrimp tempura rolls, spicy rolls, baked rolls, non-spicy special rolls and deep fried rolls! Did I mention they are open until 2:00AM?! (Last call for AYCE is at 1:30AM btw!)  I highly recommend... APPETIZERS: - Golden scallop (one order per person) - Who's your daddy (I think they took this off the original menu recently) - Vegetable tempura - Dynamite - Crab ball - Cocaine (special sashimi) SUSHI: - Grand Canyon (I think this is my favorite!) - Dancing eel roll (This is like butter! So smooth!) - Jjanga special roll (They took this off the menu, but if you're lucky the chef at the bar might make it still!) - Spider roll (A classic you can't go wrong with) - Johnny roll (No rice roll with a nice twist!) - Surf & Turf roll (So many flavors in this one!) - Salmon nigiri (All their nigiri listed below is SO fresh!) - Salmon belly nigiri - Uni nigiri - Albacore nigiri  - Cajun albacore - Cajun tuna albacore - Oysters (one order per person)  PRO TIP: They also offer hibachi teppanyaki on the other side of the restaurant, and have a full bar as well!  YELP TIP: Write a yelp review and get an asian ice cream sandwich for FREE! Omg, so good! Ice cream x red bean paste in a waffer sandwich!

ZrxVmr0-v7cJ_z-a5exjwA.text: AYCE AYCE AYCE. My have we missed Vegas simple for the AYCE.  We normally frequent a rather well known in the east side of town on Maryland, but we were by IKEA and decided to try something new. This place did not disappoint.
