VbE2qhUnyUnVoFduhcDDjA.text: We've been coming here for quite sometime now, since around the time it first opened. We have never have a bad experience here, ever!   I could talk about all the times we have come here and how amazing the sushi was, but today was my first experience here when it comes to Teppanyaki.   We walked to the front door and it was jammed packed inside. Barely even enough room to get by anyone, just to check in. The atmosphere was loud but friendly. Wasn't obnoxious by any means, since there are TVs on both sides of the restaurant and its a popular spot so we expected the place to be crowded. We scooted past the ton of people up front and made contact with the hostess.    This is where it started off a bit rough. My wife made reservations for 4 and when we checked in we told them everyone was here. We had four people in our party (Me, the wife, and our two boys). This was for my sons 11th birthday party. They told us it would be a few minutes and it was. They called my wife's name and they walked us right past the Teppanyaki tables. Me and the wife looked at each other and though "where are we going?". My wife flagged the lady down and asked where we were going. We advised the hostess we had reservations for Teppanyaki table. Well, they walked us back to the front and told us to wait a few seconds. Another lady came up to the hostess and said that we only made reservations for two people. The wife and I looked at each other again with confusion (there could not be a mistake on this on our end).   Soo a few seconds later, the hostess walks us (all four of us) to the Teppanyaki table and sat us down. We were sat down right on time with our reservations and there was plenty of seating available.   We ordered some drinks and looked at the menu.  The wife and I ordered the Grapefruit Sake and some waters. We have had this Sake before and its soooo good! We just keep getting this every time we comes here.   I ordered the 3 item dinner and ordered Scallops, Salmon, and Shrimp. Wife ordered the 2 item dinner, and she ordered Filet along with Shrimp.   Our experience was great, the "cook/chef" (don't know the exact term here lol sorry), was awesome. Pretty friendly and of course did all the fancy things they do when they make this type of dinner. Dinner turned out to be delicious and it was just the right amount of food. Heck, we had a bit left over so our 13 year old ate all what was left from our plates. Killed it!!   If this were my first experience here, I probably would have given it a 4 star rating but like I said before, we have come here a lot. That one little small hick-up was not enough to steer me to the 4 star category. I would recommend the Teppanyaki to those who haven't tried it here!   For us, the wifey and I will probably stick to the Sushi side like we always do but definitely will look into the Teppanyaki if we had a good group of people looking for this kind of experience/dinner.   Overall its amazing!! Always one of the first places I recommend to all of my friends for Sushi.   See you soon JJANGA!!!!!

-KbtXksFFCwJYtoLWDthxA.text: We were so excited to finally try this place! It was a perfect lunch spot during our Vegas trip, although it's a little far from the strip.   The All you can eat menu with a lot, and I mean a lot, of food options was a no brainer. The menu is neatly organized with different type of rolls & various categories. It made it very easy to order! So we went with that and also ordered the famous sushi burger.   The staff was very friendly and attentive. Service was speedy but because we beat the lunch rush on a Saturday.   The only reason I am not giving this restaurant 5 stars is because some of the rolls we ordered were not as tasty as they look. I feel like they should have been more savory but unfortunately they were somewhat unimpressive. Even the sushi burger was not as succulent as it looks on their instagram. Kind of Disappointing. However, the other rolls were good and I would get them again.   Parking is shared among all the other businesses in the plaza but it's a big lot so it's not a big deal.  Final verdict, will I visit again? Most likely only if I'm in the area and want a fairly priced AYCE sushi meal.

zeuewP1C1M_u04vSUIsIcg.text: My wife and I are assembling our new "Go To" list of restaurants since moving to Las Vegas. As a result we have been trying out restaurant, after restaurant trying to find that one "fill in blank" restaurant per category...Italian, Sushi, etc.  I consider myself a sushi snob after having taken a number of courses from well known sushi chef's, etc. Most sushi restaurants don't understand that it all starts with rice preparations.   Sooo I see on yelp that Jjanga has 1300 reviews with a 4.5 star rating. Wow this is a place I needed to check out.  My wife and I arrived at 4:30pm and were immediately taken to a table in front of the sushi bar. Our waiter quickly got our drink orders and answered a few questions we had.  The decor is upscale, fresh and open. The music was 80's & 90's. All in all set up a very pleasant environment. So far a very enjoyable start.  My wife ordered a plate of gyoza, veggie roll with sour cream, and a bowl of miso soup. The wife enjoyed the gyoza as it was crispy and not greasy. The bowl of miso soup had plenty of seaweed and tofu in the broth. She felt it was one of the best miso soups she had ever had. The Veggie roll came without the requested cream cheese. They took it back and had small pieces put on top of each roll. We were okay with that.  I ordered the All You Can Eat (AYCE) meal. Here is where they started dropping points in my mind. I ordered a Philadelphia  and Eel roll first. Along comes my wife's gyoza....then the veggie roll (which goes back) and then out comes the miso soup...I'm still sitting there watching my wife eat ( I told her she needn't wait). When they finally bring my wife's veggie roll back, I get served my two rolls.  Note: we were one of five (5) table with customers. One of five! Not busy here!  The rice was as it should be (big star here) and kept the roll from falling apart. The eel in the Eel roll was dry but okay. The Philadelphia roll was also okay. When the food had been dropped the waiter did not ask if I had a second order to be placed. He just dropped the two plates and immediately turned.  I waited with empty plates for almost 15 minutes before he finally came back to see if I wanted another course. I ordered a Dragon Roll and a Smoked salmon roll. I then waited....and waited....for another ten minutes. At which time the Dragon roll was delivered. This roll was quite good and the roll was moist and flavorful. Then I waited...and waited again. I had a waitress and waiter stop by to ask if I was waiting of an order. As soon as I said yes they were off and didn't ask if I wanted something. Eventually the Smoked Salmon was delivered. The waiter dropped it and immediately turned again without asking if I would want anything else. I finished the smoked salmon roll but couldn't really enjoy it. I was getting upset with the waiting game being played with regards to the AYCE. There is a total time of one hour and it was coming up on it.   As a waitress was walking by, I slide my seat back and got her attention. I ordered some eel & salmon. These were delivered right at the bewitching minute. When I had finished the 6 pieces of fish the waiter came to the table to ask if we were ready for our check.   I get it that the restaurant wants to limit the amount of food that someone might want to eat but that's the risk you take as a restaurant. You might get someone who can eat a sizable amount or one that eats much less than the cost. The AYCE price is typically the average of the two types of customers. To not visit a table to limit the food, also means that we were also not asked if our drinks needing filling, might need a napkin, if there was an issue, etc.  I so wanted this to be my "Go To" sushi restaurant. The obvious waiting game means that it won't be in the running.

nclodQ0FTb3g0PJ8oS-C6Q.text: Love this place!!! Great good, great ambiance and  great service!! Love that they have a decent happy hour menu even on the wkends!! I've come here twice for wkend happy hour and left super full and my wallet didn't hate me.... the baby octopus and sushi tower are my favorites. The house sake is delicious too and is on the happy hour menu!!! They even have a sushi burrito on the HH menu and that alone will fill me up! Take note,  they won't seat you unless everyone in the party has arrived.  The parking is a little iffy since they share it with so many other businesses but it's not a huge problem.

NHTkA2R8KKnnPcfst8NXAA.text: Happy hour is amazing.  Even normal prices are great.  Weird it's like hibachi (Benihana's) and everything else but just go for the sushi.  I'm from LA and we can't even get these prices there.  Like how the hell they get their fish to the desert and still make money off these prices?  We ordered a ton.  Sushi tacos. Sushi burgers (they're big!!!!!!! clock that, almost too big)  I like their oysters flavoring.  OMG their sizzling UDON is to die for!!!  I love yaki-udon and you can't get good versions hardly anywhere even in LA and they killed it for $5 happy hour.  Drinks are cheap too.  Like this place is a fun trip. So glad we stopped by here before getting maimed on the strip.

ct-Lnz8QfG5g6z6SsbAqtA.text: This was not a good experience for my family of seven there to celebrate my sister-in-law's birthday. Our cook wasn't very good at his craft.  I knew we were in a trying meal when he scorched the eggs in making fried rice.  Had I known about the fried rice (given a choice) I would have opted for steamed rice.  The steaks were not seared but were only colored with what looked like oyster sauce. It was first time for me that a chef poured a mayo based sauce on scallops. Perhaps that is how they fill the gap between traditional Japanese teppanyaki and what is popular with local tastes.   I can see why they don't offer free WiFi for guests. Otherwise we would be posting reviews throughout the meal.   On the bright side, our greeters and servers were friendly and quick to service our table.    I have heard that prior visits to Jjang were quite good. That is the main reason why we wanted to celebrate a birthday dinner on this night.  We are going to celebrate birthday cake and ice cream at home.  It will be our recovery attempt for a disappointing dinner.  Here is my verdict of my meal tonight.  Expected better and got the worst.

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My after dinner verdict.  Tasted more sauce than ingredients.

SpZRHfeZRhn6oVz1wUrY1Q.text: Just moved to this area and had some friends over & we wanted sushi. Nice clean overall welcoming establishment when we walked in. The hostess/manager Susan was all smiles and friendly which is half the battle these days when you go out to eat. Sat at a nice 1/2 booth 1/2 table in the corner. Our server was sweet & menu knowledgeable as well. I like seeing a well trained staff. The restaurant was clean prompt snd the dishes were good. We are always iso new decent food value & price point/ places to call home when we move to a new town so this will most definitely be on our list.

GEIOVLj8qjE3juPcUV9Avw.text: The sushi was fresh. I enjoyed the diverse all you can eat menu. The only issue I had is the location is very loud and the service is very slow. The place also needed a good cleaning. The alcohol bottles displayed over the sushi bar had a thick layer of dust on them.

g6ZUlXAxienwsa7j-KPNoA.text: We have been coming to this sushi spot for a couple of months now. We always tend to go in big groups and during our lunch time. The server always seems to be in a very bad mood. When we place our order she acts like if we're bothering her when it's in her job description to take our order. They are always short in staff and the owner is always runnjng around with the food because they don't have enough people working there. TSfcdrnI1vF-nu3La2aB2w.text: SUSHI BURGER (and fries)  Game changer!!! We are moving back to town and will be relatively close to the area. We are excited to put Jjanga down as a great sushi go to place. We got sushi burgers this trip. Neither of us have had one and we were not disappointed. Make it a combo with a soda and fries!

zKELVeERv_tkHKwB4Kiw_Q.text: I'm giving a two because the overall experience wasn't terrible. Based off of the dining experience alone it's hard to say if I'd come back. Nothing special. If the following didn't happen, I would have never thought to leave a review good or bad.   But with their bait and switch tactic and poor guest recovery from the manager, I'm sure I won't be back.   They claim to have happy hour after 10pm, $20.95 for AYCE. We called to confirm, they confirmed. Cool.   We show up just after 10pm, as our date night planned (we stopped for dessert first, sometimes you just gotta live life.) We're greeted pretty quickly and I order us waters and sake directly off the happy hour menu. Again confirming this $20.95 late night special. Sweet.   Our dinner passes with nothing abnormal. Had to ask for some stuff twice, but no biggie. Negi Hama was awesome while their nigiri was pretty sad small slices on top of gummy rice. But you get what you pay for right?  Well, not always it seems.   Shame on me after a few drinks throughout the evening for not inspecting the bill more closely. But when I woke up, my mind was still racing. Something didn't add up.   So I called the restaurant and quickly was being helped track down my receipt and the cause for the price disparity. The woman on the phone took down my information, but not without her tone to ensure I knew what a hassle this was for her.   But I was ready to forgive when I received a text with my receipt not too long later. Seems like it wasn't so difficult after all. I explained (the rest is via text mind you, she never bothered to call back) that there must have been some confusion, as you can see we were there for the happy hour price. Simple refund of the difference of $12 and we would be on our way. Maybe one day I would return for a late night sushi craving.   Life is never this simple. Turns out I had been duped. Their happy hour excluded any item they considered premium she was happy to point out with a :)   I asked if this is printed on the menu to which I received no direct response. This leads me to believe it isn't, but I'll happily be proved wrong if someone wants to actually answer my question.   I let her know our server absolutely did not mention any of this which seems odd as we immediately ordered happy hour and arrived shortly after 10pm. To any trained server it should have been evident that we were there for... drumroll please... happy hour!  Turns out this manager is more than pleased to train her staff on how to accurately do their jobs. Love to hear it. On the job training and continued education are crucial to most businesses. She's also more than willing to buy me a round of sake the next time I'm in.   Thanks for the offer! However it seems a bit unjust of a recovery compared to the $12 difference I was calling in regards to. After all their happy hour sake is $5 which is high compared to many other sake happy hours in town as it is. I'm not sure how asking me to come back to spend another $30 for my meal alone just for a free drink really adds up, but perhaps management needs training, too?  I'm just not impressed with anything I've experienced with this restaurant. Which is a shame because their Instagram photos really do excite the taste buds. But like the rest of social media, some things don't match up in real life.

-czP9lvAgV0YUzmmrLwJ7g.text: We were looking for a place to eat after 11pm and found this place. We love sushi and have really high expectations. At first we were a bit disappointed as my husband wanted AYCE and I wanted hibachi dinner. Well you can't do both so if we wanted to eat that we would need to eat separately. So we went for AYCR which I am glad we did. We truly enjoyed our dinner. We got to try a bunch of items and found out the food was excellent. Very flavorful and fresh! We will be back again.

ReGoju6TPPbZscTkwbokEQ.text: I usually hold off on writing reviews until I've been to a place a few times. With that said this place has been consistently great the first 3 times I've been. The last 2 times I've come it's been with parties of 11 and service has been great. All 3 times I've had Antonio as my server and I highly recommend u ask for him. The 1st time I didn't order a thing. He brought all his best recommendations and they were all great. It's awesome to go back to a place and honestly want all those same things that were recommended. The food has been fantastic every time. They don't overdue the rice content and don't go heavy handed on sauces which is important to me. Get the yuzu yellowtail, garlic tuna and baby octopus and you're off to a great start.

i6OdAdSrodckHa0wy-LNQQ.text: Coming from Hawaii im super picky about my sushi and I've lived here long enough to try a majority of the all you can eats. This place, hands down, thee best. Great menu, great prices, great service. Try the no rice rolls I had the spring mountain and fresh men. Yummy and not filling. This definitely deserves a best of las vegas stamp!

wS6XU0VtkEcHHDpC4IbEqQ.text: I came here for my birthday and it was a lot of fun.  The sushi was fresh and very tasty.  What I love about this place was our sushi chef, yes she was a woman and yes she was awesome!!!  I recommend the AYCE because they will make you whatever you want :). Oh, and if you like sake try one of their flavored ones, enjoy!

ozaJ2XtIa3uAZboiwcxGhg.text: I have eaten here 2x so far and I cannot say enough good things about this restaurant. The service is better than you would find in most restaurants on the strip. Every member of the staff is engaging and is genuinely concerned about your experience. The sushi is fresh, vibrant colors, creative combinations with clean flavors that take a fun modern twist on sushi. Fresh Men Roll & I Love my Ass are 2 of my favorites. Skip the soy sauce on most rolls as you can see they are often dressed as they should be already. If you've read this far, you're thinking of eating here, do yourself a favor and do it!...honestly, in this day and age the only reason to write a yelp review is if the experience is really good or bad. Las Vegas is full of average restaurants, this is not one of them!

1PqJ5j9Si9YKN9gyqpZa1w.text: I always feel at home here!!! Definitely my go to sushi place!! The sushi is always fresh. Best all you can eat in town

w7O6uPCMo6xtHwpARM-AsA.text: From the food (AYCE sushi or hibachi) to the service, EVERYTHING is A+++!!! I should probably add that I'm writing this review in a Food Coma! This is definitely my favorite sushi place whenever I'm in or near Vegas. Special shoutout to Ji who is exceptional and always goes above and beyond to make sure my boyfriend and I leave with full bellies and smiling faces!! :-) Thanks JJANGA!!

LwcZldB3BrwlqrwdUPM0fg.text: Can I give this restaurant 10 stars!! This place is amazing!! Literally the freshest AYCE sushi place ever! Service was a bit slow because of large parties BUT without having to mention it the manager Ellen was on it and took care of us her self! The girls were on it also! Team work had to be the motto here because the food was AWESOME AND THE SERVICE was PHENOMENAL! You couldn't even get upset the restaurant was on it beyond accommodating and literally the sushi melts in your mouth! The atmosphere was nice, music was loud enough so that I could hear my party, but not the next table! Honestly cant wait to come back!! Thank you for an amazing experience!!

renNNnalrhOLfEHLn4zYlQ.text: Amazing lunch specials ($3 - $8 rolls) and great quality. This is the perfect lunch spot when you are craving sushi but you don't want to break the bank.

jVAnjyq0TncCkS_rAw3jOQ.text: Excellent service & excellent sushi to go with it ! I'm always treated well here & would definitely recommend the double d or "tastes just like my ex girlfriend" roll. That's what they're named, I'm not even kidding, lol.

ATHUMmfutUVPNvetaW26WA.text: Great Mother's Day Sushi Dinner.  AYCE & the food was really good.  Our new go to sushi place.  Great atmosphere, food & service.

Yq0NXGxC_rL2n7VtRky59g.text: This place is my new favorite hibachi restaurant. Our chef Jim was so entertaining and great. The food was perfect. The waitress benja was so nice and spot on with her sushi recommendations. Can't wait to visit again!

hUsu80gRtQN2MqSGfOnGYg.text: one of the most underrated sushi spots in town. i almost never wait for a table or food, everything is so quick. the food n service are never lacking, consistently some of my favorite sushi.

zxwdWk7k4YvMaA0hXec0Lg.text: Can't say enough good things about this place!!! The food was delicious-we did the hibachi table (filet, shrimp, and chicken), and the service was just wonderful-in fact, perfect.They keep the energy very high and it's so enjoyable to be in. We were also lucky enough to have samples sent our way-that just made my night! When this place was kanji, we liked it-but now as jjanga we LOVE it! Will for sure be back-several times I'm sure. Hibachi and sushi, yes please.

Ah1p4Po4_z03Vd2WeNKW9A.text: This is my favorite restaurant in town. My husband and I eat here on average about once a week. Their sushi is delicious and fresh, and all at such a reasonable price it's easy to go all the time! The staff is very friendly, and it's a restaurant I would recommend to any sushi lover.

vTwpNoQBaECDGP4oyLFNYQ.text: The second location for jjanga on Decatur which I started to go before this one was opened. I go here  or the Decatur location depending on where I'm at. Very nice location and restaurant with hibachi. Fresh sushi that's always delicious with fun staff that's always in a good mood. My friends and I frequent this location as well as the one on Decatur. It's my favorite sushi place to casually or on a date. Would recommend to any sushi lover.

Xe_rXVFq6VMyYtNbfRPl2g.text: Fabulous place!  Jjanga's food is the best.  I've never had a bad experience there.  I travel to Vegas 4-6 times a year and always eat at Jjanga's

BwQw7mJ5tahAWrtxjRyx-g.text: First off, this is supposed to be a place to dine not dance, so when you have to yell your conversation to the people at your table your music is way too loud! We had been here a couple of times when it was Kanji then once when they switched right in the beginning and wasn't impressed then, but took another chance seeing all the 4 and 5 star reviews, which, I assure you is unfounded. It isn't the worst sushi joint that we've eaten at, but I would be hard pressed to say that it isn't pretty close to the bottom and we could never recommended it. Now on to the food...I usually try to find something positive to write in my reviews but I'm having a hard time coming up with anything. The only thing that was liked at the table was the seaweed salad, which I'm pretty sure they buy already prepared and a couple of the appetizers (Bulgogi and Shrimp Tempura). The rolls were small with paper thin stamp sized cuts of fish and unfortunately with most of them over powered with sauce. They have plenty of staff and all were very friendly except they all circle around the dining room like hawks waiting to pounce, felt like I was in prison being examined every couple of minutes. Don't get me wrong, I love an attentive wait staff, but not so much that they smoother you. The sushi chefs failed to impress in presentation of both the food and themselves, all being dressed in street clothes wearing backwards baseball caps, looking very disheveled and very young. Age and training could be the culprit here on the lackluster food as well as the constant hovering with the wait staff. At the conclusion of dinner with a small bowl of ice cream the the most disappointing part of the evening came to be...the check. Now mind you there weren't any mistakes, other than I felt what we were charged and paying for was far more then what we received! Sorry, we won't be back :(

UBtpXUB1arEDtfeEdxCH6w.text: My husband and I had very high hopes for this location because we have always enjoyed the sushi and service from the owner JJanga well before he opened his own locations. I think we dined on THE WORST NIGHT. First, the restaurant was HOT because one of the AC units stopped working. Second, the service was slow. No one came to our table to offer refills or to ask if we wanted another beer. I wanted more freakin sushi but didn't have a chance to order because again we weren't checked on. We had our two children with us and I had to walk to the bar to ask for refills of their beverage. After being there for an hour and still not being serviced my family got up and walked to the counter to pay. I mentioned my disappointment to the manager on duty and he response was that they will do better next time then I felt insulted with the fact he tried to compensate with giving my children Dollar Store toys for the kids. The service we received is NOT what we are use to from JJanga. I hope he reads this because I'm sure he would be mortified that his long time customers were treated so poorly.

Is5xVPo6I6NQb0oKCPYelg.text: Jjanga does it again! This time right in summerlin. Amazing food, great staff, great drinks (especially the grapefruit sake), excellent decor! Can't wait to go back!

RSV0yfy2F3Py2loIKKXKPw.text: This is a FIND... Stumbled in here as DW Bistro was closed on Monday...  I have never been one for all you can eat Sushi. My experience was not great flavors with a lot of rice & rules.  lol  Well This IS Totally Different.   The fish is So Fresh... The rolls are so unique.  There are rolls without rice. You can order cucumber salad, mushroom balls, mussels, & a plethora of wild and X-rated rolls.   There is so much to choose from and appetizers  and ice cream are included in the all you can eat.   This is a great find.  The atmosphere is cool, clean, comfortable & Very Hip!   Try it if you even kinda like Sushi:)  The Female Sushi Chefs are friendly in a no talking kind of way.  Seriously!!! They are The Real Quiet Women of Las Vegas!   Enjoy!

1CKdgt2H6nvvh3rbCAoQsA.text: Thank you jjanga for making my boyfriend's birthday a great one! Had 6 people here for my boyfriend's birthday dinner a couple of months ago for AYCE, and the staff at Jjanga did a great job helping us out. All of the dishes that came out were really delicious (sorry, i can't remember what we ordered since it was so much, but we basically went for everything that was "one item only," and then some sushi rolls!).   Some members of our group (actually, most of them) were late and they were really accommodating about seating us when most of us were there and letting us start with drinks, then ordering food when the rest of our group arrived.   The waitress was really great about putting the cake in the fridge for us and bringing it out with plates and forks. And no cake cutting fee! Thank you for that!   Good food and really great service. Be careful not to accidentally go to the decatur location! :b  Note: ama ebi does not come with the heads! sad times.

I'm writing this because they are offering a free ice cream sandwich if you show them the review. One con is have to choose either sushi or menu, you cannot have both. But all in all, great place to try out.

m444g4slIC31pAuwcxIwvg.text: Our most favorite sushi. We go at least once a month. Majority of the time it's pretty empty so we get our food fast. Service is always great and food is good.

ZN9PJlOx8wvOq-5eAkr0_Q.text: Great place, food came out quick. Sushi was amazingly fresh! Especially the garlic tuna, beautiful color! The volcano shrimp was delicious along with the butter salmon (melts in your mouth!) can't go wrong here!

O07jwhXU79NDrrzNlzGg6Q.text: Sushi was delicious! We went in for a girls night, so much fun. We had a few drinks at the bar before being seated, we did wait a few minutes before the bartender (who also greeted us at the hostess stand) appeared, she was so sweet and all was well. We sat down and did the all you can eat with 6 gals, there was a lot of food! Drinks were always full, food came out super fast and the plates were picked up pretty much as soon as they were clear. Everything was great, I did have a few pieces of fish that were a little tough to chew which is definitely not desirable,  however it was in one roll. The roll selection is awesome as well as the apps.  During our dinner, the woman who greeted us and was also the bartender brought us over a round of shots on the house which was so unexpected and fun, totally made the experience that much better! All around a great place, great staff, great food and beautiful space. Will be back!!

pap3jzqamR-nIXUhqyFPmw.text: I had a late lunch here on a Sunday. Place is roomy and nice. It has both a sushi bar and tables you can choose to sit. Even though it has an a la Carte menu, if you choose the all you can eat option, you order anything you like from that same menu. In other words, if you have some appetite when you go in, you can really fill yourself up with many different choices. I tried many items on the menu, it was awesome! I would definitely recommend this place. 5 full stars

AGoBy5uByqttdzzlKaE73Q.text: Despite the food being good the customer service is horrible .... not enough employees to fully cover all customers, we arrived at 2:50 and were only seated at 3:06.... after being asked what we like to drink we waited 20 more minutes for them, the drinks were misunderstood and put in wrong cups.... absolutely ridiculous, we will not be back!!!!!!

OHNly8L1PRg_c2K4rKRN2Q.text: This is my second time at this location. Service is great. We ordered the Cajun albacore, garlic tuna, yuzu yellowtail. It was all great. The nigri is great here. The rice to fish ratio is good.

48faoHylzRaUh3BFjYdejg.text: First time Jjanga and it was good! We had the AYCE menu. My favorite rolls were "threesome and TNT." I love that they had fried rolls, and labeled what was in /out the roll. The staff were nice and professional. The restaurant was very nice and clean. They're open pretty late on the weekends. I'll definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Threesome...yummy!

-J7HyZP3zq3naze1VZndaA.text: Very busy place but it was worth it! My husband and I went here for the first time for Hibachi and loved the experience. The host at the counter was so sweet and came around after the chef to make sure sure everything was good. We will be back to try the sushi!!! Can't wait

eGRHv2kOON_FNacc-4EP4Q.text: Only my 2nd time here, but good thing is that each time I was at each spot of the restaurant!   First time - teppanyaki side This was back in January celebrating a friend's bday. Their teppanyaki side has everything you would expect! Good seating around the stove, an entertaining chef, and most importantly delicious food! Idk if it was just this specific visit or not, but it definitely felt like that the food was not only cooked and prepped conserve but it was fast! I've been to other teppanyaki places before and it felt like forever before I was able to eat, but to my knowledge not here at jjanga!  Second time - sushi side I can say that this is now top 3 sushi places in Vegas for me. They have a huge selection and whats crazy is that they have items that I've never seen at other sushi restaurants! I also love that they have a specific "no rice" section for all the peeps that are watching carb intake! I'm a huge fan of fried rolls so to have a section labeled just for me, I was def awe struck.   All in all this a great restaurant, and a great venue weather it be eating alone at the sushi bar or hosting a party at either the teppanyaki or sushi side! Ambience is casual and the music they got playing are def songs you can jam out to while stuffing your mouth!

Fc7qzeVhzzif6LBmtgGKGA.text: I came in just before the typical dinner rush. Place is pretty big! The sushi was really really really good! Fresh. The nigiri had a nice rice to fish ratio (more like True Japanese nigiri). The rolls I had were amazing as well. A good mix of spicy and non spicy rolls!   ACYE is the price point you would expect.$21 for lunch and $26 for dinner. The only downside is that they dont offer half rolls even with AYCE. Not good for someone who comes solo.

lXGRK9WILWL8HgUXyHBo2A.text: Friendly staff. Slow food service . Literally got two orders then had to wait 30-45 minutes for the next orders. So the server wrote down our orders and forgot an entire list twice. At least they are good at refilling waters. Don't think I'll ever try come back here.

VlX41ML7z_3pvxWjBOS3CQ.text: A great spot for AYCE sushi I feel on the SW part of town.  They have a vast selection of items that all persons can enjoy.  Fish is always fresh and rice is never over cooked and flavored just right.  I tend to always stick with my normal routine but when I decide to tread the unbeaten path they have plenty of rolls that I may choose from as well as a generous amount of items that come from the hot kitchen.  They also have habachi grills that seem to always be busy whenever I wonder in. Although I have not tried the habachi food it looks and smells great

xgDrnbV-NUpZySJcb_9Wog.text: The place lives up to the hype! Their salmon, spicy crab/tuna and bulgogi are on point. Sooo stuffed with just one burger as well very big portions!

EfcV72hi0z77pCiMAPsIxQ.text: We were seated in time to enjoy the extensive happy hour menu. Loved everything and tried some new.  Our server recommended the tuna tostadas, so fresh and light! My son loved the high roller roll and seemed to be a favorite of our table.  For fans of sushi, it is a must stop in Vegas, we will definitely be back!

rlp87Njya6oBB5nraflaUA.text: I really like this place. We've diner here for All You Can Eat Sushi and the Teppanyaki Grill. Both were very good and the pricing is all very reasonable.   Ally You Can Eat is $25/person with a large selections of items and they have it every day. We tried around six rolls as well as the octopus appetizer and veggie tempura. Everything was delicious. We were also surprised at how quickly they were able to get everything out considering how busy it became and how good everything looked. The octopus appetizer was really good and worth trying. It was fried and then coated in teriyaki sauce. I'd say the two most memorable rolls were: Japanese Lasagna and The Sun Devil. The veggie tempura was also very good and the right portion.   If you have an opportunity to try their teppanayaki it too is worth it.

NZVCnMVk-zDAR0Ppm_kU8A.text: The sushi burger is so bomb! Can't wait to come back !! It's such a big portion for the great price!

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AjusY0EZ0JpSZ4CSnR-aDg.text: Yikes. This place has 4 stars with over 300 reviews?! Incredible. My boyfriend and I came to lunch here the other day and it was one of the worst sushi experiences I've had in a while. There was no hostess at the front when we walked in, so we stood around waiting for about 5 minutes (it was 12pm, not a weird time).  We were greeted by the hostess once she came out of the back somewhere and seated in the dining room. Our waiter was super nice and took our order promptly, but then got insanely busy-- he was the only server working and had over 10 tables at one point.  Needless to say this was a recipe for disaster. He forgot my salad, had to be asked 3x for lemons, and when we asked for our check we were held hostage while he was running around like a chicken with his head cut off tending to his other tables... forgetting to close us out.  Furthermore, the sushi was just not good. The tuna was very muscular, chewy and inedible. The spicy tuna roll was so spicy it was inedible (and that means a lot coming from me, I absolutely LOVE spicy). It was so spicy it left me wondering if they were trying to mask the flavor of old fishy fish or something.... anyhow, it didn't matter because the seaweed was so wet and gummy it was like chewing a fish flavored piece of gum with a ghost pepper wrapped in the middle.  My boyfriend had the salmon nigiri, yellowtail nigiri, and  tuna nigiri and he too said it was the worst sushi he's had in Vegas. The only reason I'm affording this place 2 stars is because I felt so sorry for the server. I mean, it's not his fault the restaurant was understaffed. We won't be coming here again.

a0i6fNkXB_Wx3VJy0U8yAg.text: We came in for Sunday brunch, and we enjoyed everything we ordered, including the service, our server Alex was really attentive, and nice! We ordered the oysters, yellowtail jalapeno, bulgogi rollers, sushi tower, and fish & chips! It was all delicious! And my favorite was the sushi tower and the bulgogi roller !!!

qLB7im6S1_2qdoBWVaNqhg.text: I am giving this restaurant 3 stars due to the following:  1. We let them know there was an onion allergy and they did not tell the chef. They just assumed there was no onion added.  2. I was told it would be a 15 min wait and we waiting for one hour. When we placed our order we were the only customer in the restaurant.  3. 45 min into my wait I ask a different server what the hold up is and he said it would be right out. I asked again if they reminded the team that  no onion was to be added and of course they didn't and had to start over.   4. This place is really dirty inside. Makes me think about the condition the food is kept in.   I am very disappointed.

I really liked the vibe and atmosphere of Jjanga it's really beautifully designed.

ycx8FGvzmSJB0Fm1l7K0ww.text: We definitely will try not to come back to this place. We went during lunch, where they only had one single customer else than us. There was no reason why the service would be so slow, but it was. They had one server and a manager looking lady and two chefs at the bar. We ordered miso soup and pumpkin soups and some appetizers to start off. Despite their empty restaurant, the foods came out cold and very late. When the nigiris came out, there was so much rice that we could not dare to start eating. We definitely did not eat all the rice and did not care if they charged us or not. The server said "oh really?" When we said the foods were cold, did not take any action about it or apologize. The nigiris were definitely tasteless since the fish was cut so thin and small.   When this place first opened, it was top notch, being rated the number 1 sushi bar in town. Couple years later, this place definitely cannot catch up the trend of new sushi restaurants like Neko or Sakana. If I am paying the same price, I would just drive a little further from house and enjoy good service and food from sushi neko.

TGNFLW7kFOArFfFQRO7ZIQ.text: Jjanga is an awesome sushi bar/teppanyaki restaurant with an inviting atmosphere. It has what you'd come to love and expect from a typical sushi place; however, Jjanga goes above and beyond to satisfy customers with outstanding service. I always opt for the All You Can Eat option, and I am never left waiting too long for my food to be prepared. A family friendly environment perfect for your night out.

GQ1hVr6vHDljIE9v8sxw3w.text: This has become my favorite AYCE sushi place in Las Vegas. The service is always great and the sushi comes out quick! We especially love when we get our favorite server, Susan. She is always so friendly and pleasant, especially to my lil nephews. I love their selection of appetizers, specials, no rice rolls, and especially their nigiri! Its always fresh and absolutely delicious! It is also great because they offer a stamp card for those frequent AYCE diners =)

zu48wwIjseQO4Oz6K1UUdg.text: I was starving after a long day work at the hospital so my gf and I decided to give Jjanga on Fort Apache and try. The flavors blend extremely well and doesn't get you over the top full which will allow you to try more things on the menu! I am definitely coming back just for the amazing overall experience.

Between the great service and the extremely fresh fish they serve, this location keeps me coming back time and time again.

W8opYgbC8d-GJ1TeSe71Fg.text: Food was good and prices were right. Came on a Sunday and there was brunch. Fun choices for japanese inspired brunch options. And they gave us a tower appetizer sampler for free which was very good. Only reason I didnt give 5 stars is service. They were polite but they are understaffed in servers. Food came out very slow and no utensils which should have been set when we sat down and not after our food was served. Free specials for yelp reviews. Will come back and change to 5 stars when that issue is fixed. More attention would result in better service but need at least 1 to 2 more servers.

I love my family but to be honest, they can be a bit difficult sometimes. The staff handled everyone's orders so well. Even though the restaurant was packed everyone in our group felt well taken care of by the staff.   To top it all of, everyone love their sushi. No complaint here on our end. Thank you, Jjanga family for taking care of us last night and kudos to everyone!

YvISH9TeMccd6h4y-Ly29g.text: Great spot, everything I've tried from the menu is great, and prepared with very fresh ingredients. Everyone in the staff is super friendly and helpful. Me and coworkers stop by often for lunch and they even remember our drink orders from last time we were there. Could not recommend enough.

FDDvgjrZEKgIi6vK5AFzBg.text: Their all you can eat is worth every penny. Come hungry! And don't limit yourself to just sushi. While the entire menu doesn't apply for the all you can eat price, the majority of it does and i mean it when I say that these dishes do not disappoint. Great for groups too!

NklSPTZL5LEbpLbWLEfGHA.text: We have come to this place 2 times already and it is amazing, we tried the sushi burger the first time and it was definitely the best thing I've tasted! This second time we finally tried their sushi and it is one of the best I've tried in Las Vegas

V5KO4BfYxSiB0CAuxvmFnw.text: The food here is amazing. The dinner includes sashimi specials and some really quality beef tataki. The happy hour specials are fair and the beer is ice cold. The desserts are decent with ice cream and mochi selections. Definitely one of our favorites when it comes to all you can eat sushi places in Las Vegas.

sZJROZ0Z1jfBc42AcXhXFA.text: This place is amazing! Some of the best sushi around. Service is always on point with super friendly staff too.

iK2htv2e3jENm1_ehibbkg.text: I came here for dinner with my husband and parents who were visiting town. I saw that Jjanga was close to my house and it had tons of good reviews and decided to go for it. My first mistake was in not realizing this place is known for AYCE. That was completely my fault for expecting higher quality food, as I know better than to expect great food from an AYCE place. But, the main reason I'm rating this place low is because of the terrible customer service.  We decided to order off the regular menu (not AYCE) since we just wanted some rolls and sashimi. We still ordered a decent amount of food with our final bill totaling around $80, just to point out that I was not being a cheapskate, but unfortunately was treated like one here. My father ordered two appetizers off the cooked menu- baby octopus and beef skewers. These two dishes came out at the very end, about ten minutes after we had finished all the other rolls we ordered. When the baby octopus came out, there were two skewers, one with 1 octopus and the other with 2. They were TINY. I thought that was weird but we already waited so long for the food, so my husband opted out and just let me and my parents have 1 each. They were incredibly overcooked and completely soaked in sauce. I seriously wish I took a picture of it.  Maybe because the service was so incredibly slow here, or because our rolls were just as mediocre as if we'd ordered AYCE (they cut the rolls thinner here, regardless if you're ordering off the regular menu and PAYING more), but I was feeling incredibly disappointed. I have never, ever asked to be comp'ed at a restaurant before. However, I used to be a hostess and I know this happens from time to time, and I figured I had a good reason for asking to be comp'ed for the octopus since they legitimately tasted terrible and were tiny. This appetizer cost $5.50. I figured no big deal. I respectfully asked the waitress if it could be removed from our bill. She then called another woman over (presumably the manager). The first thing she says is "Well you cleared the plate". Of course we cleared the plate, there were only three octopus on it and we each had ONE. She says, "There should have been 4 on the plate. You should have said something when it first came out. You cleared the plate, so..." Lol I didn't realize it was the customer's job to make sure the restaurant gives us the appropriate amount of food we're paying for? I explained that regardless, the octopus did not taste good and was overcooked/tiny. She said, "That's just how our food is made here, I can't control that". She then agreed to comp it as a courtesy, which I do appreciate. However, I would have preferred for her to respectfully decline my request instead of giving me major attitude for a $5.50 dish.  After this whole debacle, THREE separate employees came by to ask "how we were doing" (code for "get out") when the reason we were still there was because we were STILL waiting for the beef skewers to come out. Which, by the way, were just as tiny and dry as the octopus.

G77ii93t3MFcXgZZNnY12A.text: Great sushi place for large party & kid friendly. AYCE was perfect for lunch and the price too! Will definitely come back again when in the area

XCiOf5YzkPb-zPIqLHl_ZQ.text: This place is amazing! Their ayce is always a great deal but their sushi burgers are huge and delicious!! If you're here for lunch the Monkey Burrito is only $5 and worth every penny! I love this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Korean BBQ roll is freakin great!!

_icCg1ZshaPI7NtaTiSxPA.text: Love this place! Great happy hour and service! Will be coming back for the chicken hot skillets :)

fDYJ2GVA7eW05qlH7WSekw.text: I tried their AYCE sushi for lunch. Good amount of nonspicy rolls compared to most in Vegas. However I think the rice to fish ratio is a little poor, more rice than sushi. I didn't give their burritos a try based off previous reviews. The KFC was very good. Also want to mention for any sushi lovers out there, this place does not offer half rolls which is a loss in star just for that.

nSU5O4-O7zcbGXWRMLOWMg.text: We came here because it looked cool "steak and sushi" sounds like the perfect place for me, I love sushi and my hubby loves steak! So we decided to give it a try with some friends.  What we didn't know was that you can only only get steak if you do teppanyaki but you can't do all you can eat if you sit at the teppanyaki tables! Our friends wanted to do the all you can eat so the hubs unfortunately had to miss out on steak and just get sushi & apps.  Everything was very fairly priced because everything was so tiny in comparison to other sushi restaurants.  The sushi was pretty mediocre which was disappointing but the apps weren't bad.  The bench chairs they have you sitting on were super uncomfortable and run down looking kind of like the rest of the place.  We probably won't be back again there are just too many other better places in town.

fO427DikXMHL02PZw5h6IQ.text: The jjanga sushi burger was amazing! Plenty of choices. They have a very special roll wrapped in cucumber made fresh per order. All sushi rolls are $9. Price is very reasonable.

aGys3Kbvu6lU9BIyRH-IbQ.text: I tried the Bulgogi Burger with the buns deep fried and it was delicious! I would definitely come back again to try the AYCE and the rest of their Sushi burgers!

jDFCwNWLShREPaeZ4vM06w.text: We had the AYCE lunch special and ordered a ton of food. Everything we ordered was delicious and I really liked the smaller portions of the appetizers so you can try most of them without filling up. We will be back soon!

I82Rw-omlPC1-T2GCFdlzw.text: All you can eat sushi for $25! The food tasted great but the service was fairly slow.

rNmQRSH4WgCBEcAYsoagYA.text: I have no complaints on the food ,it's that rude guy with glasses that ruined my experience here.He came to our table to remind us to eat the rice on the sushi because if not we will get charged.yes!i totally understand that because that is the rule to almost if not all sushi places.when I told him its because I was diabetic,he said in a rude tone "then you shouldn't be ordering all you can eat" that's when I got pissed.he shouldn't have said anything because if we weren't able to eat the rice then charge me!because I understand the rules.it was the way he talked to me that Pissed me off.my husband talked to him and said that I got offended .he didn't even apologize to me,he just kept passing by as if nothing.when we were ready to pay ,he told my husband how he saw from my facial expression how pissed off I was so he was going to comp our dinner.my husband said you don't have to do that ,but just a simple apology would do,he just smiled (meaning he'd rather not)there was no apology and we got a discount to our dinner but all we really wanted was an apology ."that's all!!never coming back here again.that guy with glasses was so rude in the way he talked to me"

CyVuf6DMvdjznnBX2rldAQ.text: Service was impeccable. The shrimp and calamari tempura were as they should be - crispy and not at all soggy, unlike at some places. Loved the agedashi tofu - crispy on the outside and the tofu melts in your mouth. I like that you can order the rolls with brown rice instead of white, although you'd have to pay $1 extra even if you're doing AYCE. The mocktails are a good concept, esp for those that like mixed drinks but without the alcohol. The arizone sunset mocktail with added pineapple juice was awesome. For rolls, I'd recommed the Next Time roll as well as the old trusy Johnny Roll. I like that they don't try to skimp by overloading the rolls with rice. Laid back, airy, spacious atmosphere and service was quick. And I like that ESPN was on all 3 TVs! 1 star off for not offering half rolls and some of the bulgogi and dynamite was a little on the burnt side. I also wish there was no extra charge for brown rice. Other than that it was awesome.

pHWYLTxmCbPVbfQutgxsHg.text: Most of items were pretty good. The lisa hand roll is my favorite! Nice dinner and good service.

Aq5rhedwH9ps_VfdiWpK8w.text: Food and service are fantastic!  Our new favorite sushi place. We ate all you can eat, nine rolls, and all were tasty. Sunset was my favorite!

m8k480TL8dyN4J-dbI3MFw.text: This was and maybe still is my favorite AYCE sushi restaurant in town. They offer top-quality fresh fish and their menu overall tastes great. However, they have gotten pretty popular in the past years and it seems like their service have declined. The chefs used to offer us "specials" because we frequent the restaurant a lot but because they have gotten so big and busy, the service is no longer as individualized. The food quality is still the same, the last time I tried, but I wish they kept up with the service as well.

ZXsWzRh8FClCiRmJ89AVpw.text: This is the the best place for sushi in south west Las Vegas!!! Antonio is the best. Just let him pick your food. Tell him what fish you like and your golden. The gummy bear martini is amazing !!

YsMQJiB4fZm0DCBx2vXlYw.text: Jjanga does the best sushi in town.  We were frequent visitors to the original location and love this one even more since it's closer to home.  The staff are always warm and welcoming, the food is amazing and we love the vibe.

U-4DqyO7n-SW7tR7H0kWZg.text: Best sushi ever! This is literally my favorite sushi spot. Great customer service, the food is delicious, we come here all the time and they already know us. The staff is super friendly and helpful if you're not sure what to order. Try this place, you will not be disappointed!

tUvk_xclsYFFxel7zQsW0Q.text: I love this place! Food is amazing and always fresh! Staff is the friendliest I ever seen in Japanese places! Specially server Antonio is always nice! Thank you guys for your service!

UjEJ88PTl4WJbF2tbgw7-Q.text: This restaurant is not only our favorite all you can eat sushi place but it is our favorite sushi place period! They have two locations, this one and another one in Chinatown both excellent. The quality of the fish is superb. The design of the menu is innovative. They have an amazing selection of items from the all-you-can-eat menu. The service is phenomenal. Everyone there is friendly and the staff are personable, upbeat and are always offering great suggestions. You have to try the I love my Ass Roll, Q roll, Tuna Naruto, Freshman roll and the Yuzu yellowtail sushi. Oh, and you have to try the Grapefruit sake which is not on the all-you-can-eat obviously. Oh the beef Bulgogi, Gyoza and the crab balls are also a must try. The Fort Apache location closes at midnight and also has a Hibachi option and the Chinatown location I think closes around 2 AM and they also have Karaoke. So, what are you still doing reading this review? Go get in your car and go to JJANGA. Seriously, I'm not kidding.  Go already!

oEIB5VgPs_l26wm6uwLHQg.text: Honestly some of the greatest All you can eat Sushi Vegas has to offer! I came in for AYCE dinner and the service and food was so great that I had to come back in the very next day for Lunch AYCE. I've been in weekly since! The quality and freshness of the Food is outstanding. They also offer a Teppanyaki/hibachi menu and have really fun talented chefs grilling it up. This establishment is great for all occasions, from family dining and date nights, to sushi and drinks with a group of friends (btw they offer pitchers of beer). Also a huge highlight of this place is the owner Jjanga, he has to be one of the most interactive owners I have ever had the pleasure of meeting, he treats guests like family and is often one of the chefs making your sushi, and from my experiences he also has an amazing staff, it seems they got it together and work as a Team, they are all very attentive and eager to please their guests. This place has fine dining type service at a competitive AYCE price, I highly recommend this place to everyone. The Spring Mountain Roll, Taste like my ex girlfriend Roll, big easy roll it's all really really good! Mmm Yuzu Yellowtail, super white tuna, baked green muscles, oysters!!! Jeezus I need it all in my mouth!!!!!!!

NWh6L0iU0Lzdkc6wgM133w.text: This place is pretty great I wont lie. Sushi is good, and service is not too bad. however, the seating is a little uncomfortable, and awkward, because you are so close to the table next to you there is no privacy. unless you get a booth by the front door. Also the first time I went with my fiance we waited close to a hour. the second time I called to make a reservation, and the man said that they don't take reservations for parties less then five. So I guess if your on a date, there is no privacy and you have to wait an hour to be seated. not great for my taste. Speaking of taste, the sushi was awesome.. to an extent.  and I don't like my food cold, unless its ment to bee cool. the sushi we got was Luke warm and not okay because the cream cheese was too soft that the roll wasn't the right shape.  Also I believe that there should be one waiter assigned to certain tables. A lot of the time it was 3-4 different people that would come to take your plates and bring you more sushi. however, all of the employees just walk around so fast. its impossible to get their attention. which wouldn't be a problem if my table got touched every once and a while.

kOUNUQTRkCf4B2ntNBcrxg.text: Absolute best sushi in Vegas.   Came here on a friend's suggestion and they have an incredibly expansive menu, great service, and AYCE at a fair price.  10/10 would recommend to a friend - and have!

8a5N_ADl2OXT1asfc7S3Fg.text: Let me start off by saying yumm! I ordered here for the first time and was super nervous because I've never ordered sushi delivery before so I was very nervous but needed to fix my craving and didn't want to leave the house because I love to get all you can eat sushi because I eat a lot. But I love the fact that they put all the sauce on the side and they're not stingy with it because I was worried what the wet ones would look like or if they would be flipped upside down from the driver but they looked and tasted wonderful I just wish I remembered what the names were by the photos of the rolls I got because there's 2 that I will 100% be ordering again! Was sooo good I didn't want to eat it all so I can save it for later because it was sooo delicious and melted in my mouth with flavor and yumminess. The only thing was the mussels were cold and had barley anything on them. Which I was pretty sad about because that's the one thing I order everywhere and and a large quantity of them. But other than that I had a great experience and wouldn't mind getting delivery from them again.

YyVrRe_Gn8lW4mSwmwmFBw.text: I so love Facebook for showing this place to me! When the Thrillist post showed that there was something out there called SUSHI BURGERS, I knew it had to be a stop for me in Vegas! I had to see this spectacle with my own two eyes!!!!   Cool thing is, it's away from the hustle and bustle of the strip or even Freemont. Located inside of a strip mall/restaurant area, its not hard to find. I jumped out of the car and almost ran inside. Fat life.  As soon as the waiter got to the table all I wanted to know was if I could get a menu with the sushi burgers. Ain't NOTHING ELSE TO TALK ABOUT!!!!!   However, lol, we ended up getting the sushi burrito, a couple of sushi rolls ANNNNNDDDDDDD *drum roll* A SUSHI BURGER. Namely "The Karai" which is spicy tuna, crab, salmon, cucumber, lettuce and screaming orgasm sauce in between a "bun" of deep fried rice patties! When I bit into it..... sweet Asian baby Jesus - AMAZING! Maybe it was the deep fried rice patties that were fried ever so golden brown. Perhaps it was the screaming orgasm sauce that definitely made my loins warm. It could've even been the salmon that tasted super fresh. Whatever it was, if I had the room in my belly, I would've tried ALL FOUR sushi burgers.   Yes there are FOUR!   I'm quite sure that getting wasted, gambling away your first born and then getting wasted again are ALL on your list for an epic Vegas trip, but it won't be complete without this place if you are a sushi lover and foodie!

dM3hsjfrOLI_B5nE5wpRxA.text: Eh... no bueno, its not fried rice if its just rice with soy sauce. Rolls are ok regular. Try at your own risk.

GDkd9FvN16_04oiALxLvGA.text: I love this AYCE sushi restaurant! I've been here on several occasions and the food never disappoints. As a customer I know which times are best to go at because the first 2 times we went we hated the wait time. I do feel like during these busy times they should be fully staffed just because waiting 30 minutes for your appetizer to come is a little frustrating. We usually go during lunch and I've also been there for happy hour.   So, I'm giving this place 4 stars because the sushi is fresh, they have so many rolls to offer and they also have plenty veggie rolls, the price is just right, plus every time we're here, especially sitting at the bar, we have great convos with the sushi chefs.   The reason why I'm not giving this place a 5 star is solemnly because of the wait time during the busy hours but seriously this place is great and they most definitely have my business.

eLrAdlLq5uvyfEnLwCcEDQ.text: I didn't realize they have another spot close to home so I was happy to visit this place knowing full well that their location in Spring Valley is busier and smaller. The wait was just as long. We thought we beat the crowd as everyone else followed just a few minutes when we got there. Still, we had to wait an unexpected 20-30 minutes.   This is a sushi buffet which can cost up to $25 just for dinner. My girlfriend wanted to get an all you can eat thinking she'd finish everything but I was happy to have talked some senses into her. Instead, she opted for a salmon roll which only cost us $4! And vegetable tempura for $6! She couldn't even finish it with the additional $4 California roll that I got! Anyway, I'm more of the adventurous one so I got the sushi burger. I wanna say it's a lot like a sushi burrito which was a little heavy in the rice side. Also, it was a little messy to eat at the end but I used chopsticks for the rest.   The service is quick given how busy it was and the customer service was average.  Overall, it was a pleasant restaurant with cheap rolls at quality standards. I'd definitely come back here.

E61O5twfxoH27YQ4v7y0iA.text: Always a pleasure....late at night working 3rd shift this place rocks. All you can eat for 25 bucks on the full menu. A gem OFF STRIP!

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Volcano tempura shrimp.

kgA-gkz-9CWQ4GKfmcfzrw.text: Great lunch specials here! You really can't go wrong we've done all you can eat and takeout as well. Service is good but the seats get hard if you hang out for too long. Sushi is good and reasonably priced. It's close to our house and our go to for sushi these days.

UYMnRzYgFrYPUTtcJO4FeA.text: Really good sushi!   Got here @ 305pm.  It was too late for the lunch :( but thats okay! We did the AYCE for $25.  Its a decent price for the quality of the food.    We ordered from the different categories.  My favorites were the yuzu yellow tail, shrimp tempura, lemon pepper wings, and the monkey burrito.  The yuzu yellow tail was more of a palate cleanser for me because it was refreshing on the palate.  The lemon pepper wings were really crispy and just tasted so good.  I got the monkey burrito with no crab because im not a fan of imitation crab.  It was so good! I love the soy paper!!! It includes rice, daikon, tempura, and spicy tuna.  So crunchy!!!   At the end, if you do a yelp review you get a free dessert.  They ran out of the ice cream sandwich so they gave us melona.  The ayce also includes ice cream AND mochi ice cream.  Green tea ice cream is the way to go!!!!

Hi-hNfWjormxq3NMvLVSKA.text: Sushi was good but service was soooooo slow. The restaurant wasn't that busy and there were plenty of servers and sushi chefs but it took way too long to get food. They also forgot to put in several items we ordered. After about 30 mins we asked where the items were and they said there was no order for them. They also suck at refilling drinks. We only got our iced tea refilled once and only because we asked for it. Don't think I'll come back here again just based on slow service and the fact that they forget to put in order for some of your items. Seemed like most the restaurant was mostly just waiting for food to come. We did have one server with glasses that was good but the rest were super inconsistent. Nothing special here unfortunately.

avtX8Zhw7QJvUmoBDgPiQg.text: Been here many times to the point that the servers remember we are the couple that eats like pigs! I think its time I write a review. This place is amazing and has exceptional service. Very consistent with everything. Love the items on the menu that isnt the norm for sushi joints. I love how they always change up the special menu board so we can taste their memorable special items. Servers are very attentive to your every need and on point where we never had empty waters, beers, or sake as well as food! Great quality in sushi too for an AYCE place!  Every time we bring in new friends to check this place out they always want me to bring them back again ( especially those from out of town). Way to go Jjanga!

NaYm2WzEJEdzWzY-w_SmTA.text: the worst sushi ever. fishy, chewy, disgusting!!!!!! do not come here!!! everything was overcooked!!

_jvKOxeW3Jgm-X5FpfIP7A.text: The food here is great. We went a la carte and had 5 rolls including the Cajun which was the best one. We also tried the sushi tower and bulgogi burger. The Wasabi here is a little hard and takes some time to dissolve but it tastes wonderful though. Overall great experience here and not to mention they had a hibachi option as well. Food comes out quick.

0y0C_BOqf__hROqlx_GQYw.text: I had a wonderful time eating out with my mother! This place is around the corner and is absolutely amazing. The staff treated us very kindly and were very attentive. Sushi was amazing along with the appetizers. Overall an amazing experience :)
