q7gRZ7g8Fd2XD_JwLV_plA.text: Great atmosphere and friendly staff. Ordered drinks at the bar and the bartender didn't know how to make a basic drink but fixed the mistake and was super friendly about it. The food had way too much sauce on all the dishes which made it hard to enjoy the fresh sushi flavors.

rUnTi8kF6xOegbacIdWKnw.text: Ellen is awesome... She is so nice and always takes care of our Togo orders~ We never even have to double check because she always gets it right! Woop Woop!!!

-0zB8hv9rle-dFFmQH0qOw.text: I came  because I really wanted the sushi burger. This place is yummy and huge inside. They have teppan grills in the back and the sushi in the front. I like that. In case you don't know what you want you got options man. Their tuna sushi burger is yummy. It's just so pretty haha. Their poke was delish and very fresh. And that deep fried stuffed jalapeno was bomb. A little crunchy and velvet. Their seaweed salad also rocks. I would definitely be back!

fFuCNbUWvLqmD3oJ3bvh2A.text: I was here last month for a birthday lunch and have been meaning to return to check out their dinner items. Why not try it for dinner tonight? I got here with a party of 3 at 6:00pm today, and the wait was decent. The wait wasn't as bad as most AYCE Sushi places here on a Friday night. The rolls were okay and nothing too amazing, but I did in fact enjoyed the appetizers they offered. Service was great! Next time, I will have to try their popular Sushi Burgers. Since I have not had a chance to try it yet. Upon trying it, I will definitely update my review. Until then, I will have to knock some stars down due to the fact that they did not offer the half roll option. If we were able to order half rolls, this place would be a solid 4+*****

xWGXJ0l5x4X_uXXdNPDifA.text: I love this place so much. If I lived closer I would probably develop a sushi addiction and eat here everyday.  It's very clean and open when you walk in, I've always been greeted quickly. The servers are nice and unless it's very busy I've never had to wait for long for my food. My favorite sushi guy there wears a hat backward and glasses, he's the best!

vYV-jtTdluq978D_Z1BKrA.text: This place UH-MA-ZING. I can't even put into words how great this place was. We went in at around 12 noon, party of 5, the seating is wonderful, got seated right away... he recommended the lunch menu and it was PERFECT. We ordered 2 sushi burgers (Jjanga & Kaairi?)  and a Japanese lasagna, and a bento box, my sister ate the Japanese lasagna slowly because she loved it so much and didn't want it to end. I had a burger and it was AWESOME, huge, but awesome. The concept of the burger is creative and fun. If you're debating on eating here, DO IT. Prices are GOOD, food is GOOD, service is GOOD. Loved it. 10/10

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9990wYQEfG1-rgEn2ug5wA.text: Not as good as expected appetizers were delicious but rolls them selves were below average

SnRgjCwBD0o0l9WXP6RT4g.text: Sushi was really good! Nothing especially great but until I find another sushi spot, I do recommend this one!

AUZgeGOWciq4RJJUFBPHUg.text: This was a good sushi bar with fast and helpful staff. It is a clean and quite place off the beaten path.   It is nice that it caters to locals instead of all the crowds near the strip. Don't get sucked into the crowed places around town.

swa4MrQMaIqMcTUeuv-lIw.text: So one of my favorite things to eat in Jacksonville are sushi burritos from this one popular joint. I'm telling you- sushi burgers are the new sushi burritos. And I think Jjanga ruined me for the lot of them.  We decided to try one that was panko fried and one that was not. The panko-fried burger was a lot easier to eat, but both were simply amazing.  The quality of the fish itself was top-notch. And the flavors of each sushi burger were beautifully executed.  I would come back to Vegas in a heartbeat to eat some more sushi burgers!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

s_gfR3g4wHbBs1ukxl6FhQ.text: I had the AYCE sushi on 5/6/2019. I arrived at about 7:05pm. However there was no hostess at the front and I waited 3 minutes. I went to the sushi bar and sat down. I was then told I had to go back to the entrance and wait to be seated by a server! As I go back to the front entrance, the hostess finally shows up. Once, I started to order, I was getting confused as to who my server was. I was asked if I needed anything from 4 different people. Great sushi but not well organized.

50Lb8QkcoRXPwtHHd4SCpw.text: Came here today to try some sushi as we were craving it and got seated promptly. AYCE prices are decent around mid 20s for dinnner and you can order from a pretty large menu including an assortment of rolls, nigiri, and appetizers. Its not the best quality sushi but compared to a few other AYCE sushi places on the upper end of it. You get what you pay for after all so dont expect japanese imports!   Unfortunately there was one roll that had caused me some stomach problems almost immediately after i ate it so i will not be able to give such a stellar review. I cited the problem to some of the staff and although one was a bit difficult (may be due to some people complaining to get lesser prices) it was fixed a bit after by another of the staff who made sure that our time wasn't too bad and a bit more pleasant, i will likely be coming back to give it a try again because of him.

vfK_KdSJRsRTscG90F6Ymg.text: We came in the restaurant today At 2:00 pm. We ordered 4 sushi rolls We got the food after 45 minutes  Both rolls was wrong they had to change  The rolls took them 20 more minutes to bring the new rolls The food wasn't fresh the sushi rice was  Very sticky and mushy  The worse sushi I ever had!!! Don't eat in this place!!!

RnXWkRvVwuINZjSo0n00qQ.text: Oh my gosh, imagine my surprise when I found an affordable, delicious, practically gourmet-quality (imho) sushi place in Las Vegas! I'm so accustomed to this city being flooded with overpriced cuisine that focuses even more on presentation than they do the taste of their food.  Jjanga has a great balance of both. And just a warning, their other location does not have their sushi burgers/sandwiches! We went there first but then left quickly to check out this location.  The restaurant is pretty spacious, and the variety on the menu is vast. I had seen their sushi burgers/sandwiches on Instagram, and couldn't wait to give them a try. Heck with my vegetarianism! I'm flexible for special occasions.   I got their main Jjanga sushi sandwich with panko crumbs, which I can't seem to find on any of their online menus. It was fantastic! However, I didn't realize that having the panko crumbs meant it would be fried - well duh! It was crunchy on the outside and juicy on the inside, and it was huge for just $9 I believe. I could only finish half, but finished the rest that night for dinner.   We also enjoyed some sake bombs, and my husband loved all the various rolls he ordered. Next time we come to Vegas, this will be our first stop for food.

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sake bombs
Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jjang sushi sandwich fried in panko
Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jjang sushi sandwich fried in panko

8r_iJEdDfvusc7vTZ8T6Fw.text: My wife was excited to try this place, so we had dinner here last night.   When we arrived around 5:30p it wasn't too busy, we signed in because we didn't have a reservation, and we sat for maybe 5min.   Once we were seated, the server got our drinks right away, and we were ready to order.   We each had 2 rolls each. I can't remember what they were though. Overall, the sushi was good, but it was just like any other sushi place. Nothing too special.   I removed 2 stars because the service lacked when they got busy at around 6ish. I had asked for another roll, and it took them 30min, literally, 30min for me to finally receive it. My wife was about to say something because she was waiting to eat her roll until my got to the table.   With service like that, it really changed our mind about that place. We understood it got a tad busy, but make sure there's enough staff to accommodate then, especially on a Saturday night.   Would we go here again? Probably not.

a9bn1C-h7fk7lHre9HcbfQ.text: Called last night to ask when they were last seating, they said last call to order was 1:30AM. My friend and i came in at 12:30AM and no body came to get our order for 30 minutes. Then we hear the staff behind us talk about how they wanted to go home and that we should leave immediately. They didnt close until 2AM. Ordered various items of nigiri and one Cali on top roll. The roll was pretty good but nigiri came with too much rice and it was extremely vinegary that my tongue was stinging a bit. Completely overwhelmed the taste of the actual fish. We also ordered Uni, my favorite, and it tasted like dish soap. Didnt order much and couldnt get my $26 AYCE worth. Good mochi tho? Definitely not coming back here. Umiya is way 1000 times better.

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Uni tasted like dish soap, and the tobiko tasted off as well

K4yJ7Jx1d5FU3bhseh0t9Q.text: Alex and Tim are so freaking amazing!!!! Thr food is great but i will go back for sure for them!! Please come and show your love!

2OR8Vi0URM_rJV45wESNcg.text: Came here to try their sushi burgers & it's definitely the best thing EVER!!! Didn't realize how big it was going to be because in pictures it appeared to look so small but it was not & it surely did not disappoint! We also tried some items off happy hour but do need to come again for AYCE. Appreciate the dinning area, pretty spacious. We did come during lunch time so it wasn't very crowded just yet. Our waitresses were so welcoming and made sure we were taken care of.

vVZZ3m0i3vLdIQYuCtsynQ.text: This review is for the AYCE sushi only.  We arrived around 9:30pm on a Saturday and had to wait for about 10 minutes.  The menu is quite extensive, and everything on the menu is included with the AYCE; however, there are some items marked in red, which means only one order of that item is allowed per person.  The fish was good for AYCE sushi.  The wait staff comes often enough to ask if you would like more.  The policy written on the menu states that people will be charged for food not eaten so it's best to order a little at a time.  Of course, our first order was a good amount, but then each subsequent request only was what we were sure we could finish.  After placing an order, the sushi comes pretty quickly.  I would return to eat here again.

IDHWXllYopqYHA7yTJb__A.text: Favorite sushi place hands down! Food is always fresh and consistent. We always do AYCE when we come here because of the great selection and it's in a convenient location. We will continue coming back to this location and highly recommend!

mf1zeQ8eWzmVhR-mwNhzuQ.text: Horrible service waited 30 minutes to get no food after ordering would not recommend going here not to mention whenever we got the food it wasn't that good  They also called me names

OJXVgv2T9sEFQ3s2vHt3vw.text: So far I'll stick with 4 stars.  I've only ordered take out once and that was to try one of their SUSHI BURGERS!  I tried the one with Salmon.  They call it Karai Sushi Burger.  It was huge.  I couldn't capture the same burger they have on their IG page but it was huge and good.  Very different.  Pictures of the salmon burger showed more salmon in it, but when I got mine, it seem like I had a spicy tuna burger.  The salmon was in the burger but I found it in the middle. Overall it was a 3/5 stars.  Like a roll just with the goodness between Panko rice buns.  I would still like to try the other burgers.   In general, I like Jjangas menu because I've been to their sister restaurant so I'm a fan already.

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon Sushi Burger

Go_Ud8T05KMnkXNvgqbbYg.text: We went to this place on a Sunday afternoon for their sushi burgers.  Service was great but the restaurant is kept very cold which wasn't the most enjoyable thing.  We were pleasantly surprised that the sushi burger for lunch was only $9.95 and you can add fries for extra $3. The burger is huge. I ate it about 7 hours ago and I am still full. It is a bit messy once you start eating it which is expected but the taste was worth the mess.

photos.caption: Photo of Jjanga Steak & Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-Sxw7dKtdWAmsp-MUbjpjw.text: Great food!! We come here all the time. It is usually busy especially on weekends. More people come in for sushi when we visit. We've had both sushi and hibachi and they are equally tasty.

375d8Fx_bsqoQwQmAV0Y5Q.text: I noticed that this place would be a 50/50 shot based on the reviews. One review would say it's amazing and the next would say not very good. I should have listened to the other reviews and skipped this place. I ordered takeout and none of the rolls I got really wowed me. The yellowtail tasted fishy so I didn't eat it. Everything was just pretty much sub par. I would have rather spent a few extra dollars to get better quality somewhere else.

D_uD5TA6yhH5IR9SbSBrcA.text: I think I must have come here on an off night. The five star ratings on this place are awesome and I was excited to try it. Not sure if I can come back.  It was just the 2 of us and the place was pretty empty so we were seated right away. I would say there were maybe 3 other tables in the whole restaurant. The waiter came up after 5 minutes and took our order and drink order. We only ordered 2 Kirin Light beers. But we did order a bunch of sushi.   The waiter came back with some water and then he turned around and started giving us our sushi from the sushi bar. We ordered around 10 items and they pretty much came all at once. That is fine but where is our beer???  The waiter never came back-- I had to get another waitress to come by, I asked her where our beers were. It didn't really matter at this point because we had already finished out entire meal. I mean the restaurant was not busy and they could not serve us 2 beers? That's a problem.   The fish was not fresh at all and the pieces were so small. I have never seen pieces this small before. It was very strange. I have been to many AYCE sushi places and I was also surprised that they did not put avocado in the rolls. They either left it out or put carrots.   When we finally got the bill they ended up charging us for the 2 beers. I thought it was kind of rude to do that since they didn't even bring them until we were finished with our meal. The whole point was to enjoy the beer while eating the sushi. Overall I was not impressed with this place and will probably not come back. I like my sushi to be fresh and I didn't get that here.

SDzDw_3a4iw0vOp1hDFJiQ.text: I am currently in Jjanga and am in a party of 10. The service we have received is absolutely terrible. They are messing up half of our orders, majority of us have had a ridiculous wait time just for them to make our food and our server is not listening to anything we need. The chefs definitely did not make what we asked our server for. They are still getting our orders and what we have asked for wrong! Definitely will not be returning here.

W-ltovW4WTKgdYG0lXxfJw.text: The sushi was great many choices for all you can eat and very good price . Loads of choices.

hYwM6fDp0Nw14IcPgivNRA.text: I don't post many reviews less than 4 star rating, but my experience here was just horrible! I flew in from Austin late Thursday, July 12th . After flight being delayed 2 hours and not arriving till 10 I was starving. I found this late night sushi spot on yelp with amazing reviews and interesting food. Took an Uber and arrived about 11:30 pm right before their late night rush I guess. I was promptly seated but after being seated it went all down hill.   A waiter who I never saw again took my initial order and I asked to keep the menu so I could see what else I wanted. 15 min later and not even appetizer or the man coming back to see if i wanted to add to my order.  20 min in, I watched newly seated people, with groups ranging from 2-4 people get their food first! I'm here at 12am, visiting Vegas, alone and I'm being ignored.   A man finally came and asked me if I needed anything or was waiting and I told him what I was waiting on and how I wanted to add something .   I gusss my other waiter got off and just forgot about me all entirely . Once I recited my sushi burrito 40 min into my dining experience. I devoured it! And don't get me wrong, it was good.. but hey where Is my appetizer ... where is my bulgogi.. wheee is my sushi roll?     My new waiter apologized and checked - I guess they lost my sushi roll order and so I had them cancel. The bulgogi was meh, nothing special. I don't even remember the appetizer I ordered because the dinning experience it self just bugged the hell out of me.   Great prices, decent food I'm sure and trash service .   I'll stick to eating on the strip next time and saving a $20 uber ride

DrDGsZ6O7JCVIuY1ZGo7qw.text: This is my favorite sushi place of all time! It's a MUST every single time I'm in Vegas! The food here is incredible. If you love trendy fusion, this is the place for you! My favorite here is the sushi burger, but I also love their sushi tacos, and sushi pizza. The staff here is super friendly! The chefs are amazing, and on my last visit, they went out of their way to make a special dish for me! It was so beautiful I almost felt bad eating it! I rave about this place to everybody I know and tell them they must visit whenever they're in Las Vegas- that's how much i love it! Thank you Jjanga restaurant & staff, you guys are wonderful!

The staff make me feel like family and I feel comfortable. The wait can get long at times but just hop over to the bar and enjoy a drink while you are waiting :)

IdSwMe1pT-fYSI1ONUNcxA.text: I have been going to jjanga sushi for a few years now and it has never failed to satisfy. The service is always great the servers are always super nice and attentive. The menu has a good verity of sushi rolls and it's an overall great environment to eat at.

5GyyNF2V6-VywyQ-9s24pA.text: I was SO excited to try this place. I live 30 mins away, and kept on seeing really yummy food so I made the drive. It was lunch time and we sat down, I waited a good 10 minutes for my first order which was only: miso soup & fried fish. Had to wait another 6-7 minutes to order more food (I ordered AYCE). I'm waiting 20 minutes for food! I finally waived at the server to ask for the check and he tells me upon giving me the check that health inspection came in and they couldn't make anymore food. I understand, and that's fine, since I know the health department does random check ins, but where is the COMMUNICATION with your customers?!? They made me wait 30 mins. Sigh, so sad my first time had to be like this. Def probably will never come back, so many other sushi/hibachi places with better staff.   *update*  The manager did comp our next dinner here. The service was great and food came out yummy! Whenever I am on that side of town I will definitely be back. Thank you!

QamSYP_n9Z_qKXRsrJUBuQ.text: Long story short, this is a good place for AYCE sushi and some other kinds of dishes, BUT don't come here expecting significantly high quality cuisine. So if you are extra sensitive to particulates in the air and somewhat smokey odors, you might have an uncomfortable time breathing here.  The fish quality is satisfyingly good here, but the preparation/presentation is a tragedy. The nigiri here would make Jiro Ono's head explode.   So, their sushi is ugly, but still a place worth checking out.

wWQfx9YGJDG4VEJ7xFXwcA.text: Good food. Slow service. Not a very extensive menu. A good amount of items were not on the AYCE menu. Lunch AYCE menu is different from the dinner AYCE menu (less items to choose from, unless you pay the dinner price). We were there for over an hour just waiting and waiting for our food. No one checked on us, we had to ask the bus boy to get our waiter so we could order multiple times. I will probably not go back there again. Turned off by the slow service.

DNowH-wSnM8rIXbSYmzjvw.text: It's probably needless to write a review for 4 star Jjanga. The large crowd last night entices me to limit any further exposure, but having eaten my body weight in sushi over multiple visits, I have to throw my 2 chopsticks in. Best service of any sushi restaurant in town! The hosts and staff go out of their way to accommodate with a smile and great attitude. There is a sushi section and teppanyaki/hibachi section. Atmosphere: High Energy club-like vibe ALL YOU CAN EAT. This is the only way we do sushi...why limit yourself to a la carte when you can unlock the entire menu for $25.95 (dinner 3pm-2am) or $20.95 (lunch 11:30-3pm) Get a carafe of GRAPEFRUIT INFUSED SAKE to share, you might even want 2. Refreshing, cold with citrus accents and the perfect way to start your night or compliment your sushi. Sushi: our friend said it best when describing the freshness..."I know it's fresh when you can't tell the kind of fish, it just melts in your mouth." That is how good Jjanga's sushi is. FAVORITES: Something Special: calamari tempura, crab wrapped in cucumber topped with eel sauce. Light and doesn't fill you up with rice. Ask for RAYU sauce...sesame, chili infused oil...dip everything in it...especially the Garlic Tuna. You're welcome. The Cheese Croquettes are a must try. Crispy warm fried cheese topped with a creamy sauce. Don't knock it til you try it...it surprised us. Something Wrong 69: A roll where one side starts with salmon and ends on tuna with shrimp tempura on both ends. Did I mention the RAYU sauce? Love that stuff. Oysters: fresh and perfect for shooting. (Limit one per AYCE guest) Screaming Orgasm: delicious but needed more sauce. (Limit one per AYCE guest) Bulgogi : this is the only sushi place that I know who has sizzling Bulgogi on a fajita plate...awesome! To finish your meal, you have to leave room for the Chocolate Malted Crunch Ice Cream. They freakin have Thrifty's ice cream for dessert! This is now our sushi place. I'd appreciate it if you didn't come here on Saturday nights :)

Got two AYCE, and lots of drinks.. bill was $120. The sushi was typical, like all the other places, but we wanted to drink a little too. The server recommended some type of sake, we downed the whole thing and no buzz. Tasted like juice. Ordered more drinks from the bar, VERY watered down, still nothing... isn't that illegal? Even showed the waitress AND bartender the drink we wanted, Vegas car bomb, with ingredients and everything.... STILL GOT IT WRONG. Tasted like juice. Forgot the whiskey. Neither one of us felt ANY type of buzz. What a waste of time. I will VEHEMENTLY sway others away from this place and dispute the charge on my credit card, because this place is a scam.

cLbjMCXy5km_TVhXj5xMeQ.text: This is the second time my boyfriend and I have been to Jjanga in two weeks. I think this will be our first stop for sushi from now on. The service is wonderful! We are always greeted with enthusiasm and a smile and it stays that way throughout the night.   Originally, we decided to try to place on the fact that it was open and it was close to my house. The second time we chose it because of the service, quality of the sushi, and the happy hour that starts at 11pm-1pm. They give you lunch AYCE pricing instead of dinner for those couple of hours. Also, just a small fact- you can get classic rolls (8 pieces) for only 3.00 without AYCE.   Everything we get is delicious. Not bland, boring, etc. So worth it. We will be coming back for more.

I like the rice portion, its not too much.. 2. They have freshest oyster you could ever had a Las Vegas 3. The food portions are perfect. 4. Food came out fast during dinner service. 5. The best garlic tuna  I wish they also have hamachi kama and soft shell crab that will make my rating over 5 stars Lol. But other than that, I will surely come back as this restaurant is very close to my house.

nlb6NE9QLiG7Vx7Vx0NR8Q.text: After hearing so much good things about this restaurant, we decided to celebrate our daughter's 8th Birthday here. It was a Friday evening, so a bit busy on the AYCE sushi side.   Upon arrival we were greeted. Nice atmosphere, music a bit loud. Other than that, it's a good place. I would have liked to give this restaurant 4 stars, because really our food was tasty and our chef was the bomb.   The cons. We waited about 20 minutes for our dinner to even begin, which we had our kids ages 18, 16, our 8 year old Birthday girl and our toddler son who is 2. Try telling your young ones, the food will be coming shortly or even our appetizers, which never came until we asked about it. By this time our entrees were being cooked, but our son had fell asleep before he could even eat anything. Our waitress never came by to refill our drinks or even ask if we needed anything or asked if we were ok. Pisses me off I had to leave a tip for such bad service, but our chef Joshua did an outstanding job with our food, that we decided to tip 16% If he hadn't made us laugh and did an awesome job, I would have left a $5 tip and a piece of my mind on that receipt.   Management needs to talk to staff and make sure their employees are well trained. Our waitress passed us by a handful of times, never once asking if we were good. There's no excuse to be treated this way. She was later relaxing with others by the bar. To me, this is totally unprofessional. If you're done with work, LEAVE. I could be opinionated, because the fact that we spent so much and still left a tip, makes me so angry. This wasn't our first choice, but since so much friends highly recommended it and it's 5 minutes from our place, we decided to give it a try. Not sure if we'd give this place another try, but the food is good and Chef Joshua or Blaze (same guy) was awesome. For us or I speak for myself, first impressions of a food establishment say a lot. Too bad our first experience here, wasn't as great as our friends. Hands down to the waitress that picked up our waitresses slack tho.

NEmhUKwDF0YuH7ENROQhbA.text: Great value and incredible taste. Portions are perfect for being able to try many things. All thumbs up.

XlE-ZwhN7yQYcwfdbDfrgQ.text: This was our favorite place and we have been going there since it was open. I am allergic to seafood, but my husband loves it and I get vegetarian rolls. The only catch is they have to use a clean knife and cutting board, so I always let them know when I order and order my rolls all at once in the beginning so I'm out of the way. This time they said they couldn't wash a knife and cutting board for me so they couldn't serve me. I explained we have been coming here for years frequently and it has never a problem. They said they were sorry but the chef wouldn't serve me. I'm also 5 months pregnant, so despite the allergy I couldn't risk cross contamination due to food poisoning risk to the baby. So if you are vegetarian or vegan, that means you will have fish on your veggie rolls too since they won't clean between making other types of rolls. Unfortunately we can never go back. We are very disappointed.

-QP_yEO4PyJD5NkGGfA7SA.text: Want some super tasty and delicious looking sushi? Then look no further! They have an amazing array of rolls that taste orgasmic. Even when it's packed they still have fast service and bring out the rolls pretty quickly, although you better make sure there isn't a line because it does get packed.  Highly recommend the Baby Octopus, Threesome Roll, Kiss of Fire and Spider Roll to start.

The food was served in a timely manner and it was delicious. I would recommend getting the sushi burger with the regular buns..getting the panko style is like eating hard rice; it holds up pretty well until the last few bites. Definitely will come back here next time.

RfaRkUa97xfR7XupAmofHA.text: This location is one of my sushi heavens!  They have a variety of sushis to choose from and a good amount of appitizers to pair with your sushi rolls.  You can't go wrong with their all you can eat with is really priced affortably.  Lunch is till 3PM for about $20 and dinner after 3PM for about $25.  The atmosphere is relaxing,  nothing too fancy, but just a comfortable place to be.  The tables are spaced out perfectly considering how big you will feel after eating way more than you should have lol.  They have the tempenyaki grills at night which I still need to try. They have the usual dessert of assorted ice cream and mochi ice cream.  Here's a little tip,  there is a small blackboard at the bar with specials, check it out for any special dessert.  They usually have the melona bars that aren't on the menu.  But ask for one and if they have any you score!  I would have given them a 5 star but the service was really slow to the point you are questioning your self and are pretty sure you put your order in.  And a few times they brought us someone else's order and took our orders to other tables.  But other than today this place is awesome and usually give great service.

KIjLtbRuHastdDCxVJ9XTQ.text: I came here for my birthday back in January and came back again in the summer for another celebration. The food is delicious, but sometimes it can get a little busy depending on the day (they are that good). It can be hard if you have large parties to get serviced quickly so please keep that in mind, the staff there do their best. The only reason I am doing 4/5 stars is because my order was incorrect or forgotten a few times and I did have to remind them. But again, they were at a busy time so I understand that too. Let's talk food. If you like AYCE or Hibachi this is definitely the place to be. They have amazing sushi burritos (Monkey and Superman are tasty). Oh and if you like spicy rolls try out the XXX and Red Rock rolls. Overall the sushi, hibachi, and desserts were really good. For the desserts, the green tea mochi was really good. If you are doing the Hibachi, the Jjanga special is a good portion and has an amazing combination of meats.

sTgTQHJ2R-tVtwzyxdkw8w.text: Always been a big fan of Jjanga and his work over at his original location down on Spring Mountain Rd. I heard through the grapevine that he had expanded and had opened a second restaurant over on the west side. Even more intriguing was the fact that he had taken over Kanji restaurant, which was known for it's teppanyaki. A group of us headed over to check out his new place recently, and suffice to say, it's all good... in the hood!  Jjanga is located on the west side over near Fort Apache and Warm Springs. They have taken over the space that was formerly known as Kanji Steak and Sushi. But, they have retained the teppanyaki at this location, so even if you are not in the mood for sushi, you can get your onion volcano fix here. The interior is definitely very cool and classy. It's probably one of the more upscale sushi spots here in town. If you do go the teppan route, that side of the restaurant is very fun and exciting.  But oh, let me talk to you about the sushi, because it is something that you should definitely not miss out on. Jjanga (and also a different restaurant) is in my top two favorite ayce sushi spots in Vegas. He uses a lot of fresher product than most other places, and he would not be willing to send out anything that isn't up to his standards. The cuts of fish used on the nigiri are thick, and the rice portions are small. That's a big plus for me. And, the rice is cooked really well here. I'm not personally a big fan of rolls, but Jjanga does make some good ones. My group ordered some, and I was able to sample a few, and in conclusion, they were really good, with all the flavors balancing out with each other (and also, Jjanga probably makes the best salmon skin hand roll in town).  A lot of people take apps for granted when they go to a sushi restaurant. I would urge you to not look over the apps at Jjanga, because you would be missing out. Because the same care and quality he and his chefs put into the sushi, the same great quality and care is being put into the appetizers. The first thing you must order is the golden scallop. A thick, meaty, whole scallop that is lightly battered, and simply fried. It's a great way to start your meal. The baby octopus is a textural sensation, with the chewiness of the octopus, offsetting with the crispiness in the preparation. And do save yourself room for an oyster. That would be the icing on the cake! But try all the apps, i'm sure you won't be disappointed.     Jjanga has been killing it at his original location and it only makes sense for him to expand due to the growing popularity. The skill, the eye, the level of detail, and the caring for his guests are without question. No doubt I will be back and I always bring people here who want some great quality sushi from a great chef. Thanks Jjanga!!

There were a few items that were good, I appreciated the fact that they served Inari which not a lot of AYCE places carry but nothing really stood out. It could be that it was Valentines and it was hectic but that really shouldn't matter though. I don't know if I'll be back as there are a lot of better AYCE places in town.

ja9ec4ZUAwTuZArvcOpUVQ.text: My bf and I came here for dinner on a Saturday night. The place was busy but not packed. We were seated immediately in the sushi section. Our waitress greeted us promptly and asked for our drink order. We decide on the house flavored sake - white peach. We placed our nigiri order and sat for a few minutes. Our sake came soon and it was delicious. Would definitely recommend the flavored sake they make. Our nigiri orders started coming to the table in about 10 min. The food was all very fresh. I love that they don't smother the fish with a ton of rice. The presentation of the food was pretty typical for sushi. The ambiance of the restaurant is family friendly with half the restaurant having hibachi. The service was wonderful. We had the wait staff stopping and making sure we were doing alright and if we wanted to place any more orders. Overall, very happy with my visit. The food was great and the service was wonderful. Will definitely be coming back again.

XP7Cxj7tpZIYaM7QY-cdtQ.text: Let me start off by saying that I love this place and this review only reflects this visit. Only reason I'm giving 2 stars instead of zero is the sushi chefs. The service was absolutely horrible tonight! We didn't get any refills on the sodas, all the appetizers took forever to come out and my girlfriend ordered her miso soup and house salad twice and never received it! The servers were not courteous at all. I think I'll only go to the decatur location from now on.  I'm very disappointed in Jjanga tonight

vKvlaNkxRJT798CwKsdUuQ.text: Absolutely amazing night food, and service! I am a fan of Blaze and Tony!! They make you feel so welcomed, and comfortable, which is very important to me especially when they are the ones preparing your food! I am a fan of the three some, and who's your daddy! They have fun creative names and it makes dinner become and experience.
